NAME: Louise Audrieth
CONTENT: A fairy tale for grownupsIn the Heart of the Linden Wood by Ekta R. Garg is a captivating yet serious story of heartbreak, danger, and magic set in a fantasy kingdom governed by a young king troubled by his own… વધુ personal issues.After suffering a devastating loss, he is challenged to not only defend his kingship, but come up with a solution to save the very life-blood of his kingdom, the Linden trees.Each character in this book deals with his or her own personal problems that somehow link to the greater problems they are tasked with solving. Ekta kept me wondering as the characters behave in sometimes unexpected ways to deal with their challenges. The final solutions arrive, if they do arrive, in unexpected ways as well.The book is a delight to read and a satisfying fairy tale complex enough for a grown up!

Ask your favorite bookstore to order… વધુ them, order individually from Amazon as listed below, or get all six of his books at https://www.amazon.com/s?k=roscoe%20champion&i=stripbooks...-- VIGNETTES - Do you remember playing “Horsey” with your child gleefully astraddle your back? Do you recall the magic and mystery of smiles, a dandelion’s rage to live, or times of quandary in your life? You’ll find them all in “Vignettes” - a collection written by the insightful poet, Roscoe Champion, This prolific author has produced a… વધુ

NAME: Shoshi Kadosh
CONTENT: Where the Lilacs Bloom Once Again by Roni Rosenthal, was the first book I read in 2023, and I just can’t let it go. This book mesmerized me and even two weeks later I find myself still thinking about it. Do you… વધુ know the feeling?It may be because of my own Jewish-Romanian roots, or because of this new stage of life I found myself, but this book really opened my eyes and helped me see the world differently.This morning I saw on the author’s FB page that the book already won 6 book awards!Turns out I'm not the only one who thinks so...Does anyone have any connections to Steven Spielberg or Netflix? This book must become a movie!*The photo is from the Author’s FB page. I’m just reposting it here for you. I hope it's okay#Netflix #netflixseries #netflixmovies #StevenSpielberg

NAME: Susan Henkel Schofield
CONTENT: Here is what I read in January.  My favorite was Hello Beautiful - it was such a moving family story.  Just Cronin fans will not be disappointed in The Ferryman - it’s another epic and unique novel.  The Golden… વધુ Spoon and Everyone in My Family Has Killed Someone were both very entertaining mysteries.  The Drift was a great thriller with some surprising twists.  Vote First or Die was an informative and enjoyable book about the New Hampshire primaries.  The Bandit Queens was good but I didn’t love it.  And I did not like The Things We Do To Our Friends at all. Hello Beautiful - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Ferryman - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Golden Spoon - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Everyone in My Family Has Killed Someone - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Drift - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Vote First or Die - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Bandit Queens - ⭐️⭐️⭐️1/2 The Things We Do To Our Friends - ⭐️⭐️

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: THE FALL OF MARIGOLDS is about two women connected by a beautiful scarf sprinkled with marigolds whose stories are 100 years apart who both survive two unspeakable tragedies in New York’s history - The Triangle… વધુ Shirtwaist Fire in 1911 and the terrorist attacks on 9/11. I loved this book that has a nice mix of historical fiction and current history, along with a beautiful love story. The 1911 story took me to the hospital located on Ellis Island and into New York City at the time that my grandparents would have immigrated from Europe. Susan Meissner tells a wonderful story linking the two devastating events across time periods and reminds us of the power of resiliency in the face of loss. Highly recommend for book clubs! CONTENT: SOUND FAMILIAR?"Two days after Christmas, Ann-Helén Laestadius found herself being gently pummeled by reindeer.Taking advantage of the bluish glow that passes for daylight in Sweden’s far north at that time of… વધુ year, she had left her parents’ cozy kitchen and driven to the corral where her cousin keeps his herd during winter. She was there for a photo shoot, but first, she had to help feed the animals, extracting half-frozen tufts of lichen from a mesh sack as the reindeer jostled her impatiently. Even after a close brush with the pointy end of an antler, she looked on them indulgently.“For the Sámi,” Laestadius said, referring to the Indigenous group of which she is a member, “Reindeer are… વધુ

NAME: Christeen Fayek
CONTENT: Two sisters, one reads the last page of the book first and one who likes to go in knowing as little as possible. Two different lives but bounded by sister's enteral love. One who used to play the protector and… વધુ one who tries to deliver a message of independence. A story full of emotions and career ambitious, full of life and choices, full of fate and decisions. Amazing book to read and absorb. One of my lovable quotes (Maybe love shouldn’t be built on a foundation of compromises, but maybe it can’t exist without them either. Not the kind that forces two people into shapes they don’t fit in, but the kind that loosens their grips, always leaves room to grow. Compromises that say, there will be a you-shaped space in my heart, and if your shape changes, I will adapt. No matter where we go, our love will stretch out to hold us, and that makes me feel like . . . like everything will be okay.)

If you want to explore how much money can do, how much soul can be destroyed, how much strength you need to survive you need this book!  Made me sad, mad and crazy! How dear world be so cruel???

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: All Fall Down by Jennifer Weiner What a brilliant book! I feel guilty that took me too long to to actually finish this book. It stayed on my TBR list for a while and I always find a reason why not now. Partly… વધુ because the reviews wasn't so promising, partly because it's wasn't psychological thriller, partly no reason.  Good job I actually added this book to my A-Z challenge as I finally did it!  One more time proves that I can't trust negative reviews! I absolutely loved it!  This is a book about addiction, intelligent addiction or successful persons addition who thinks that everything is under control!  Made me look to the situation from different angle! In my work I am meeting people with addiction but I never knew how they feel, what's happening in their minds! I definitely recommend this book to anyone who fall in trap or knows someone who could be in the trap!  Definitely good book! Highly recommend!

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: 3.5 stars for HESTER-Laurie Lico Albanese.  The first 50% was very slow and repetitive... it picked up after and although the idea and theme is excellent..there was something lacking. I just couldn't get into the characters...they seemed superficial to me..although the husband and lover did give me a 'punch'. All in all readable, well written and I… વધુ would recommend it..although I don't think I'll read more by this author. Please read the authors note..it clarifies quite a lot. May I add that the note at the beginning on 'synesthesia' is very interesting but not well developed in the book. #Review

CONTENT: Mind blown 🤯🤯🤯 Might be the most thought provoking book I’ve ever read. I finished it late last night and I’m still thinking about it and trying to unpack all the feels. I feel like this will be one that stays… વધુ with me. Is redemption possible for someone who has done truly despicable things? Such a very nuanced question. And I love that this book didn’t even try to answer that or steer you anywhere. It just laid it all out and let’s you answer the question yourself if answering that question is even possible.

CONTENT: "A murder and a case of mistaken identity brings the police to Hannah Elias’ glitzy, five-story, twenty-room mansion on Central Park West. Shedding her past, Hannah slips on a new identity before relocating to New York City to become as rich as a robber baron. NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: The Golem And The Jinni-Helene Wecker  What a surprising book. I was doubtful when I started and it took a while to start getting the message...especially lonliness....but I couldn't put it down and each of the… વધુ characters started developing their own important place in the book. A mixture of Jewish, Muslim  and Christian without going into depth about religion but tracing their ways of life between Syria and New York and all interacting at the beginning of the last century.  Fantasy,history and some discreet romance....together with a powerful spiritual message.  Maybe it's not a book for all, but I'm not easy to please and it's definitely left me thinking.  4 Stars as I wouldn't call it a masterpiece although well written..and the ending leaves plenty of room for the sequel, The HiddenPalace.  The Golem and the Wizard are truly wonderful characters. Well they all are really. I do recommend it. Afterword...I don't recommend the sequel a real let down for me #Review #

Although it is hard finishing great books, I look forward to finding more.

CONTENT: I've read several books by Celeste Ng, and really enjoy her writing style. She creates interesting, real characters that are easy to relate to, and reveals the everyday flaws that many families deal with. This was one of her earlier novels I believe.

NAME: Tara Eakin
CONTENT: I am currently reading the ARC of  Looking For Jane Heather Marshall’s debut novel. This is a masterpiece, it is a very personal read for me which deeply resonates with me on a personal level. I finished the… વધુ book on January 3, I would like to thank NetGalley and Atria Books for the ARC copy of Looking for Jane.  Heather Marshall’s debut novel is a Masterpiece of Historical Fiction. The story is told from various timelines and flows seamlessly together. I couldn’t turn the pages fast enough to see what was going to happen next.  I could not put this book down, be prepared to stay up late into the night reading.  “I loved the story”and it even had an unexpected twist at the end of the story.  Highly recommend #LookingForJane #simonandschuster #HeatherMarshall #historicalfiction #booklover

CONTENT: I finished!  The Mess series by Kiersten Modglin  And I loved it 💕 A lot of love, heart break, adrenaline, secrets and forgiveness. My favourite was first one as I love good love stories 💕  I love how book by book everyone got their well deserved closure.

NAME: Trisha Power
CONTENT: Of women and Salt by Gabriela Garcia.  I absolutely loved this one.  5 women 1 child , 2 families, set between Cuba, Mexico and Miami.  Spanning 4 generations of women covering war, domestic violence,… વધુ immigration, addiction, loss and much more but at the core of this story is the relationship between mothers and daughters and the complexity that goes with it.  It’s heartbreaking and uplifting at the same time

NAME: Lopez Gloria
CONTENT: Next book. Audiobooks have made reading much more enjoyable because it's been hard to hold a book for a long time. And of course it is convenient for on the go ☺️

NAME: Trisha Power
CONTENT: Empty Houses by Brenda Navarro.  This mornings quick read.……… except it wasn’t that quick I kept having to leave it down as I had to digest it as it was disturbing.   This is the story of a little boy who go… વધુ abducted from the playground, but the book is not about the boy , it’s about his mother and the very honest account of ‘being in her head’ in the aftermath. it’s also about the woman who takes him who is clearly ill and in an abusive relationship and what it’s like to be in her head.  While  I had to finish it, I didn’t enjoy it but I don’t think anybody could……, it is however a good book,  I think it will be in my head for a while

CONTENT: To be fair I would like to give this novel 2,5 stars the reason why because Sometimes I feel like I want to get my money back other times I feel like it worths reading . that is not mean it is that bad But… વધુ there is no thrilling along the whole story and I think it is not my reading type as well .. But I think I like the overall concept which is about how it is important to respect your children’s choices and wishes even though you have a gut about the consequences and whatever their decisions come to be  .. NAME: Regina Carlton
CONTENT: Review: Wahala by Nikki May - This book is about three great girlfriends, each with their own personality and lifestyle, who have a new comer join their closeknit group. I'm sure you can relate with one of these ladies: one who wants to be happily married with kids; one who has a husband and beautiful child but feels unfulfilled; one who has the… વધુ perfect lifestyle and glamour but hides a secret from her husband. In comes trouble, Isobel, who at first seems like the perfect fit to their friendships. But then things start falling apart for all the girlfriends. You'll keep reading this with interest in what could happen next with a surprise ending. This book brought a lot of conversation to our Book Club.

NAME: Karen Stenberg Bruyere
CONTENT: So way back in the day I seem to remember that I liked Alex Cross books by James Patterson.  Lord, I must have been desperately  escaping from work/life or something. I've attempted to read other James Patterson books without much success in the past,  but I just seem to remember the Alex Cross series as decent.  I have read that most of Patterson'… વધુs  books are based on his story idea with other writers actually doing the writing. Thus many books with two authors listed on the cover.  Anyway, back to Alex Cross. I like books about the same characters, so decided to read the series. They are truly atrocious. Poor grammar and poorly written.  Cliche comments. Ridiculous characters and story plot.   A lot of blonds with piecing blue eyes. Gratuitous violence.  The audibles also have some very white sounding guys trying to narrate for a black character. Uffda! Not good.  Sorry. Thanks for listening to my rant. I think I'm just surprised at the popularity of this drivel. I need a new series. I also think I was remembering the Alex Delaware character by Jonathon Kellerman.

CONTENT: I just finished this. This was certainly out of my normal 'wheelhouse' of historical/cultural fiction and even the more secular self-help I've been reading more recently. NAME: Mark Swt
CONTENT: IF YOU FANCY SOMETHING A BIT DIFFERENT FOR VALENTINE'S DAY ...Try 'Red Wine and Dark Chocolate', a cutting-edge short story collection by Buck Starmer. Much of Starmer's work is edgy for its explicitness,… વધુ frankness, and deeply perceptive critique of human nature and the society people have built around them. This particular example seems appropriate to proffer as an alternative to Valentine's Day and all the commercial hogwash that generally goes with it.Red Wine and Dark Chocolate is a collection of short stories about the dark side of love and what the consequences may be when, for whatever reason, love goes wrong. These are dark tales from a dark mind that at times border more on the… વધુ

NAME: Shoshi Kadosh
CONTENT: Now it’s my turn to give back. I am blown away by this book. It's thought-provoking and powerful. What a story! The book is set in Romania in the 1920s and the author takes us through a true and compelling tale… વધુ of World War II Romanian family. The main character, Friddie, is a strong, independent and beautiful young woman, who we first meet as a spoiled and demanding teenager, but needs to make life-changing decisions in order to survive in the hostile Nazi world. The book title: "Where the lilacs bloom once again" Author: Roni Rosenthal This is a real page-turner! Add it to your must-read list.

NAME: Lori Baff
CONTENT: Wishing you all a happy and healthy new year! I am thinking there is a little bias against people who choose audio books over hand held books or reading on a device, kinda like those of us who choose audiobooks are having a lesser  experience when we choose audiobooks.   For me, enjoying a book, whether by listening or reading, is all about… વધુ learning, experiencing, feeling, and growing, and being a slightly better person for the experience.   I have always been a person who is an auditory learner.  When I listen to an audiobook, I feel I am very present and attentive with the book.  I am not cleaning the house or multi-tasking.  Sometimes I am out in nature.  Why is there this prejudice against people who prefer audiobooks?  We are committed and present even though we don’t have the book in hand.   I would love to hear back from you.  Thank you!

NAME: Stephanie Kaileen Hidalgo
CONTENT: I wanted to share a neat author encounter I had a couple years ago. When my son was in 6th grade his English teacher sent out an email of things the students could do for extra credit. I was reading this out… વધુ loud to my son when I came across a meet and greet/book signing with Orson Scott Card and my husband's ears perked up. My husband is a huge enders game series fan as well as Orson Scott Card fan. We decided to attend and my husband bought Orson's new book A town divided by Christmas. What was really cool is the kid who Ender is based off of was there that night and we got to meet him too. My husband was fan girling soooo hard lol. We had just had a baby in July and she was quietly sleeping on my shoulder. After the QandA Orson says if you have tiny littles you get to go to the front of the line so the children don't get tired of being there and we had the smallest of the kids so we were first. He signed our book. In my husband's he wrote "This is the first copy of this book I ever signed." It was a pretty neat experience and I'm sure my husband will never forget it.

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: This was the original portrait depicted on the book The Marriage Portrait-Maggie O'Farell.  A just 4 stars for me. HF is just that... historical accuracy combined with fictionalized elements.  Couldn't be truer… વધુ in this book.  The artist Il Bastianino, who was supposed to have painted the marriage portrait..painted much in Ferrara but I could find no reference to a portrait of Lurezia anywhere by him. The Duke Alfonso 11...was an odious character and Lurezia part woman part child...leaping from childish ways to profound wisdom, of course she was only 16 when she died...this is not a spoiler!! To many flowery expressions and euphemisms bored me a little and the ending was far fetched but likeable and sad IMHO. All in all....an interesting read and recomendable.  I would  definitely read the author's afterword.

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: Oh, wow!  The Missing by Kiersten Modglin  Ok! This is completely new level for Kiersten Modglin!  I finished quite few books by this author and I loved them but this... This book is different! So different… વધુ from all others!  I can say with confidence, I think this is my favourite so far!  I loved the story line!  I loved the characters!  I loved the ending!  I loved the twist... I can't say it was twist it was more like clarity, like having answers to all the WHY? in completely logical way! This is story about true love and strength this love giving to you.  This is a story about surviving. This is the story about not giving up.  This is the story about friendship. I absolutely loved it!  If you never read any of Kiersten Modglin book, this is good one to start with. If you stuck what to read next from the author, grab this one!  You will be surprised!

NAME: Jessica Andreiw-Backous
CONTENT: Just finished this. It is a cute Disney extension of nightmare before Xmas of course. It is a feel good book and easy read.  Sally is having a hard time with her new Pumpkin Queen identity as well as processing… વધુ her old life as an experiment from dr finklestein. She stumbled across a new ancient door and released a monster that creates havoc not only in her world, but all the holiday worlds and even the human world. Sally has to find a way to save everyone and meets some really important people in the middle of it all.

I can probably find her earlier installments at my local… વધુ bookstore. Thanks! Edit: thanks to all who answered my question! I have passed that information on to my friend, as well as a link to a list of the series' books in order. She is planning to start at the beginning.  I came to the series before the two stand alone novels, which I loved. Agree that the series is much different. I love the range of the author.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Just an fyi: starting last year I decided to track my favorite and least favorite books per month, and ended up really enjoying the experience. I would post both boards in several reading groups every month,… વધુ and I remember a few times being asked if I had the template I used by people who liked the idea. Not saying it's such a hot idea, but when I had time today I did a favorites (decided to stop saying "best" starting this year) board for 2023, so thought I'd post these in case anyone liked the idea, especially after seeing how a finished one looked, and wanted to try it this year. Will post a "worst" template for 2023 when I get it done, if anyone is interested. Happy Reading!

CONTENT: I have just finished reading 2 books. I finished a great telling of  The Collected Stories of Winnie the Pooh by A.A. Miline  Narrated by Stephen Fry, Judi Dench, Micheal Williams, and Geoffrey Palmer If you… વધુ are young at heart you are going to like this collection of Winnie the Pooh stories. I also just finished reading a riveting fantastic tale of murder, ghosts, spellbinding and definitely unique story of The Library of the Dead By T.L. Huchu I highly recommend checking this book out it will knock your socks off.

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: Finding the other women by Cole Baxter Absolutely fantastic book! I loved it so, so, so much!!! I know year just started so I can't say best book of the year but definitely best book in a long while! Definitely… વધુ will be on my "I absolutely loved it" list for 2023! Such a good story, such a good development and such a great way to witness what trauma can do to us! How trauma affect our brain and what amazing machine is brain when we need a protection from ourselves!  Definitely recommend to anyone who when through trauma, anyone who feels that part of the life is missing, anyone who is in the middle of something they want to end...  You are worth it no matter what anyone says!

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: Brain damage by Freida McFadden  Of course I loved it like any other Freida McFadden book. There was some chapters that was too slow or loo long but they was there to show the development but story line was… વધુ interesting and the question "What's happened?" was present all the time. This book is about dedication and reaching the goals even if you can't see "Why, what's the point?" because there is a point, always! But this is not why I will remember this book!  There was the "rapist" scene that made me laugh so hard that I cried! I know it's sounds horrible but you must read it to understand it! My wife was so intrigued of my laugh-crying, she took my kindle and started to read loud but she couldn't! She cried as well. I don't remember when we laughed so hard! You must read it!

NAME: Eisha Sarkar
CONTENT: Book 1: The Great Train Journey Author: Ruskin Bond (India) 🇮🇳 Genre: Short stories Set in: India 🇮🇳 Page 16: I have lived to see Bombay become Mumbai, Calcutta become Kolkata, and Madras become Chennai. Times… વધુ change, names change, and if Bond becomes Bonda I won’t object. Place-names may alter but people don’t, and in Mumbai I found that people were as friendly and good-natured as ever; perhaps even more than when I was last there twenty-five years ago. Flag score: 🇮🇳 #books #ruskinbond #flagscore #readingjourney2023 #trains #india #indianrailways

NAME: Joan Sanderson
CONTENT: Have you ever sat down and wondered how and why Africa became impoverished despite an abundance of human and natural resources? Have you ever wondered why you get so many emails from the so-called "Nigerian… વધુ Prince" who has billions stashed away wanting to share with you for a small percentage? In these two volume books, the author describes the many reasons that a country like Nigeria is so behind the rest of the world, reading these two books, you can then understand fully well why Africa lags behind other continents in terms of growth. These are Must Read books.  "HOW WE DESTROY NIGERIA" 1 & 2  PRECEDENCE OF DOOM and HAVEN FOR FINANCIAL CRIMES & CORRUPTION. by John Walker Adetunji-Adeoye Both books are on Amazon and Barnes & Noble.

Am staying away from the word "Best" from now on - it's always so subjective, plus that world riles some people up - but while my yearly Top 10 lists (I do one for films, too), are never listed in order of preference, I always pick a #1, or favorite, book - no one more surprised than me that mine was THE LATECOMER. NAME: Susan Henkel Schofield
CONTENT: Here is what I read in December.  Remarkably Bright Creatures was a wonderful book about friendship.  Flight was a very good family drama.  Locust Lane and The Last Party were both good and surprising domestic… વધુ suspense novels.  Guilty Admissions was a fascinating account of the college admissions scandal - it truly was amazing the lengths these parents would go to and the amount of mobey they would spend to get their kids into the “right” school.  Maureen was a short and sweet conclusion to the Harold Fry trilogy.  Just the Nicest Couple was a good thriller.  The Bullet That Missed is the third book in the Thursday Murder Club series - it was so entertaining and enjoyable.  Bookworm was the only book I really didn’t like - it was not a light and fun rom com like the cover implies.  It was much darker and the characters were all just so unlikable. Remarkably Bright Creatures - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Locust Lane - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Last Party - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Guilty Admissions - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Bullet That Missed - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Maureen - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Flight - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Just The Nicest Couple - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ Bookworm - ⭐️⭐️

NAME: Jeanne Doyle Glass
CONTENT: This book is based on a true story of Five Girls who grew up basically on their own. They lived on Broad St in Downtown Augusta, GA.  The Writer, Gloria Boltz tells of how life was growing up with her sisters… વધુ with alcoholic parents that neglected them. God had these five Girls in the palm of his hands. And it shows that things in your life does not define who you are. These girls turned into awesome ladies. The stories in this book made me cry, laugh, shake my head and make my jaw drop.  This book is a must read. When you start reading this book you will not be able to stop til the end.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Let the stats begin. Eleven books read in December, bringing my total to 124 for the year, per Goodreads. That's six books more than last year, BUT also like 13k MORE PAGES than in 2022, which means - much as I… વધુ love manga, kid-lit and graphic novels - I am glad to have "beefed up" my reading of longer books this year, which was the plan. Even happier, I read some TERRIFIC books in 2022; if I remember right, something like 6-7 of my Top 10 Reads of 2022 are either debut authors, or authors I had never even read before. I set my 2023 GR goal the same as I do every year: 33.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Anyone see this yet? Barnes & Noble has put together a 2023 WEEKLY Reading Challenge; yes, there are 52 different prompts here (some of them a bit bizarre) - basically a book a week - and upon seeing some of… વધુ the prompts I thought "No way" ... but then realized that, if you didn't do them in order but hunt-and-picked what you finish from each page as you do them, it might make for a REALLY interesting challenge - especially come, say, November 2023 when you saw what prompts you had left to fill! NAME: Andy Lubrano
CONTENT: Hello. I have never been in a book club, but I do love to read. I am not compelled to keep up with all of the bestsellers. My usual approach  is to check out 10 or so books from the local library, based on the title and cover. Yes, there are times I go seeking a specific title or (more likely) author, but it is usually a free-spirited outing for… વધુ me. I.e. regardless of what I come out with, going to the library is a happy thing. My latest book was The Book of Longings. Before that, the Woman in Cabin 10.   I would like to join this group so I can latch on to other good reads and engage in stirring commentary.  Or not. I just enjoy my time spent reading  and wish to celebrate the individuals who create the stories for the rest of us to enjoy. It is also about affirming the feelings and values we all share.  If this is not the the proper venue to find what i seek, then I would greatly appreciate a recommended alternative.  Thanks.

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: The Blue Rose-Kate Forsyth....well she's done it again...not as good as Bitter Greens, but almost.  After just reading The Clockwork Girl-Anna Mazzola centred during the reign of Luis XV of France and the… વધુ undercurrent of the French revolution...This book is situated during the reign of Luis XV1 and Marie Antoinette and the French revolution from the point of view of a young aristocrat.  Well written and extremely informative and descriptive...I felt as if I was living the many cruel, bloodthirsty, unacceptable and incongruant situations. 4 stars as I found the part about China much less informative and a little bland. This book has it all...history (extremely informative), suspense, romance(not annoying, but a little unbelievable ). I got so involved with some of the characters I ended up hating them!!!.. or...loving them. Would recommend reading the afterword first...I don't think it spoils the reading, although I must say that the ending was a little disappointing for me. I totally recommend this book. #review

NAME: Peggy Royer Parisi
CONTENT: Just finished The Personal Librarian by Marie Benedict and Victoria Christopher Murray.   It is based on the life of Belle da Costa Greene, who was hired by J.P. Morgan to organize and build his personal… વધુ library collection.   The book explores many themes - family, race, gender, income, class, women's role in society, sexuality, discrimination, and prejudice.  Belle was a determined woman who used her intellect, curiosity, hard work, and charm to successfully navigate the exclusive world of rare books, manuscripts, and artwork.  Belle had a secret and lived in fear that if her secret was known, all she had worked for and the career that supported her family would be lost.  She had to make many tough choices.  If you look online at The JP Morgan Library and Museum you can see pictures of settings in the book.  It is a magnificent space.   I could see Belle having one of her chats with Mr. Morgan.   Recommend.    I have enjoyed all of Marie Benedict's books.

I even had a dream where I was trying to write a review but could not find the right words. Why? Reading this book was like waking up 20 years ago but being lucky enough to see from the side...I could separate the audience who is reading this review in 3 ways:If you survived your psychopath - this book will through you back in past. Be ready to go through… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to tell  you about:The Last Bookshop in London by Madeline Martin. I loved, loved, loved this book! The protagonist, Grace Bennett, arrives in London in 1939 expecting to live a more glamorous life, and finds herself working in a dusty bookshop with the world on the verge of the Second World War. Grace is not a… વધુ bookish person, but she sets to work to create an inviting atmosphere in the bookshop. In fact, she discovers that she loves reading books, and she develops a following by reading to the patrons of the shop from novels that she has found to be particularly interesting. She also reads in the shelters during the Blitz and finds that it not only relieves the minds of those anxiously sheltering from the bombs but also unites the community in ways that she never imagined. An inspiring, well-written tale….

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: 4 stars for The Hour Of The Witch-Chris Bohjalian. A well written and active book on historical fiction. Situated in puritan Boston around 1680's. The characters were well developed and the ending, although not… વધુ particularly surprising, left me wondering.  I did find a few gaps in the story which mainly takes place in a courtroom althoughit didn't bore me...to the contrary. I must emphasise one negative point .... the book states that the first  Protestant martyr to be executed under the reign of Mary Tudor..John Rogers..was put to the stake and all his family wife and children too...I've looked in all sources and he died whilst his family watched...they were not put to the stake. It was mentioned quite a few times...and I think it's a real faux pas ...one thing Is to fictionalize and quite another to distort facts...IMHO. All in all a recommendable read.

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: The Perfect Child by Lucinda Berry... My heart is broken in hundreds pieces... I don't remember when I cried and gasped loud while reading book... The book is finished but I still want to cry...  If you are… વધુ looking for something deep, emotional and are ready to break your heart, this is THE book!  I can't say more without giving out important information so I will say this is the most emotional book that I read this year!

I started this morning and already knew that I will need to finish today as would be hard to wait until tomorrow to know, where all this is going. This book just simply proof that we all are different tastes and preferences and even so there was plenty reviews saying this book was "plain and predictable" I loved it every chapter! I definitely will check out other books by this author and looks like will replace some choices on my A-Z list 2023 :)

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: “Overkill” has a good thought provoking story line - the importance of having a Will stating your wishes and a Medical Power of Attorney. Former Super Bowl MVP quarterback Zach Bridget has MPA for his ex-wife,… વધુ Rebecca, who has been placed on life support after a violent assault. Zach has kept Rebecca on life support for 4 years to honor her parents wishes. The attacker, Eban, gets an early release from prison and Kate Lennon, a brilliant state prosecutor, is determined to put him back behind bars. If Rebecca were to die, Eban could be retried on a new charge: Murder. Zach is asked to make a difficult choice: keep her on life support or take her off and put Eban back in prison. We discussed… વધુ

NAME: Kristine McKenna
CONTENT: I love Fredrik Backman 💕 I have read all his books, starting with A Man Called Ove. Then I started the Beartown Trilogy. Beartown is a much more complex and darker book then his others. It also takes place in a… વધુ small town that’s main activity is the town’s High School Hockey Team. I was not sure I would enjoy this one. I really did though and got very wrapped up with the characters. I think Fredrik Backman is brilliant at this. Then the second book came out, Us Against You, which continues the story. I liked it, but enjoyed Beartown better. Now, I just got The Winners. I have been waiting for it to come out for a long time. Really looking forward to reading it. I have heard mostly Very Positive Reviews about this book. I am really active on Goodreads and had to try and not read any friends reviews since I didn’t want to have any spoilers.  So, has anyone else read these books? Please, no spoilers. Going to start The Winners this week. Love Reading other people’s take on books.  Thanks, and hope this is another 💖💖💖 Fredrik Backman Favorite!

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: Solitario exists in a Valley of Shadows (by Rudy Ruiz), where he is haunted by the ghosts of those he's lost, those whom he cared about too much, awakening the malediction plaguing the men in his family.  The… વધુ semi-recent loss of his wife drives him into a self-imposed solitude, wherein he waits for her to appear. He works his ranch and only periodically goes to town for supplies, but when the local sheriff and his wife and son are murdered, Solitario is summoned to look into the crime. The ritualistic murder of the mayor's wife & kidnapping of his young children seemingly stump the local mayor, who compels Solitario to return to his law-enforcement position. Solitario resists, but when his… વધુ

NAME: Margaret Hammond
CONTENT: Where the Crawdads Sing: Delia OwensI know every-one else who has read this book has given it great reviews so I thought I may-be missing something special so I thought I must get my fat little fingers on this… વધુ book and see what the song and dance is all about. I had seen that it was made into a movie and I wanted to read the book prior to going to the film.Wow! It is a fantastic read. All of you who have raved about this book are correct. It is captivating. I could not stop reading it.  If you have not read it yet….do yourself a great Christmas treat and start reading. Loved it, loved it!. Ten out of ten.

NAME: Melinda Wenberg
CONTENT: OMG I am OBSESSED with this book!!! It's a steamy enemies-to-lovers paranormal romance and I couldn't read it fast enough! A real page-turner if you ask me. If you love spicy love novellas with lots of angst,… વધુ that 'I can't stand you but I can't stay away' energy, this is the book for you! A sinfully sizzling-hot short story, you're sure to light your kindle on fire! Lots of action and suspense and it's so fast-paced, and I love me some unhinged OTTJP MMC! Keep in mind it is a dark romance so check the content warning at the beginning of the book.

CONTENT: Last year I read ”The Push” by Ashley Audrain, it was a tough, yet great read. When I finished that book I was a little shaken and was like what in the devil did I just read? Well, the author will be releasing her second book, “The Whispers” and I’m here for it.

CONTENT: Just finished Before We We’re Yours.   Historical fiction about the Tennessee Children’s Home Society from 1920’s to 1950’s theft kidnapping and brokerage of children in Tennessee. NAME: Farjana Mimi
CONTENT: Alpaca Ranch Fun! Paperback – October 31, 2022by Jack Rotifer (Author)Book Link:https://amzn.to/3HhSBIPAunt K owns a farm where alpacas and a menagerie of other animals live. Three yorkies-Jingle, Jaywok, and… વધુ Joi Daisy-visit the farm and learn about the different animals including some of the history of these great animals. The yorkies become good friends with June and Josie, a couple of young alpacas. Jingle, Jaywok, and Joi Daisy also meet Betty, the sled dog, a world class athlete who competed in the Iditarod. The farm is home to many more animals, and the yorkie pups think it's great fun to learn about creatures from different parts of the world. This picture book for children shares the message that you can be friends no matter what color, size, and background you come from.

NAME: Wendy Petranik-Kennedy
CONTENT: I started off not really liking this book There was really no plot. Being the artist he is, Backman carves away at the initially unlikable main character, Ove, until his real truth is revealed. This is a book… વધુ about the simple things in life and the impact even simple lives have on the world in general. The end made me weep, partly because I was sad for Ove, but partly happy because I feel that at the end, his new found family affirmed the importance of his existence. Never think you don't matter.

NAME: Raul Ramos-Sanchez
CONTENT: HOW BOOKS BECAME THE IDEAL HOLIDAY GIFT  For centuries, Christmas  was a holiday so debaucherous that the Puritans tried to suppress it: From 1659 to 1681, celebrating Christmas in Massachusetts was illegal.… વધુ But in the early 19th century, things began to shift. Wealthy merchants had grown tired of dealing with the marauding bands of revelers who paraded through the city — banging pans, smashing windows and generally causing a ruckus that was not good for business — and they embarked on a campaign of rebranding Christmas as a domestic celebration. A key component: the invention of modern-day Santa Claus -- and a tradition of gift giving within the home.  By the mid-1800s, many publishers were… વધુ

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: The Immortal Nicholas-Glenn Beck  5 stars (The third I've given this year) to an imaginative,deep and humane book from an Author I've just discovered. Thanks to the person who recommended it. I rarely get… વધુ emotional with any books and I'm a more spiritual than religious person..but this book had me 'believing' in all the characters 'real' and fiction.  Accurate historically and flawless writing without excessive vocabulary.  From Agios(Saint in Greek)to today's Father... Christ...mas, so originally fusioned together with the birth and death of Jesus..then Christ, plus all the historical and fictionalized personalities. It got me so emotional that I had a few bad nights thinking about it.  So many books don't leave a mark...this book will stay with me forever.  Only a very humane and sensitive person could write something like this. Highly recommendable to all faiths...this is a book about faith, giving and real love, which I think we need a lot of in this world.  A Happy 'real' Xmas to all #Review#

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: An Almond For A Parrot -Wray Delaney 3 stars just  A prolific author of children's books under a different name and writing her first adult novels ...a children's story with adult context IMHO.  I think there… વધુ was an attempt of emulation to Michel Faber, Rose Tremain or Sarah Waters...she didn't reach the level in elegance or vocabulary.  The erotic parts are so repetitive and superfluous that they ended up as boring. So explicit as to be vulgar even though most are metaphors. A possibly good story well written and badly constructed.  Tully is exceptionally naïve  and her spiritual gifts just don't 'click'. I have no doubt Delaney is a good and well versed author in her normal genre and the  3 stars are because I finished it and wanted to see how it ended....which almost reminded me of a Harlequin novel!! I had hopes for this book but was let down. #Review#

NAME: Gilbert Lecamus
CONTENT: 'Stuck Inside a Vinyl Record' is a timeless, hilarious, and enlightening story about four extraordinary heroes, particularly... the Beatles!  All readers, whether they are familiar with the four musicians or… વધુ not, will be taken to another age and will follow them throughout the world and beyond! The astonishing, at times terrible, challenges they will confront will gradually lead them to achieve intimidating yet valuable soul autonomy, which is both their natural resource and their most significant strength. In many ways, 'Stuck Inside a Vinyl Record' is a story of undeniable universality, highlighting a golden era: the fabulous sixties! Here comes a great gift idea to give urgently (for a very low cost). For all audiences. Fantasy. Amazon links: United states-  https://amzn.to/3tvxBq3 United kingdom- https://amz.run/55TX Canada- https://amz.run/55TY The author's website: https://bit.ly/39MWDdE

NAME: Susan Henkel Schofield
CONTENT: Here is what I read in November.  I loved The Soulmate - it was a great domestic thriller.  All That is Mine I Carry With Me was well written and absorbing with it’s four different viewpoints.  The Prisoner and… વધુ All Good People Here were entertaining but I didn’t like the ending of either book.  Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can’t Stop Talking was informative and interesting but definitely not a book I would usually read.  The 100 Year Old Man Who Climbed Out The Window and Disappeared was enjoyable and funny but a little long.  Allen’s adventures reminded me of Forrest Gump. The Soulmate - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ All That Is Mine I Carry With Me - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Prisoner - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can’t Stop Talking - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The 100 Year Old Man Who Climbed Out The Window and Disappeared - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ All Good People Here - ⭐️⭐️ 1/2

NAME: Robin Sizemore
CONTENT: Thank you all for the recommendations to my request below.  You have given me many to choose from 😊.  So many, that I cannot thank you all individually.  I love being a member of this group 📖💕 Often, the books recommended by our group members are newer books that our local library does not have yet.  I am a huge audiobook reader who wonders if we can recommend some older books that are available as audiobooks.   I love to listen to audiobooks as I walk the dog, weave baskets, make pottery, clean the house, etc.   Lovin' me some audiobooks 💕

NAME: Bethaire MacKinnon
CONTENT: Strange observation:  Reading "The Rose Code" today took me back to the days when books had flexible spines (to stay open without force 😅), print large enough to read easily, pages you can easily turn one at a… વધુ time, and ---it's an awesome story!  In short, the most comfortable I have felt with a book for some time. Well done William Morrow! Good choices Kate Quinn. I remember when all books were like this one.💯

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to recommend it here:Secret Prey by John Sandford. As you know if you are a fan of John Sandford, all the “Prey” books star Lucas Davenport as the protagonist/hero/top dog. This is an early one in the series, but one which I had not read. This one involves the murder of the chairman of a company who had been out… વધુ hunting with four of his executive underlings, each of whom may or may not have had a reason to wish for the death of the chairman. There are lots of twists and turns in the story as Lucas Davenport (and you, the reader) tries to determine who is responsible.

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: You know when you're reading a book and it feels like the words are directly whispering to your heart. This was that book for me. Maybe it's because I worked in a restaurant as a teenager for 2 men from Cyprus… વધુ (late 80s) and they introduced me to so many wonderful foods. It's definitely the writing which is beautiful, thoughtful and wrought. But the Fig Tree taught me so much about life and observing. Total fan of Elif Shafak.

NAME: Peggy Royer Parisi
CONTENT: Just finished the story of Gino Bartali, "A Champion Cyclist Against the Nazis".   Many found ways to resist fascism and the Nazis. Gino was a champion cyclist who used the pretense of training to deliver false… વધુ documents to help save the lives of about 800 Jews. Many details of his life before, during, and after the war.  Only 176 pages, easy to read.  Hard to put down.  Recommend.

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: Our most recent 2 book club reads were enjoyed by all members. They were:  - Other Parents by Sarah Stovell - The Fountains of Silence by Ruta Sepetys.  Both quite different books but both were enjoyed by all of us which is very unusual.  My book group is in Spain and the Fountains of Silence is set in Spain so it was of particular interest to us,… વધુ but I’m sure the subjects it deals with will be of interest to many.  Other parents is a very down to earth, pithy, both funny and sad story set around the parents in a small school. Judgement of parenting methods from ‘Other Parents’ can be brutal, family life can be fraught and feelings always run high where children are involved.

NAME: Kathyrn Goecke
CONTENT: This is a 5 star read for me. Powerful life lessons told in 3 timelines. 💯 Robert Dugoni also wrote The Extraordinary Life of Sam Hell.

She was on a bank, she kept swapping from her body to the spirit world (I guess you could say) Only one person could see and talk to her, a male. She use to bully him, so it took a bit of convincing to get him to help him find where her body was before she passed.  Also the book title is not "If I stay"

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Reading The Day the World Came to Town by Jim DeFede was, for me, like receiving a warm hug.  The many ways  the people of Gander,Newfoundland  took care of strangers —hundreds of strangers— grounded as 9/11… વધુ unfolded, reminded me of a  Biblical parable of love, selflessness snd compassion.  The stories of simple human kindness told in this book will remain in my mind and heart for a long time. A highly recommended read!!

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Angel of Battan by Walter Macdougal is the true story of Lt.Alice Zwicker and her stints as a military nurse in Manila, Bataan, and Corregidor during WWII. The story also details the three grueling years during… વધુ which Alice  and her medical peers were held by the Japanese as prisoners of war at Battan. For Alice and her fellow prisoners the war did not end with liberation from the Bataan internment camp. She and most of her peers fought medical maladies originating from the circumstances of their imprisonment until the end of their lives. The reader is advised to keep a box brim full of tissues nearby during the reading of this amazing story!

NAME: Malek Karim
CONTENT: Let it Rain Kindle Editionby Marcela Mariz  (Author)Book Link: https://amzn.to/3U2VMH2The funniest and most charming novel about finding yourself you’ll read this year.Mandy Olsen lives and breathes the… વધુ Eighties: an era of great music, questionable fashion choices, and endless possibilities. It was also the only time Mandy was truly happy in her life.Now working at the school she used to attend, Mandy’s fixation with the past is starting to attract attention. Jessy, the office mean girl, whispers that “Mental Mandy” is going off the deep end. Principal Weber prefers to call her confused. And to make matters worse, the mysterious hot new teacher has developed a knack for popping up at the most embarrassing moments possible.If Mandy wants to keep her job, she knows she needs to face the grief that turned her world upside down. But can you grasp at a second chance if your best years are behind you?Perfect for fans of Beth O’Leary and Sophie Kinsella, Let it Rain is a bittersweet coming-of-age story about friendship, rebellion, and finding the courage to love and laugh again.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: BIG Kindle Daily Deal sale today, and it includes two of my favorite reads of this year (THE LATECOMER, THE HOOKUP PLAN), and one of my favorites from last year (ACE OF SPADES). The Latecomer is definitely… વધુ literary fiction, a slow burn but so beautifully written; not sure if for everyone but I loved it. Hookup Plan was just so much fun I fell in love with both the characters and Farrah Rochon. And Ace of Spades was perfectly creepy and unsettling YA that kept me turning pages like crazy. Best yet, the Kindle edition of each is just $2.99 today!

NAME: Julie Ling
CONTENT: Hey everyone! So I just wanted to share a book I think you'll like: Fated to the Triplet Kings by Stephanie Noircent. I rate it 5/5 stars and that's a rare treat from me! The paranormal story gripped me from… વધુ the start and I found myself turning the pages faster than I could keep up! The romance is what really reeled me in and kept me coming back for more. If you like stories with a badass heroine, with three OTTJP alpha males then you need to pick this novel up asap. I've never really been into the why choose or RH genre but figured I would give this new indie author a try and WOW! It got my heart pounding and my fingers itching to turn the page to find out the next plot-twist. It did not disappoint! Lots of world-building, action and adventure so it's got something in there for everyone. Check it out!

CONTENT: Just finished The Secret Life of Sunflowers. Not on my list of favorites, but it was ok.

NAME: Cathy Crouchman
CONTENT: I just wanted to thank NetGalley for the ARC of Code Name Sapphire by Pam Jenoff. I really enjoyed this historical fiction novel right from the beginning. This novel is about the underground network responsible for aiding downed airmen out out Belgium during WWII. It sheds light of the sacrifices and dangers that these individuals placed themselves in order to survive through the stories of Hannah and her cousin Lily as well as the leader of the resistance line, Micheline.#codenamesapphire #netgalley

NAME: Chris Strange
CONTENT: How many read young readers books. I read  Fableheaven and  am now starting the Candy Shop War both by Brandon Mull.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Possible controversial opinion, and I don't mean to tie a knot in anyone's bungee cord, but I put almost zero credibility into the Goodreads Choice Awards. Oh, I am SUPER happy for the nominees and winners -… વધુ especially ones I have read and loved - but to me, the awards themselves are ... kind of worthless. They're popularity contests, essentially; you can have, say, 12 books up for best thriller, and anyone can vote - meaning someone voting might have read ONE out of the 12, so guess who they're going to vote for? Even someone who has read, say, 10 of the 12 - how do you know that one if those two you HAVEN'T read might not blow the other ten out of the water? Were you judging an ice cream… વધુ

NAME: Jacki Van de Schoor
CONTENT: These books are so good! I just discovered this author this year and all the books are among my favourites I've read all year. They are all loosely based retellings of the Tudors.  Wife After Wife is a modern… વધુ day retelling of Henry VIII and his wives.  Sister to Sister is a modern day retelling of Elizabeth and Mary Tudor.  Notorious is a modern day retelling of Elizabeth of York, King Richard, Henry VII and the lost Princes.  ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

NAME: Jo Shryock
CONTENT: This book publishes in April  If you enjoy historical fiction based on real events and people this one might fit the bill!  Thank you to Book Club Favorites at Simon & Schuster for the free copy for review. #… વધુBookClubFavorite  This is the retelling of the December 26th 1811 Richmond, Virginia Theater Fire that killed over 70 people. The author tells the story from four different perspectives using short chapters to alternate the different POV. I found the book to be a quick read, a page turner that kept me wanting to know what happened next. The characters are well developed but I felt I wanted more from them so I think maybe lengthening the chapters a bit would have lead to better character… વધુ

NAME: Lisa Ryan
CONTENT: I’ve read a few books by this author but my favourites so far have been The Girls and A Mountain Story.  She’s such a good writer and her topics are varied with unexpected twists.  I was reluctant to read The… વધુ Girls because it was about conjoined twin sisters. I thought it would be sensationalist but instead it focused a lot on the love and support they had for each other and from friends a family.  It was written like a memoir from each sister’s point of view.  So good!  A Mountain Story was gripping and insightful with a very different ending.  Loved them both.

CONTENT: I finished this book tonight. I must admit that I didn't like it at first. But once you get about half way through it is a game changer. I could not put it down. It wasn't so much about the murder mystery but… વધુ the relatable character development behind the mystery. The author allows you to see them all in such a way that you feel their pain and their joy. All the while learning an exorbitant amount of amazing facts about bees...Including where the title comes from. Another amazing book to add to the shelf!

NAME: Gilbert Lecamus
CONTENT: 'Stuck Inside a Vinyl Record' is a universal story that might remind you of the works of the 19th century if it didn't evoke record players, vinyl records and the...Beatles: as you know, unusual heroes make… વધુ stories stronger! In a stunning tale for the whole family, the Beatles take you into unknown, new and sometimes dangerous territory! Well-written and based on a solid and meaningful story, 'Stuck Inside a Vinyl Record' is, for a very modest price, a wonderful gift to give to all curious readers to celebrate the end of the year. Just be universal and explore the fabulous but complex world of the sixties through sensational entertainment! United states-  https://amzn.to/3tvxBq3 United kingdom- https://amz.run/55TX Canada- https://amz.run/55TY

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: One Dark Window by Rachel Gillig  Can a fantasy novel feel cozy? Ancient castles, cottages in the woods, cloaks and cold, creeping mist... Yes, this captivating and fantastic tale had me wrapped in blankets and… વધુ sipping tea deep into the night as I moonlighted as Elsbeth, a young woman who keeps to the shadows, guarding a dangerous secret...the monster inside her. As she navigates a village cut off from the world by a magical curse and villagers cut off from each other by fear, Elsbeth discovers that she is not the only one who hides her truth. Tentatively, she enters a world of intrigue focused on undoing the magic that imprisons them and saving all those whose secrets would condemn them, and as she calls on her monster for protection and strength, she realizes that this power comes at a price and that eventually her truth will out.

CONTENT: No Plan B: A Jack Reacher NovelNEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER • The gripping new Jack Reacher thriller from the #1 New York Times bestselling authors Lee Child and Andrew Child“No Plan B is not to be missed. A… વધુ perfectly plotted, fast-paced thriller, with bigger twists than ever before. But Jack Reacher saw what really happened: A man in a gray hoodie and jeans, moving stealthily, pushed the victim to her demise—before swiftly grabbing the dead woman’s purse and strolling away.When another homicide is ruled an… વધુ

NAME: Wendy Scott
CONTENT: This is your next great read, Becoming Duchess Goldblatt. This is a story of a tweeter that poses as an old Victorian matron bent on encouraging readers to be kind. She makes daily posts and has a huge following because of her positive uplifting daily thoughts. It is humorous and lighthearted - an easy enjoyable read.

NAME: Wade Howlett
CONTENT: NOW AVAILABLE FREE ON KINDLE UNLIMITED OR 99p TO BUY ON AMAZON KINDLE Dirty Days is an authentic recount of a young miners journey and experiences working in the coal fields of Yorkshire, the many life changing… વધુ events that took place above and below ground in the years leading up to the epic struggle of the 1984/85 miners strike and the difficulties that presented themselves throughout those turbulent times until the industry's eventual and predicted demise. Overall it is a unique and well rounded story of a dark existence deep underground, made light, with many funny little anecdotes, a plethora of ghost stories, and few metaphoric film references that will test your movie knowledge to boot.

NAME: Irene Ivaldi Egan
CONTENT: I'm usually not a romance -kind -of- reader but I enjoyed reading Heart Song. Ella Hurley's first book in a series of books. I'm waiting on her second book to come out.

NAME: Kim Bakayoko
CONTENT: Currently reading The House We Grew Up In by Lisa Jewel.   So far its a good story,  a little sad, but I'm enjoying it.

NAME: Tina Jones
CONTENT: Oh those Rolling Stones! This was funny, moving and just loaded with amazing stories. Keith is a complex man & I’m so glad he shared his story. Let me know your thoughts.

NAME: Elizabeth Birch Gaffney
CONTENT: Just finished! Another good Rizolli/Isles mystery by Tess Gerritsen  Although it dove deeper into characters that haven’t been previously developed, like Jane’s mom, it left me wanting a deeper storyline for… વધુ Maura who plays more of a supporting character this time around. I still enjoyed it. Seems like the ending may introduce Amy in a  future book by TG. Overall, typical weave of the plot, good book to read over a couple days.

NAME: Sarah Coe-Odess
CONTENT: Hi!  I'm a psychologist and run a virtual well-being book club. We read  books that are not necessarily "self-help" but that focus on mental  health, therapy, relationships, etc. For each month, the group does… વધુ live  discussions with the authors, and anyone is welcome to join (even if  you haven't read/finished the book)! Our book this month is The  Happiness Project, which is written by a woman who spent a year  exploring ways to be happier, using conventional wisdom, lessons from  pop culture, and research. The book is a NY Times bestseller and has  sparked a podcast and a movement. I'm doing a live discussion with the  author Gretchen Rubin on December 1 at 8 pm EST on … વધુ

CONTENT: Well, THAT was unexpected. Was minding my business,, reading a couple books I was really enjoying, when I happened to look for DEATH AND THE CONJUROR by Tom Mead via library, because of all I'd read about it.… વધુ That wasn't the plan, this was bypass-the-library month, but when you accidentally hit a debut historical locked-room mystery that keeps you reading pages like a maniac, and has you thinking about the book whenever you AREN'T reading it -  well,, not finishing is kind of not an option! ⭐⭐⭐⭐-1/2 stars  (And cannot WAIT for upcoming book two in the series!) Review to come. 👌

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: “Lessons in Chemistry” is a fabulous book that had me laughing at the clever and witty style of Bonnie Garmus. I loved all the different and colorful characters, each one a gem, especially the pet dog named… વધુ Six-Thirty. This is the story of Elizabeth Zott a scientist in the 1950’s. I enjoyed how she fought the patriarchy in the workplace, unbending in her sense of right and wrong, I was rooting for her the whole time. How she ends up as a TV personality makes for an entertaining, yet thought-provoking story. This is a story of resilience, responsibility and determination. Highly recommend!  Book Club Menu:  Aubergine (Eggplant) Dip with crackers Tossed Romaine Salad with     Good Season’s Italian Dressing Spinach Casserole  Chicken Pot Pie Bonnie Garmus Brownies     (From her website)

NAME: Cheryl Isaac
CONTENT: Just finished reading our next bookclub selection, "People of the Book" by Geraldine Brooks.  I really enjoyed it.  The novel describes "the journey of a rare illuminated manuscript through centuries of exile… વધુ and war.  In 1996, Hanna Heath, an Australian rare-book expert, is offered the job of a lifetime: analysis and conservation of the famed Sarajevo Haggadah, which has been rescued from Serb shelling during the Bosnian war. Priceless and beautiful, the book is one of the earliest Jewish volumes ever to be illuminated with images...The reader is ushered into an exquisitely detailed and atmospheric past, tracing the book's journey from its salvation back to its creation. " "Inspired by a true story, People of the Book is at once a novel of sweeping historical grandeur and intimate emotional intensity, an ambitious, electrifying work by an acclaimed and beloved author."

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: Grady Hendrix's The Southern Book Club's Guide to Slaying Vampires is only tangentially about vampires, or...the one literal vampire. The true 'vampires' are those tied to 'the way things are.' These… વધુ characters, namely affluent white men & their society wives, assert polite neighborliness but really 'look within' & focus on whatever they believe is best for their family. #relatable Not surprisingly, the things they strive for (money, status, saving face, safety, peace) are the very things they stand to lose when they refuse to acknowledge the monsters within & around. This theme kept me reading. POTENTIAL SPOILERS 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ 🧛‍♂️ I did not… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read that you may like:Sparring Partners by John Grisham. Having worked in the legal field for over 35 years myself, I have been a fan of John Grisham’s novels since the very first one I read, The Firm, in 1991. Grisham has never failed to capture my interest with his legal thrillers, and this one is no exception. This book contains three novellas, i.e., three short stories involving different characters and situations. It grabbed me from the moment I started reading it and didn’t let go till I’d finished it.

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Cloud Cuckoo Land is the story of  5 characters in different time periods who are bound by the “magic”of a fragmented  story borrowed from Ancient Greece. The adventures of these characters run parallel to each… વધુ other until , at the point in the story when the reader despairs of ever achieving closure, the situations of the 5 characters intersect and become both life saving and life changing.  Cloud Cuckoo Land is a tale in which the reader must invest time and thought in order for all of the pieces to fit together properly.  However, time and effort necessary for  reading this masterfully told tribute to the power of the printed word are time and effort well spent!  ***** 5/5 stars!

NAME: Robin Baker Flores
CONTENT: My husband and I were watching a ghost show last night. It showed an apparition going back and forth to a bookshelf. I said, oh is that in a library. My husband said, yes it looks like it.  I said, if I’m ever a ghost, I want to be stuck in a library.  My husband said, “you’re weird”!  LOL. I think you guys can probably relate!  😂

NAME: Julie Ling
CONTENT: Honestly, this book just blows my mind. It's everything I could ever want in a paranormal romance: feral shifters, possessive men, a strong female lead, and lots of steam and spice. I rate this book 5/5 stars.… વધુ It's such a page-turner, I couldn't put it down! Even if you prefer paranormal adventure, fantasy and action, this book has it all. It's full-length and pulls you in from the first chapter. It is part of an unfinished series BUT each book can be read as a standalone and I love that, so there's a little something for everybody. Seriously, you need to get this book. You're missing out if you haven't given this novel a try! Hurry, get it on Amazon! Like seriously, run, don't walk! It's called Fated to the Triplet Kings by Stephanie Noircent and it ROCKS!

CONTENT: October reads. I could not get into John Grishom's The Reckoning - sad because I normally like his books. I wasn't going to force it - if I don't enjoy it, I'm not going to read it. Book Lovers, The Seven Husband's of Evelyn Hugo, and People We Meet On Vacation were all very good.

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: Once upon a time you would never see me without the book. My dream holiday was to be locked in the library for a month 🤣 then I moved the countries and  started my life in England with limited language so books wasn't an option for me... Until 2 years ago when I felt confident to restart my reading/listening.  And then I discovered A-Z challenge… વધુ and once I finished one of them I wanted one more because this is the way to discover new authors!  For example Christina Dalcher. I would never read her books if not the struggle to find book for Q. Now I finished all her 3 books. Or, Catherine Steadman.  I am on my last 2 books for my second A-Z challenge and after this I will make my third one... Not to finish this year but just carry on. The same as diet don't need to wait for Monday A-Z challenge don't need to be limited in yearly boundaries. If you never tried TRY IT! It's exciting and fun and you will be surprised how much new you can discover!  Do not copy others list, first make your own list as full you can and then fill the gaps with recommendations.

CONTENT: October reads: Lily and the Octopus was tough to read after losing my pup last month. The Murmur of Bees was beyond beautiful and is now one of my all time favorites. Rabid was fascinating! I haven’t read a page turner like this in a while. The Culture Code was great and has inspired me to keep “leading from the bench”. Wishtree ♥️ The Girls from Stilt house was a deep read that I have been looking for since I fell in love with The Kitchen House. You couldn’t help but get invested in the characters. NAME: Tawnya Robledo
CONTENT: Perfect Little Children by Sophie Hannah It started out pretty amazing!! I thought this was going to be great. Then a few chapters in and midway it was dragging out. For a minute I thought her husband was in on… વધુ the mystery and that would have been great if he was because he was so reluctant about her digging into the problem. There were many parts that lagged for eternity and got confusing. Then there was they whole "Chimpy" nickname conversation that went on and on and I thought ...what the mess am I reading?? All to end in straight craziness..it wasn't even a plot twist. It was chaos. I did like the main character and her loyalty to friendship and willingness to care about her friend or ex best friend. People like her are the people who help friends out of domestic violence or toxic relationships. I did have huge respect for her determination.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to mention it here:Shadows Reel by C.J. Box. This is the 22nd mystery in the Joe Pickett series by C.J. Box. Joe Picket is a game warden in Wyoming. His wife, Mary Beth, is the librarian at the local library. One morning Mary Beth discovers a package on the steps of the library, which, upon opening it, contains a… વધુ prominent Nazi’s photo album from the World War II era. Thus begins the adventure as a couple of unsavory characters appear on the scene, in search of said photo album. Even though this book is not my usual (or most favorite) genre, I really enjoyed reading it. The story is quite compelling.

NAME: Jaime Angell
CONTENT: Mixed feelings about this book. Since the perspective changes from character to character and the setting changes, I found myself having a hard time sometimes remembering which character it was and when it was… વધુ happening. I kept mixing up the two boys. There is some beautiful writing in it and it has a very touching ending which is why I’m giving it four stars and not three. But it’s a very heavy story!

NAME: Susan Henkel Schofield
CONTENT: Here is what I read in October.  The Winners was an amazing conclusion to the Beartown trilogy.  I envy the reader who will read all three books consecutively.  Mad Honey was another very good book from Jodi… વધુ Picoult.  The Man Who Died Twice is the second book in the Thursday Murder Club series and was just as entertaining as the first book.  Daisy Darker was a great thriller with some surprising twists.  Three Things About Elsie was okay but I wouldn’t go out of my way to read it.  I’m Glad My Mom Died was an excellent memoir about Jennette McCurdy’s life as a child actress and her relationship with her mother.  I also started but did not finish The Passenger by Cormac McCarthy - it was nothing like the description and I gave up after I read about a third of the book. The Winners - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Mad Honey - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Man Who Died Twice - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ I’m Glad My Mom Died - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Daisy Darker - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Three Things About Elsie - ⭐️⭐️⭐️

NAME: Kathyrn Goecke
CONTENT: 5 Stars I just finished reading my advance copy of Mad Honey by Jodi Picoult & Jennifer Finney Boylan. These two authors writing together was seamless. At the end of the book, they described their process that… વધુ made it work. This book is planned for release in Oct. Wow, just wow...Picoult at her best! It is a mystery revolving around a murder, add in domestic abuse, teen bullying & other very sensitive subject matter of today in need of a voice. It will be controversial, that is what Picoult does best! There is a twist half way through that no way could I see coming & also a surprise ending. What I really loved about this book was all the detail about beekeeping! Intricate details, reminded me of the Where the Crawdads Sing book. Her definition of "mad honey" summed up the book. Then there were the recipes at the end! If you are a Jodi Picoult fan, this is an excellent read❗💛📖

CONTENT: In The House Next Door, Anne Rivers Siddons depicts an idyllic upper middle class neighborhood in the 1970s where every household conforms to expected standards of politeness, neighborliness, and moral/economic superiority, each family within the 'acceptable' (to them) range of diversity but oblivious to how their ignorance reflects classism,… વધુ racism, and other social biases. The protagonist and her husband work their jobs, create an Eden in their yard, and drink their martinis, often with neighbors who pop by. For years they've enjoyed the privacy and solitude afforded by the wild, undeveloped lot next door. When a new family buys the lot and builds an incredible modern house designed by a… વધુ

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: I understand the author's desire to increase representation of Chinese folklore, but I really disliked this book. It does not portray Chinese people in a positive light. The characters come off as prejudicial,… વધુ misogynistic, judgemental, and conforming to Chinese stereotypes. The author does include a bit about the oppression and abuse of Chinese immigrants, but authors Lisa Lee and Grace Lin do a much better job of connecting readers with the plight of Chinese immigrants and refugees. This author relied heavily on stories heard as a teen and his own research, and boy did he include every single explanation and definition needed to define certain beliefs, spirits, spiritual practices, Chinese… વધુ

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: This book was a 5/5 for me. It’s is firstly, a great mystery/thriller told in two timelines narrated by two female characters and a podcast sprinkled in. It’s quick paced and entirely engaging. I read it in one… વધુ day because I was riveted. AND, the theme can be triggering for some.I learned so much about the judicial system and rape cases. The legal difference between rape, sexual assault and sexual battery. What is entailed in a rape kit. The victims of rape stand trial and relive their trauma to be judged but the accused never has to testify. A literal he said versus she said and which legal counsel brings the most convincing specialists. And the politics of rape, how that plays into so much… વધુ

NAME: Collette Powers Knight
CONTENT: It always surprises  me to learn how naive I am in regards to American history. I learned about the Tuskegee experiments on Black men when I was in college. I had no idea about the history mentioned in Take My… વધુ Hand by Dolen Perkins-Valdez. My two youngest kids currently attend HBCUs, one of which is a student at Alabama State University. My husband and I were stationed twice in Montgomery Alabama. This book addresses history rarely talked about and is absolutely brilliant and should be made into a movie. Part of me wonders why this book hasn’t received the attention I feel it deserves. But then I remember the issues America has with wanting to bury certain history. Perhaps it is just too painful?

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: Such a creepy story. And I never figured out anything until the author revealed it. There were times where I thought "is this like The Sixth Sense?" or 'The Others?" and there were scenes that conjured up… વધુ visions of "The Changeling". On page 328 I had to take a 20 minute break because my nerves couldn't handle anymore. Definitely twisty. The violence is never described nor are the wounds but ya just know it's bad. It's hard to recommend these kinds of books because of the nature/topic. If this is your kind of thing though, it's a spectacular thriller. I'm thinking Stephen King would approve of this novel.

NAME: Kathyrn Goecke
CONTENT: It Starts With Us by Colleen Hoover, 5 stars❗This is the sequel from It Ends With Us. The story of Lily & her baby Emerson & the strength it takes to break the cycle of domestic violence. Even though they are… વધુ divorced, Ryle is still involved as the father of baby Emerson & he still has his violent outbursts. Atlas re-enters Lily's life which complicates all their lives. Atlas discovers he has a brother & that storyline with the abusive mother & new found brother is heartwrenching. This book was uplifting for me, to see the protagonist rise above to break the cycle of violence that almost destroyed her.  "He’s a broken man, but he isn’t broken because of me. He was broken before he met me. Sometimes people think if they love a broken person enough, they can be what finally repairs them, but the problem with that is the other person just ends up broken, too."

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read that you may like: "French Braid" by Anne Tyler.  Anne Tyler may have a stellar reputation as a novelist, given her Pulitzer Prize, but French Braid left me feeling that this book and the writer thereof achieved a slightly less than remarkable result.  The Garrett family has its ups and downs as all families do, and that… વધુ is the crux of this story.  The interesting part, for me, was the explanation by the son, David, that revealed how the author came up with the title for the book:  “Families are like the French braids that left their daughter’s hair in waves even after she undid them, David tells his wife: ‘You’re never really free; the ripples are crimped in forever.’”

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: Nan Sparrow still remembers the chimney sweep who loved her, kept her alive with hope & sacrifice, and then left her behind with a bit of coal to keep her warm. A vulnerable little girl but highly skilled… વધુ sweep, she must indenture herself to a master sweep in order to work for her survival. He feeds her gruel & provides a hard coal bin in which she & the other children sleep after long days climbing & cleaning in dangerous conditions. These children live both together & in isolation, pitted against each other in cruel competitions for food & praise & reluctant to form bonds that might be destroyed in one perilous instant. Through it all, Nan's gift of coal & her nightly dream memories from… વધુ

NAME: Zoey Zhou
CONTENT: I LOVE this book!!!  A friend recommended that I read “The Water Tree Way” by Ruth Mendelson when I felt a need to press "reset" on my life.  Things felt very chaotic as I approached my college graduation.  It… વધુ was a time full of confusion and uncertainty. I doubted myself for having the courage to meet the challenges when pursuing my dreams in a troubled world. I really needed to experience some clarity and inspiration. All this came in the form of meeting "Jai"-- the little girl from “The Water Tree Way."  Jai took me on a page-turning adventure of self-discovery where I learned that there are risks to take, promises to keep, and temptations to resist in order to be who I am. After finishing the book, I  felt something had changed in my deep down.  The little ‘Jai’ inside of me reminds me of what matters and what doesn’t. I feel calmer,  happier and empowered!  This book is for the child within us all! Thank you, Jai!!!

NAME: Melinda Wenberg
CONTENT: I'm OBSESSED with this book! I LOVE full-length paranormal romance! You saw it coming. You knew the day would come when the three of them would have to come together and face their fate. The Triplet Kings have… વધુ been waiting for a long time, and now it's time for them to step out of the shadows and into the limelight—a place that they've always deserved. What they didn't know when they find their mate, is that they'd have the same one. Will they fight for the right to mate her, or will they learn to share? Get it here: Getbook.at/ftttk
