NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: The Nightmare Man captures the vivid hellscapes and terrors meant to remain imprisoned within your dreams and releases them into a world grown complacent with contentment. Imagine your own nightmares newly born… વધુ with one purpose--to find and destroy their maker--and you might suffer an ounce of the terror bound between these covers. I promise you'll turn pages with dread and eagerness, and you might have trouble sleeping--I did! If I have any criticism at all, it's that there are some questions still left unanswered. Questions like WHY? and HOW!? and WHY!?, but honestly, I'm not sure it would be better if they had been! I look forward to more terrifying tales from J.H. Markert! I read this as an ARC from NetGalley and was very pleasantly surprised at how much I liked it! This is my first ARC. I wish I could talk about it with others! #everyreaderneedsabookclub

NAME: Julie Ling
CONTENT: You know that friend who always has a new book to recommend? The one who's always talking about how good it is, but you never have time to read it? That friend is me. I'm here to tell you about the new book:… વધુ Mated to the Enemy. It's a prequel in the Royal Mates Series, and I think it's going to change your life.  It's a dark paranormal romance novella that takes place before the events of her first novel, Fated to the Triplet Kings, which was one of those books that just blew your mind. If you haven't read it yet, go do it now! Seriously—you won't regret it. Anyway, back to Mated to the Enemy: This story follows the rogue werewolf Alicia as she falls in love with her enemy. It's full of action and adventure and a lot of twists and turns along the way—so much so that the ending had me gasping for air when I read it (and it has been years since that happened).  Mated to the Enemy is available at Amazon. Grab it here: Mybook.to/mtte #MonsterRomance #shifterromance #paranormalromance #spicybookrecs #spicybooktok #steamybook #enemiestolovers #enemiestoloversromance #StephanieNoircentBooks

NAME: Laura Cantu-Lopez
CONTENT: Hi! I run an in-person book club. We recently had a few guys join. We had 3 guys attend the meeting for The Lincoln Highway and one guy that attended for the book Severance by Ling Ma.   I'm putting together our books for 2023.  I would like to add a few books that might interest the guys in the group.  I did read Hail Mary Project by Andrew Weir… વધુ and I liked it but some of the scientific/space stuff was a bit much.    Does anyone have any suggestions on books that would interest both guys and ladies?  Thank you very much. update:  Wow! Thanks for the big responses and suggestions.  I have a lot of looking up to do on the books that were suggested.  Just to let you know, I have asked for suggestions (in person and on my site) and so far none of the guys have offered up suggestions.  I also ask for book recommendations all the time from the ladies and only get a few.  Those books suggested are added to the list.  I come up with the rest of the books for the year.   But again, thanks for your assistance!

NAME: Trisha Power
CONTENT: The Winners by Frederick Backman.  Only Frederick Backman would keep my attention for nearly 700 pages.  We meet them all and fall in love with them again.  This book is just brilliant and the stories of all our beartown favourites conclude.  It will make you laugh, make you cry but most of all it feels like a big hug - 🥰🥰

NAME: Lynn Gray
CONTENT: I just finished this book. What an experience! First, if you have a teenager in your life who is wondering/questioning/searching for meaning, YOU must read this book. Second, because it is a frequently banned… વધુ book in high school libraries, speak up for it’s worth. The central quote is “How do we get out of this labyrinth of suffering?” Don’t you want to know the answer to that? And don’t you think every teenager needs as much help as possible finding that answer too?

NAME: Kathyrn Goecke
CONTENT: You Are My Sunshine, a laugh-out-loud funny true story of a loving relationship, a grand adventure, and a promise kept. Sean Dietrich is a fav author & blogger of mine. I love his tribute to his wife, Jamie.  I… વધુ followed his daily column while they were riding the Appalachian Trail & now I really know how grueling those 350 miles really were! Sean makes you cry & laugh, he is witty & he is the real deal southern born gentleman, well known as Sean of the South.  I love this book for many reasons but hope & resilience is what stands out & I love them both for their love & devotion to each other. Sean just hit another home run! 💯

NAME: Debbie Watson
CONTENT: 🎧🎙️𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑵𝑬: 𝑩𝑶𝑶𝑲 𝑶𝑵𝑬    𝑭𝑶𝑹𝑩𝑰𝑫𝑫𝑬𝑵 𝑳𝑶𝑽𝑬 𝑺𝑬𝑹𝑰𝑬𝑺                    𝑨𝑼𝑫𝑰𝑶 𝑩𝑶𝑶𝑲 🎧🎙️ 𝑩𝒚 ~ 𝑨𝒏𝒈𝒆𝒍 𝑹𝒐𝒔𝒆// 𝑴𝒂𝒅𝒊𝒔𝒐𝒏 𝑷𝒂𝒓𝒌 #𝑫𝒂𝒓𝒌𝑹𝒐𝒎𝒂𝒏𝒄𝒆 🖤  Eleven-year-old Madison suspiciously eyed the handsome fourteen-year- old boy—Joseph,… વધુ AKA “Tiny”—who casually puffed on a joint. His heroin-addicted father dropped him on her doorstep, claiming the two shared a mother. Eager to prove him wrong, Madison took him inside their tattered home to introduce him to her mother. There, in that tiny trailer, the pair looked at Madison’s strung out mother and realized the only way to survive was by leaning on each other. Her mother’s nonstop string of Johns. Scraping by for food. Witnessing horrors no children their age ever… વધુ

CONTENT: Riley Sager's Home Before Dark will keep you guessing right up to the neat-as-a-bow ending. It features two storylines, the written account of what the protagonist's father claims is the truth of their time… વધુ living in Bainberry Hall 25 years prior and her modern quest for the real truth because she thinks her dad is a liar. She can't believe the house really was haunted, so when she inherits the home after her father's death, she moves back in. This story will keep you turning pages and questioning what you think you know along the way.

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: In Daphne du Maurier's Rebecca, the second Mrs. Maxim de Winter lives in Rebecca's shadow, dwarfed by her grandness, her magnanimity, her perfection, her beauty. She wants to be all that is expected of her, but… વધુ she is haunted by Rebecca, who seems to have excelled at everything. Thrust into Rebecca's position at the Manderley estate, the otherwise nameless Mrs. de Winter moves through Rebecca's routines, inadequately filling her shoes. Rebecca's shadow lurks, but truly it is Mrs. de Winter's own feelings of insufficiency and insecurity that consume her. The mystery of Rebecca-- her person, her life, her death-- and Max's silence about it all compounds these feelings. Haunted by Rebecca's death, Max detaches from the living, trying to ignore the past but unable to truly live in the present. He struggles to establish an honest and vulnerable relationship with his new wife, further driving her into the shadows of doubt and inadequacy. Ultimately, Du Maurier successfully explores how people become lost in despair--despair over loss, despair over guilt, despair over failure.

NAME: Susan Henkel Schofield
CONTENT: Here is what I read in September.  The Family Remains was a great sequel to The Family Upstairs.  I loved Britt-Marie Was Here and can’t believe I hadn’t read it sooner.  The Family Game was twisty and fun… વધુ thriller.  The Thursday Murder Club was such a fun read - I can’t wait to read the rest of the series.  The House Party was an okay domestic suspense - I wouldn’t go out of my way to read.  All the Lies They Did Not Tell was interesting account the Satanic Panic in Italy in the 90s. I didn’t love Our Wives Under the Sea even though it was very well written - I don’t know who the target audience is and it left me with way too many questions.  I didn’t really care for All That’s Left Unsaid - it was slow and depressing. Britt-Marie Was Here - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Family Game - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️1/2 The Family Remains - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Thursday Murder Club - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Our Wives Under the Sea - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ All the Lies They Did Not Tell - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The House Party - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ All That’s Left Unsaid - ⭐️⭐️1/2

NAME: Jennifer Murdoch Martucci
CONTENT: I just finished reading “The Healing Year” by Christine Hunt. It is such a great story, that is so beautifully written. The heroine, Abigail Gerre, is someone I couldn’t help but find myself rooting for and… વધુ admiring for her tenacity and resiliency. I felt as if she was a kindred spirit, who evoked character traits of both Jo March of Little Women and Elizabeth Bennet of Pride and Prejudice.  The story harkens back in time to a post-Civil War Virginia during an outbreak of Scarlet Fever. The characters are so well written, that you feel as if you know them personally. I had a hard time putting it down and honestly, it is the kind of book that you are sad when you finish because you don’t want it to end.  I highly recommend it! I loved it! https://read.amazon.com/kp/embed?asin=B0BD5KG6T7&preview=newtab&linkCode=kpe&ref_=cm_sw_r_kb_dp_72ZXA18ZR9EWQJ4K2ZXM

Another page turner from one of the best mystery writers out there!

CONTENT: I Am Kitty: An Exciting Story for Children 8-12 About Facing Fears and Being YourselfGender Neutral Catby S. J. Riding  (Author)Book Link: https://amzn.to/3fsQENyStray kitten Kitty faces fears and uncertainty… વધુ when humans rescue him from a life in the wild. He is placed in a new home with the grumpy house cat Taz, but as often happens with adoptive families, acceptance doesn’t happen quickly. When Taz is taken to a cattery, Kitty sets out on a dangerous journey to rescue him, with the hope of winning Taz’s approval. He is helped by the local, feared black cat Mr Black, and his best friend Biskitt, the female cat who lives next door.Wherever Kitty goes he is mistaken for a female cat, but Kitty doesn’t care if he’s male or female, he just wants to be a cat.

NAME: Ka Saelee
CONTENT: Reading the introduction to this book and it’s so good! War should be a last resort and it’s purpose is to bring about peace so people can live in peace —away from wickedness.  I Haven’t got to the 13 chapters… વધુ that Sun Tzu wrote but he was an unknown man who loved peace and was scholar with military experience enough for Ho Lu King of Wu to ask him to write a military treatise. Anyone who followed Sun Tzu The Art of War won the war and anyone who didn’t lost. The Chinese scholars throughout Chinese history plagiarized, added to or couldn’t do justice to Sun Tzu work. Some claim to be his descendants even though it was unknown who and if Sun Tzu was his real name.  Dr. Lionel  Giles did a good job at the introduction of this book. I can’t wait to read the 13 chapters. This a reread for me as I read it when I was high school when it was popular book and didn’t really know it’s significance . Rereading again at 38 is a whole new experience. I am so privileged to read this masterpiece.

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: Widely regarded as the first horror story, this may have been intended to horrify British adherents to the line of succession and Catholic piety, as much of the horror springs from Manfred's corruption, greed,… વધુ disrespect for the "will of God," and usurpation of the royal family of Otranto. As a modern progressive, I felt more terror from the patriarchal and religious control of women's bodies and choices. One of the most terrifying scenes is at the beginning when the elderly Manfred attempts to force the young Isabella to marry him, and because of his powerful position, nearly succeeds! Scary indeed! The performer of this audiobook is amazing and really helped me to enjoy this story more than I might have otherwise.

CONTENT: This book left me very glad I was born in the time period that I was meant to be in. I always struggle with understanding how women can live in the “shadows” of their husbands and their husbands expecting them… વધુ to do so. I have admired Einstein’s ability to overcome learning disabilities and to hold his own in the scientific community but now I know that he most likely had a ton of help from his first wife and it saddens me that he didn’t recognize her for it. Although this book is fiction, it does follow letters that were written by the couple. This would be a fantastic book for discussion.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to mention to you:The Summer Wives by Beatriz Williams. I love, love, love Beatriz Williams’ historical novels! And The Summer Wives did not disappoint, not one iota! With alternating timelines between 1930 and 1969, she captures the lifestyle of the elegant summer residents of Winthrop Island in Long Island Sound… વધુ as it collides with the lifestyle of the working-class year-around residents of the island, descendants of Portuguese fishermen. Of course, Miranda Schuyler, stepdaughter of one of the summer residents, falls in love with Joseph Vargas, the son of the keeper of the local lighthouse. And thus begins the drama that turns this novel into one of intrigue and romance, enough to keep the reader eagerly turning the pages until the end.

NAME: Bhavani Sundaram
CONTENT: have all grown up hearing about “Pandora’s Box” from childhood and that box has always made us curious about the contents inside the box, making us wish many a times for a box like that to lock up our secrets,… વધુ feelings, emotions, and keep them away from everyone’s reach. The stories hidden in these “Pandora’s Box” have the same emotions, feelings, secrets and will give the readers a thrill, a joy, some sadness, some smiles and will may their journey easier and happier. These stories have been compiled, some written by me, some taken from internet, and some shared by some friends…they all have one aim in the end to make your understanding of life’s journey easier and I hope the same will be shared by you with your friends. Personally, I always believed in “fairy tales” and I feel stories have a way of touching the hearts of hundreds, reaching out to many for whom these stories act as the medicine of life.

It's reading as though the author is using his father's words verbatim.

NAME: Christeen Fayek
CONTENT: I believe it is one of her best books. The story is full of ups and downs . It is so real story full of wisdom. Even the strongest relations can fall apart with the avoidance challenge. If I avoided to say and… વધુ show what u feel or why you devastated about. A tall wall will be build separating you from your loved ones. And if both of you gave up on each other at the same time, your marriage will fall apart. I have highlighted many statement of this read. Well done Colleen, you have done it again to me. You made me fall in love with ur books one more time.

NAME: Sandra Shanti Mistretta
CONTENT: It amazes me how an author can take a subject about which he or she knows very little, and through hard work and research, create a fascinating book which teaches the reader something new. Jodi Picoult also… વધુ does this beautifully.  I never thought about how memories and past experiences from my ancestors could influence me. Even ancestors whom we never knew have affected our gene makeup. Epigenetic inheritance turns past experiences of my ancestors to manifest in mine and can shape my children and grandchildren. It was intriguing to read about scientific experiments which show examples of this. Julie Clark tells a heartwarming story through a genetic scientist's viewpoint  of a mother with abandonment issues who uses a sperm donor to have a child, so she is unencumbered by having a father present in the child's life.  I learned so much from this book and I hope to keep it in my memories.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book, enjoyed it, and want to recommend it to you:Lessons in Chemistry by Bonnie Garmus. I’m not even remotely interested in chemistry and never have been. But this book captured my heart almost immediately. From the dog, named Six-Thirty, with a vocabulary of 600+ words, to the precocious daughter, Mad (short for Madeline), to the… વધુ protagonist, Elizabeth Zott, scientist extraordinaire, who is overlooked as a woman and receives no credit for her smartness (her work is credited to her male counterpart), this story rollicks along, carrying the reader to new heights of respect for a woman of courage who is not afraid to stand up for herself, in spite of everything! The fact that Elizabeth can sell her chemical knowledge and make it interesting to the general public through a cooking show on television is testimony to her intelligence and her dedication to her profession. This may be Bonnie Garmus’s first book of fiction, but it surely will not be her last.

I mean I wanna see how their adapt in the new world but you know what always happen..less than 50 Pages and the MC turn into Co*kDigger… વધુ especially when a MALE officialy Appears for example Dragon Marked..the premise Is very promising about A Sister separate between world and got reunited..But again less than 50 page it turn into Co*kDigger..i hoping to see the complex conflict between them like In The NETFLIX Series Of ARCANE..

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: In Whisper Down the Lane, a 5-year-old boy with a grand imagination and a desire to tell the adults around him what he thinks they want to hear sets off a panic about Satanists in his community. Now he's an… વધુ adult and the Satanists have come for him... or have they? Is his childhood story really true, and has he become the monster he created? As he loses his friendships, his loved ones, and his reputation, he begins to lose his grip on reality. Will he be able to grasp it again before it's too late? This story had my stomach in knots. We know how easily the mob of humanity can be stirred up to attack a perceived monster with irreparable consequences. Often the true horror is that once a story is out there, the truth can never set the "monster" free again.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: Wow! I loved the plot twist at the end of the story that I didn’t see coming. “The Good Sister” is the story of fraternal twin sisters Fern and Rose. The story is told with an alternating narrative with Fern as… વધુ the main character, who is on the spectrum, taking place in the present. Rose’s story is told through her diary which is riddled with tales of an “apparently” dysfunctional life growing up with their mother. When Rose reveals she cannot get pregnant, Fern thinks she has a great solution. But over time, things begin to unravel and both sisters might not see each other for who they are. The author creates a psychological drama as she weaves the intertwining lives of these two characters, past and present. If you enjoy a fast moving plot with unexpected twists and turns, this is the book for you.  Thank you to The Book Club Cookbook where I received this book from the monthly book giveaway.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to recommend it here:I Am Not Who You Think I Am by Eric Rickstad. This book was my book club’s selection for September. Wayland Maynard is eight years old when he witnesses his father’s self-inflicted death and finds a hand-written note that says “I am not who you think I am.”  Over the years Wayland begins to… વધુ experience doubts that the man he saw dying was his father. He has never shown the note to anyone, and he engages in investigating whether the handwriting on the note is indeed his father’s.  This is a dark story with a lot of twists and turns that may or may not intrigue the reader. In fact, there are aspects of the story that, in going unresolved, caused me to lower my overall appreciation of the book.

NAME: Jennifer Namtze Helmen
CONTENT: Babysitter by Joyce Carol OatesWOW.  I tore through this in two days.  It was enthralling, horrifying, soulless.  Not easy to read as it deals with child serial killer, pedophilia, rape, racial inequality and marital discord.  It's like the veritable "train wreck";  You want to avert your eyes but you can't.  I can't remember the last book that filled me with such tension.  Please read it so we can talk about it!  I have so many comments and questions.  :)

But even within this society of "outsiders," there are those who try to impose their personal standards of who & what is acceptable, ultimately succumbing to the same injustices they escaped.​ 4 ⭐s ​"Timebox" by Monáe and Eve L. NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: Our book club just finished reading “The Magnificent Lives of Marjorie Post” by Allison Pataki. None of us was aware of the story behind Post Cereal Grape-Nuts. Marjorie and her dad, Charles Post, were way… વધુ ahead of their time in that he changed the breakfast lives for Americans and Marjorie gave us frozen foods.  A true rags to riches story. Marjorie LRD an incredibly glamorous life, yet gave so much to help others. She built Mar-a-Lago and so many buildings and institutions are in existence because of her. Unfortunately, she was unable to find the one thing she truly wanted, a stable relationship with a partner who truly cared and loved her. Our book club had a fabulous discussion and I highly recommend this book.  Book Club Menu: Grape-Nuts Crusted Chicken Breasts Birdseye Loaded Baked Potatoes Birdseye Broccoli and Carrots Grape-Nuts Cookies

CONTENT: WHO EXACTLY IS THE ONE-EYED KING?‘In The Court of the One-Eyed King’ is an existentialist novella from Buck Starmer  through which he explores the path to freedom and wholeness in the face of the ordinary… વધુ sensory world. He does so in a manner that is reminiscent of the likes of Sartre, Camus, Wilson and Salinger, dealing a “cutting edge” to the modern world via a character that is disaffected and pessimistic. Typically, Starmer also turns his attention to one of his frequent bug-bears, the tyranny of experts and those in ‘authority’ who, while they may know a little more than the rest of us, often know nowhere near as much as they claim and are given credit for.Through the dysfunction and… વધુ

NAME: Inia Virg
CONTENT: Following on from a Jodi Piccoult post, what is your favourite JP book and why?  I can't decide between Small Great Things and Lone Wolf. The debates and insight into race and racism in the former and animal behaviour and life/death decisions in the latter were so gripping alongside narrative and plot. They've really the perfect combination of story, character and intellectual engagement. Others of hers I have read have similarities, but none quite so good.

NAME: Nancy A Bekofske
CONTENT: I loved these zany, passionate, intrusive mothers and their rebellious, troubled daughters. I laughed and laughed. The Vietnamese mothers of Little Saigon in Orange County, CA knew hardship and survival.… વધુ Romantic love had little place in their lives. There was the war and starting over in a foreign land, the struggle for financial security. They wanted their American born daughters to have the best, and they were certain they knew what was best for them. Their daughters, although successful in their careers, were unable to find success in love. It was all because their family had been cursed generations ago. They couldn't be happy in love and they couldn't produce a male child. Matriarch Mai… વધુ

NAME: Samuel James
CONTENT: A Town Called Solace by Mary Lawson. I felt this was a great novel for our transition to Fall from Summer! It’s 1972, and we’re off to Ontario, Canada 🇨🇦! In the wake of a missing 16 year old girl, Clara, a cat… વધુ named Moses, Liam, and Elizabeth take center in this drama/mystery novel. 7 year old Clara is the sister of the missing 16 year old. She is also watching her neighbor’s cat, Moses. Clara’s neighbor is Elizabeth who is in the hospital. And unbeknownst to Clara, Liam is moving into Elizabeth’s house. See how they all connect, and the moments that brought them all together. Will the missing girl be found? How does one illicit hope from grief and loss? What kind of new beginnings (or tragic endings) will this small Canadian town bring? See for yourself and check it out☺️ Happy reading all!

NAME: Nicole Pender
CONTENT: Ireland Deckland is a feisty probation officer with a tough exterior and an ass kicking vibe. Regularly putting handcuffs on others has her view of people, and their choices, trending down. She needs a change,… વધુ a life altering change. She has been single for too long and fears that her view of people - and her exterior - is keeping her from her happy ending. Insert Xavier Gold: the city’s most eligible bachelor. The sexy, successful, and wealthier than sin CEO was not looking for anyone to be a fixture in his life, or his bed. But the allure of Ireland, her vibe, her beauty, and her lips - and a woman who wears a badge - has caught Xavier’s undivided attention. Will one chance meeting crack Ireland’s exterior and turn her heart into Gold, or will the threat of the Russian Mob leave her single yet again? Ireland finds herself kidnapped and Xavier will not wait on the red tape required to save her. Xavier enlists help from an unlikely source, but will it be enough to save Ireland? Discover how Ireland finds Gold.

NAME: Larenda Brantley-Hondl
CONTENT: Okay, confession time. I like to read paranormal horror novels. I know 🤦🏽‍♀️. But, I just saw the trailer for Amazon Prime’s adaptation of Grady Hendrix’s My Best Friend’s Exorcism and I am so friggin’ excited! For those who aren’t familiar with Hendrix, he writes what I would call horror humor. There are some frightful things in some of his novels… વધુ but his interjection of humor into those frightful situations is masterful. And, My Best Friend’s Exorcism is one of the best because it draws on ALL the 80s tropes. September 30 can’t get here quick enough! 🤩

NAME: Cheryl Isaac
CONTENT: Finished reading "The Bloomsbury Girls" by Natalie Jenner and I loved it.  It is a follow-up of "The Jane Austin Society" novel and a return of Evie Stone.  "Bloomsbury Books is an old-fashioned new and rare… વધુ book store that has persisted and resisted change for a hundred years, run by men and guided by the general manager's unbreakable fifty-one rules. But in 1950, the world is changing, especially the world of books and publishing, and at Bloomsbury Books, the girls in the shop have plans. As they (Vivien, Grace and Evie)  interact with various literary figures of the time - Daphne Du Maurier, Ellen Doubleday, Sonia Blair (widow of George Orwell), Samuel Beckett, Peggy Guggenheim, and others - these three women with their complex web of relationships, goals and dreams are all working to plot out a future that is richer and more rewarding than anything society will allow."  SO GOOD!

CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and thought you might like:All the Lonely People by Mike Gayle. “Ah, look at all the lonely people; where do they all come from?” As I read this book, the lyrics of the song kept running through my head. Hubert Bird, an 84-year-old Jamaican immigrant living in London for the past 60 years, just wants to be left alone. He’s… વધુ all alone and lonely and he thinks he likes it that way. When his new neighbor, Ashleigh, and her young daughter, Layla, knock on his door one day making friendly overtures to get acquainted, Hubert rebuffs them. When Hubert’s daughter Rose writes to say she’s coming to visit in a few weeks, he panics because he’s been telling Rose stories about… વધુ

NAME: Eisha Sarkar
CONTENT: My reading challenge 2022 is to finish 50 books that have been published/authored/set in 50 different countries. I shall post about the ones I have read, mention the country they are set in and where the author… વધુ is based. Instead of a review, I shall open a random page in the book and quote a line/para. My reviews and ratings are available on Goodreads, for those who wish to know. NAME: Kelly Bush Barrett
CONTENT: A night to remember and never forget.  The Polson Library Association had a fundraising event tonight with author Mark Sullivan - An Evening with Best-Selling Author Mark Sullivan -  at The Barn in Finley… વધુ Point.  I have truly never been this excited about meeting anyone famous.  The book Beneath the Scarlet Sky is in the top three of my all time favorite books.  The Last Green Valley is in my top five.  If you have not read them, you should.  Both stories are real life stories about WWII and will leave a mark on your heart forever.  Special guest was one of the real life characters in the book The Last Green Valley, Bill Martel. The Martel’s story is an epic story of survival during the Nazi’s invasions of WWII and coming to Montana. It was an honor to meet both of these gentlemen and hear their stories.   Truly a night I will never forget.

NAME: Trisha Power
CONTENT: The Queen of Dirt Island by Donal Ryan.   This book is fantastic, I loved every word.  Donal Ryan has the ability to turn the everyday into something brilliant. This books follows 4 generations of woman from… વધુ one family living in a small rural village in Ireland of the 1980s and 90s.  The woman are strong, independent and immensely loving and loyal to each other.  The book also captures rural Ireland of the time (both good and bad) but the women are the stars of the show.

NAME: Teresa Morris- Woodrum
CONTENT: I stumbled across an amazing author and I am absolutely enjoying her writing. I just finished her book “The Forgiving Kind”.  It is a standalone book as are all of her books. Donna Everhart writes stories that… વધુ are all Southern fiction (and deal with tough topics) and they're all a little different. The Education of Dixie Dupree is probably the hardest one to read due to the graphic content, but it was her top selling book until The Saints of Swallow Hill. As to the timeframe of the stories, not all take place in the 50s, but they are considered historical fiction as well because they take place 50+ years ago. For instance, Dixie Dupree is set in 1969. The Road to Bittersweet (based on the 1940 flood in NC) takes place in  . . . haha, you guessed it - 1940. 🙂 The Moonshiner's Daughter. takes place in 1960, and her latest, The Saints of Swallow Hill, takes place in 1932 - during the Depression. Donna Everhart’s first four novels are all coming of age type stories. The Saints of Swallow Hill is not coming of age, but a great story about lost history in the south. The Forgiving Kind

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to recommend it to you:The Investigator by John Sandford. I am a fan of John Sandford’s books, most of which take place in Minnesota and star Lucas Davenport and Virgil Flowers. This new book is the first in which Davenport’s daughter, Letty, is the protagonist. Letty has been well trained by her father in… વધુ investigative skills, so she jumps at the chance to work on a case for the Department of Homeland Security looking into reported thefts of crude oil in Texas. Letty and her partner, John Kaiser, lead the reader on a rip-roaring adventure involving a militia group who are using the proceeds of the stolen oil to purchase black market explosives to do some real terroristic damage. I am finding it hard to put this one down, so I’m reading it in record time. I highly recommend it – another exciting story from John Sandford!

NAME: Mst Joly Khatun
CONTENT: Overkill#1 New York Times bestselling author Sandra Brown delivers a riveting thriller in which a conflict of conscience for a former football star and an ambitious state prosecutor swiftly intensifies into a… વધુ fight for their lives. Former Super Bowl MVP quarterback Zach Bridger hasn’t seen his ex-wife, Rebecca Pratt, for some time—not since their volatile marriage imploded—so he’s shocked to receive a life-altering call about her. Rebecca has been placed on life support after a violent assault, and he—despite their divorce—has medical power-of-attorney. Zach is asked to make an impossible choice: keep her on life support or take her off of it. Buckling under the weight of the responsibility… વધુ

NAME: Mark Swt
CONTENT: Goodbye to LovelyMany mental health problems have a biological correlate, such as changes in brain neurochemistry, but are these changes the cause or the consequence of mental suffering. Sometimes people become… વધુ so accustomed to the things they have to endure, that they can no longer even articulate what is bothering them. To the observer of their condition there may be no apparent discernible cause.Buck Starmer’s book ‘Goodbye to Lovely’ illustrates how suffering can become ‘hard-wired’ when endured for prolonged periods and result in maladaptive coping strategies.Covering a period from the 1960’s to the early twenty-first century, ‘Goodbye to Lovely’ is a true story and includes a final section summarising current theories of ‘domestic violence’ and ‘addiction’.Starmer’s writing is reminiscent of Colin Wilson and J.D. Salinger at their best.

CONTENT: This is, by far, the easiest and happiest 5-star review I’ll give this year! This book is an art lover’s dream! Legendary spy and art restorer Gabriel Allon has finally retired from Israeli intelligence and is… વધુ residing, hopefully quietly, with his wife and children in Venice. Allon will be engaged in the task of art restoration for the Tiepolo Restoration Company of which his wife is the new manager. Surely his days of danger and violence are over. book on SALE!

NAME: Kathyrn Goecke
CONTENT: On Gin Lane by Brooke Lea Foster This started out slow for me & I wasn't sure about it...but it turned out to be a great read❗💯 1957 in the Hamptons, the protagonist, Lee, has a trust fund, a fiance & a summer… વધુ on the beach. But she longs for much more. Her desire to become something more than a rich housewife & our society saying no, especially in the world of the arts. It is a good mystery, I did not figure out "the who done it" & was surprised at the ending. I really loved the time period & struggle for a woman wanting more out of life. 💛📖

NAME: Jordan Michaels
CONTENT: An Oldy but a Goldy! I was on the edge of my seat when I was reading this.  I LOVE this book!  I've read it almost 30 times between a span of 3 years.  Annie Wilkes is definitely my favorite character.  I love… વધુ her obsession with Misery Chastain and the way she was written.  The Dragon Lady was just a whole different style then what I usually read!  The story was amazingly created, the storyline was fabulous.  All in all, I recommend this 100% to anyone. Fun fact: My grandfather gifted me this book and it was the first book I had ever been gifted. It has a special place in my heart as this was also the same year he passed.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to recommend it:Tiny Little Thing by Beatriz Williams. Here’s another engrossing story from Beatriz Williams involving a prominent New England family with political aspirations, very like the Kennedys.  The story is told in alternating chapters, those from 1966 from the viewpoint of Tiny Hardcastle, and those from… વધુ 1964 from the viewpoint of Caspian Harrison, cousin of Frank Hardcastle, Tiny’s husband. Caspian and Tiny share a mutual attraction to one another, but Tiny, being the proper young lady that she is, has promised to marry Frank Hardcastle. The story is further complicated by the fact that Frank is not precisely the man he pretends to be. I found this to be a compelling story to read and stayed up well past my bedtime to finish it.

NAME: Geoff Burke
CONTENT: A must read! 'DEATH & SALVATION' is the sequel to the acclaimed novel 'BETSY ROBERTS'. It is a collection of 8 truly enthralling and gripping stories that tell the tale of real life characters and events set… વધુ against the backdrop of Britain and America in the late 18th century. The stories are full of fascinating details from the period and the characters are brought to life in an authentic way. The reader is transported on a colourful journey from locations such as Lancashire, England to New York and Scotland to Kentucky.. The depictions of the places of that time, carefully researched by the author, enhance the credibility of the stories. Both books are to be found on Amazon.

Please give this a read I have read them 8 times now and they have lost nothing only becoming more vivid with each read. Available on amazon and amazon unlimited.

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: Review of book 2 with book 1 spoiler! .... In book one (Children of Time), humans desperate for survival encountered a human influenced sentient species and tried to destroy it in order to commander its planet,… વધુ but the sentient species took them in and taught them to see others as like themselves and as something beneficial and useful. In this continuation of their story (Children of Ruin), humans and their counterparts once again encounter life, but it is no life they can recognize. Will they be able to communicate and work together, or will one side be destroyed, devoured for the use of the other? Once again, Tchaikovsky challenges human dominance and our practice of taking over instead of playing nice. Through an alien species, he gives us a taste of our own medicine, as we try desperately to make ourselves understood, to be recognized as a sentient species worthy of existence.

NAME: Cheryl Zalk
CONTENT: In 1932 the world was mesmerized by the newspaper reports of the Lindbergh kidnapping. There were rumors, speculation, and worldwide interest in the who, how, and why of the event that carried forward into the… વધુ trial of the accused kidnapper. Author Mariah Fredericks has taken this event and interwoven fact with fiction in her thought-provoking book, The Lindbergh Nanny.  The Lindbergh Nanny offers up the story of the kidnapping of 20 month old Charlie Lindbergh as told through the voice of Betty Gow. Betty Gow comes to New Jersey, and the employ of Charles Lindbergh and Anne Morrow, from Scotland via Detroit in February of 1931. During her time with the family as Charlie’s nurse/nanny, Miss… વધુ

NAME: Vickie Harkness
CONTENT: Great introductory book for older kids without the horrific details.  My 10 year old had to read a non fiction book for summer reading and was fascinated by  Anne Frank and what Jewish people went through. … વધુ Only about 60 pages but enough to bring on great discussions for the both of us, including racism and why it's not okay to hate people because of race, religion, etc. EDIT for those being judgemental.  This book is not from Ann Frank's POV.  The author talks about EVERYTHING surrounding Ann Frank and what was going on.  Ann Franks diary doesn't cover concentration camps or what was going on with other innocent people.  So this book is actually more factual than her diary.  I even learned a few things I didn't know and I have read a lot about the Holocaust and what people went through during that time.  Maybe read the book before making an assumption?

Very well worth reading, and IO am going to go back and read her first novel, whose characters appear in this book also.

NAME: Susan Henkel Schofield
CONTENT: Here is what I read in July.  Lessons in Chemistry was fantastic - smart and funny with a strong female protagonist.  Smells Like Tween Spirit was another hilarious book in the Class Mom series.  Book Lovers,… વધુ The Hotel Nantucket and Vacationland are all perfect summer beach reads.  Stay Awake was a great thriller - fast paced and exciting.  The Summer Place was not my favorite Jennifer Weiner book - it was entertaining enough but some of her other books are better.  The Perfect Neighborhood was a good domestic thriller.  I did not like The Island - the writing was not very good and it was just so unbelievable.  I also didn’t like Bookends - the author was so entitled and elitist and not relatable at all.   Lessons in Chemistry - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Smells Like Tween Spirit - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Hotel Nantucket - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Vacationland - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Book Lovers - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Stay Awake - ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Summer Place - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Perfect Neighborhood - ⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Island - ⭐️⭐️ Bookends: A Memoir of Love, Loss and Literature  - ⭐️⭐️

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to tell you about it:The Bad Angel Brothers by Paul Theroux. This is an interesting character study of two brothers, Cal and Frank Belanger, who grew up in a small New England town where they are locally known as “the Bad Angel Brothers.” Frank, the elder brother, grows up and becomes a powerful lawyer, and Cal, the… વધુ quieter brother, becomes a geologist who travels the world and advises corporate explorers in their search for precious minerals.  Personality-wise, Frank lords it over Cal, from childhood throughout their lives. Cal who is often gone on long exploratory trips makes his home base in their familiar small town, where he continues to be the butt of Frank’s domineering spirit whenever he’s at home. The interchange between these two brothers comprises the story. The story is driven by the reader’s anticipation that Cal, at some point, will react against Frank’s continual interference in his life and affairs. I leave it to you to read this book and decide if the ending fulfills your expectations.

Any strong female characters or empowering messages are welcome 💪🏽, also page-turners and fun summer reads! ☀️

NAME: Keren Nicole Jackson
CONTENT: "The silence of dictatorship, the silence of the closet, as we call it now--all of that is layered and layered like blankets that muffle you until you cannot breathe." The thumb of Uruguay's dictatorship… વધુ crushes freedom and marbles communities with suspicion, silence, and isolation. The chaos of fear and danger overwhelms the city of Montevideo, and it is only by fleeing a day's journey to the shore of Cabo Polonio that our lead characters can shed the weight of oppression and feel free to be themselves, "civilization" juxtaposed with the natural world, the limitations imposed by society with the weightless ease of staying true to one's nature. The fear of dictatorship, of disappearing into … વધુ

NAME: Eisha Sarkar
CONTENT: My reading challenge 2022 is to finish 50 books that have been published/authored/set in 50 different countries. I shall post about the ones I have read, mention the country they are set in and where the author… વધુ is based. Instead of a review, I shall open a random page in the book and quote a line/para. My reviews and ratings are available on Goodreads, for those who wish to know. NAME: Geoff Burke
CONTENT: A must read! 'DEATH & SALVATION' is the sequel to the acclaimed novel 'BETSY ROBERTS'. It is a collection of 8 truly enthralling and gripping stories that tell the tale of real life characters and events set… વધુ against the backdrop of Britain and America in the late 18th century. The stories are full of fascinating details from the period and the characters are brought to life in an authentic way. The reader is transported on a colourful journey from locations such as Lancashire, England to New York and Scotland to Kentucky.. The depictions of the places of that time, carefully researched by the author, enhance the credibility of the stories. Both books are to be found on Amazon.

Once I started reading, I was unable to put this book down. Kristina McMorris’ ability to create relatable characters had this reader crying with them, feeling their anxiety, and experiencing emotions that these fictional characters surely would have been feeling. While I often complain about a lack of character development in the work of some authors, Ms. McMorris has thoroughly done her research and spent time creating characters with depth and a detailed backstory to… વધુ

NAME: Sachi Ito
CONTENT: I hope this fits the bill for this group. It is self development related.  Dr. Nicole LePera published her book, “How To Do The Work.” Doing the work means embarking on a journey of transformative healing. This… વધુ journey doesn’t end, though; the work is never done. There are so many ideas that I want to share with you from this book. But here are just a few of the main key points: Healing Is A Conscious Effort  We Need To Widen The Definition Of Trauma Many of us think of trauma as a point or several points that basically destroy a person’s life.  But what happens if a person can’t admit that any part of their childhood or life has been damaging? This doesn’t mean that trauma wasn’t present.… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to recommend:Brooklyn by Colm Toibin.  This is a low-key story about a young Irish girl, Eilis Lacey, who immigrates to America in the early 1950’s. Eilis is a young Irish lass with expectations of growing up, working a few years (she’s finished her training to become a skilled bookkeeper), marrying an Irish… વધુ fellow and raising a family in the same Irish village in which she grew up and living her life among her familiar friends and family. When Eilis is unable to find employment in Ireland, her village priest and her mother persuade her to immigrate to America where opportunities abound. I really enjoyed this story about Eilis’s life in America, her romance with Tony, her return to Ireland when her mother is dying, and her quandary as to how to live her life with the feeling of responsibility to return to New York and her husband, Tony, and the urge she feels to remain in Ireland. A very readable story, and one I feel comfortable recommending.

NAME: Kim Moore Wakefield
CONTENT: What are some of your favorite Southern Gothic books?

NAME: Kim Bakayoko
CONTENT: Just finished this audio book.  Definitely recommend. I loved this story Summary: After Tova Sullivan’s husband died, she began working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium, mopping floors and tidying up.… વધુ Keeping busy has always helped her cope, which she’s been doing since her eighteen-year-old son, Erik, mysteriously vanished on a boat in Puget Sound over thirty years ago. Tova becomes acquainted with curmudgeonly Marcellus, a giant Pacific octopus living at the aquarium. Marcellus knows more than anyone can imagine but wouldn’t dream of lifting one of his eight arms for his human captors—until he forms a remarkable friendship with Tova. Ever the detective, Marcellus deduces what happened the night Tova’s son disappeared. And now Marcellus must use every trick his old invertebrate body can muster to unearth the truth for her before it’s too late.  Shelby Van Pelt’s debut novel is a gentle reminder that sometimes taking a hard look at the past can help uncover a future that once felt impossible.

CONTENT: Summer is finally here! And with it—fingers crossed—three months of blissful leisure reading for off-duty students. Their answers include the usual suspects as well as some fun surprises. If your kids are still looking for a perfect summer read, maybe leave this list (oh so casually) open for them to see.

CONTENT: I thought this book was excellent! With women's rights so much of an issue today, I thought this nonfictional account of one woman's struggles and her incredible strength was very relevant to the times we find… વધુ ourselves in now. It was somewhat of a difficult read, but as I read the book, I was amazed that this was actually a true story!

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: The Clockwork Girl-Anna Mazzola  4 stars (very stingy with my 5 stars) What a surprising  book. I hadn't read anything by this author and was pleasantly surprised.  Historically accurate...except for one error,… વધુ using the terminology of Petrol Blue as a colour of material in the 18th century...  The claustrophobic atmosphere could be felt as well as the empathy with the characters.  The only one I didn't get into was Reinhart...An individual perspective of three women.. each one completely different but with much in common. Freedom. Based on authentic facts although one may think it impossible.  All in all a combination of 'almost' fantasy...thriller and historical fiction.  One could feel the future revolution of Luis XV1 boilng in the not too distant future.  A highly recommendable read and will read more by this author.

CONTENT: I just finished this book and want to recommend it to you:The Judge’s List by John Grisham. John Grisham’s specialty is legal thrillers. This one is definitely a thriller, and the subject is definitely legal – the perpetrator is a judge! If you’re a Grisham follower, you may recall that Lacy Stoltz appeared in another of his thrillers, The Whistler. This is not a courtroom drama like many of Grisham’s stories, but it has enough twists and tricks to keep you turning the pages till the very end.

NAME: Laura Paglia
CONTENT: Hallo! I'm new here and I'm looking for recommendations. I'd like to read more authors who write in: Italian Spanish French German Japanese I love BIG human stories and I'm really not afraid of big books, on… વધુ the contrary! My favorite books when I was younger were The Lord of the Ring trilogy. I've now graduated to such as The Pillars of the Earth, Pachinko, I very much enjoy Isabel Allende. I read a lot in English, but I'd like to expand my horizon to authors in the above languages. Portuguese, Dutch and Scandinavian languages would also do (except Finnish 😅). Thank you for adding me to the group, and thank you for any suggestions!

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and thought it worthy of mentioning here:The Wicked City by Beatriz Williams. Think flappers, bootleggers, prohibition, speakeasies like the Christopher Club in 1920’s New York City, and you’ll catch a glimpse of what this novel is all about. Interspersed with the romp through the ‘20’s though is the present day life of Ella… વધુ Gilbert, who lives in an apartment building adjacent to the former notorious Christopher Club, due to her separation from her wayward husband. It is said that strains of jazz clarinets can be heard through the walls of the laundry room in Ella’s building. There is romance, a cruel stepfather, mad chases through the countryside, and much more activity to compel the reader to keep on truckin’ through this novel. Another very readable story from one of my favorite authors, Beatriz Williams. Hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

NAME: Joseph Carrillo
CONTENT: Read this gem this week. For my inner child and 90's nostalgic needs as a 90's kid. Great reads... I've read 5 of this twisted tale stories and it really does take me back in time with VHS's and the infamous Disney music when a movie was beginning or ending ❤️📚📖

CONTENT: Just finished this one. “Descending Up” by Vladimir Manascurta. I cannot express how much I seriously loved this book; the characters, the plot, the writing. This book had it all in spades. The dark combined… વધુ with the twisted kept me hooked from start to finish. Told from a dual POV, the book paced with plenty of dark and gorey bits along the way kept the tension high. I cried. I actually shed a tear reading this, and not just once! And believe me, that is not something that happens often. This book has all the feels, all the action, all the twists.

CONTENT: I stumbled across this book in Glasgow while travelling. Beautifully researched and written, there are many story lines here that almost could be independent, but when strung together create an intriguing… વધુ mystery about the hero's family and family history. I HIGHLY recommend it."The Sixteen Trees of the Somme is an intricately plotted and enthralling novel by the award-winning author of Norwegian Wood and The Bell in the Lake. An international bestseller and longlisted for the Dublin Literary Prize, it tells the story of Edvard and starts at his family’s tree farm in Norway, where he was raised by his grandfather.The death of Edvard’s parents when he was three has always been a mystery but… વધુ

NAME: Deborah Kravetz
CONTENT: This is one of my two favorite books about WWI, this of from the British point of view, about tactics, failures, individual morale, with an intrepid young woman looking for the body of her fiance after the war.… વધુ Excellent writing and character development, social settings, and a mystery (actually several mysteries).  My other favorite is Sixteen Trees on the Somme by Lars Mytting.

NAME: Michael Lutz
CONTENT: The shortstory "The Fall of the House of Usher" opens with the unnamed narrator arriving at the house of his boyhood friend Roderick Usher. Having received a letter from him complaining of an illness and asking… વધુ for his help. Roderick's symptoms include hypersensitivity and an excessive preoccupation about having a serious illness. It is revealed that Roderick's twin sister, Madeline, is also ill and falls into death-like trances. Roderick tells the narrator that he believes the house he lives in to be sentient, and that this sentience arises from the arrangement of the masonry and vegetation surrounding it ...

NAME: Kamyra L. Harding
CONTENT: 📖 Targeted Teen Booklist Focused on the African American Experience 📚  Juneteenth (June 19th) commemorates the day chattel slavery finally ended in the United States. Considered the oldest African American… વધુ holiday, the celebration dates back to 1865. In 2021, the federal government finally declared it an official federal holiday, giving us all a great opportunity to learn more about African American history and culture. In honor of the holiday, we asked educators, tweens, teens, and a few former teens, to suggest Black books for teens and tweens, ones which focus on an aspect of the African American experience. Here’s what they gave us.

NAME: Miraz Hasan
CONTENT: Title: Beating the Odds In and After Foster and Residential CareThis true story provides teens facts and statistics they must know about succeeding in the child welfare system and strategies that show them how… વધુ to prepare to thrive as adults. The author uses his experiences living in an orphanage, juvenile detention home, mental hospital and residential school for delinquent and foster youth to explain how he beat the odds of ending up in prison or a psych ward or dead on the streets and, instead, turned his life around and took control of his future.Please read the book….Link:  https://rb.gy/jpxfyh#Fostercare #Childwelfare #Fostercarebooks #Fosterkids #Fostercarechilddren#Fosterchild #Fostercaresystem #Fostercarestories #Fosterparents #Fosterparenting#Fosterparentbooks #Amazonkindle #Book #Amazonkindlebook #Kindlebook #Viralbook#ebook

NAME: Michael Lutz
CONTENT: The harsh and freezing cold nature of the Yukon Territory and the Northwest Territories of Canada is the setting of Jack London's novel. "White Fang" – half dog, half wolf – is forced to survive while the 1890s… વધુ Klondike Gold Rush. Somewhere deep inside the heart of this not domesticated creature are memories of love and trust. Will White Fang throw off his independence and his impetuous wildness and start a journey to domestication ...?

NAME: Tina Ross Dalton
CONTENT: If you’re in the mood for a sweet, quick read, I’d like to recommend “Remakably Bright Creatures” by Shelby Van Pelt. Tova spends her evenings cleaning at the local aquarium, and she takes great pride in the… વધુ thorough job she does to keep the place looking pristine. Marcellus the octopus watches Tova, and finds her a fascinating creature. Eventually the two form a sort of friendship, despite Marcellus' grouchy ways. Marcellus knows more about Tova than she realizes, including what happened to her son Erik when he went missing years ago, just after high school graduation. Marcellus decides he has to somehow communicate to Tova what he knows.  This is a sweet book that is surprisingly touching. I really enjoyed it.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: THE MID-YEAR BOOK TAG This is a tag that goes around booktube every June. I modified it a bit, took out a few of the sillier questions, but otherwise thought the answers could be interesting. Answer what you… વધુ want/can, one title or person per question only if possible - and have fun with it! Will post mine in the comments, I guess, soon as I have them, (for anyone interested). 1. What is your favorite book read so far this year? 2. What is your favorite sequel read so far this year? 3. What is a new release you haven't read yet? 4. What is your most anticipated release for the second half of 2022? 5. Biggest disappointment so far this year? 6. What is your biggest surprise so far this year? (Could be good OR bad.) 7. Who is your favorite new author (debut or new to you)? 8. What book made you cry this year? 9. What is a book that made you happy this year? 10. What is your favorite book-to-film (or TV) adaptation so far this year? 11. What is the most beautiful book you bought/received this year? 12. What book do you need to read by the end of the year?

NAME: Margaret Hammond
CONTENT: The Bay: Allie ReynoldsI  have just finished reading The Bay. It is an easy read, light and  quick. This isn’t because the story falls short in any way but it is a  ‘who done it’ book with quick twists and… વધુ turns.The  Bay is the story of young surfers who chose to live their lives in an  ‘alternate way.’ There is an underlying agreement between them that  those very few who chose to go to The Bay – never leave The Bay.This would be an excellent book for the younger reader or readers who love the surfing life.If you are looking for a fast paced, twisting plot of a book this is a good read.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Two books I just read and want to tell you about:Hamnet by Maggie O’Farrell. Maggie O’Farrell is a master of prose. Hamnet is so beautifully written that, even if you knew this was “A Novel of the Plague,” you would find it so poetic and engaging that you would enjoy every moment of the reading of it. The story is really about Agnes, the wife of… વધુ William Shakespeare and mother of Suzanne and twins, Judith and Hamnet. Life in the 16th century is difficult; the black plague is rampant and cures are uncertain at best. Agnes is an herbalist who concocts poultices and potions from the plants and seeds she is constantly gathering, trying to help the sick and wounded in her family and her… વધુ

"You're My Favorite" written by… વધુ Ginny Priem, is her true story of a relationship that Ginny thought was perfect! She loved both Chad and his children and built a life with them that she thought would be her happily ever after. She found out in a heartbreaking way that Chad was not the man that she fell in love with. In this book you get to go through Ginny's whole journey of falling in love with Chad, how she found out who he really was, how she dealt with the situation and how she began to heal her heart. This book has… વધુ

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: The Tiger Queens: the Women of Genghis Khan Stephanie Marie Thornton I  promised to write my opinion after I finished. This book took me a good three weeks to read. 4 stars as I passed the first 25% thinking… વધુ what have I got into...500 pages.  I've read 3 books by Conn Iggulden on Genghis Kahn...and they were  easier for me than this book. I spent a lot of time researching... every two pages.. as there were so many interesting parts..the way of life of the Mongols...what they eat ...what the wore...how they felt and worshipped...incredible.  it's not a difficult book to read but it is extensive as there is no descriptive index apart from the names of the different personalities and their… વધુ

CONTENT: Meg is a con artist with a conscience. She has the remarkable patience and ability to reinvent herself so that she can be exactly who she needs to be, in order to carry out her plans. Each of her cons, however,… વધુ have a deeper purpose than the reader is at first inclined to believe. It’s as though Meg is a modern day Robin Hood, a character with whom the reader can soon empathize. An incident in high school sets her on her path to uphold the “Girl Code” and the reader gets to tag along for the ride. Kat is a journalist who is relegated to writing fluff pieces and peddling them to various publications just to pay the bills. Meanwhile, she is on the hunt for that career-making story that has Meg… વધુ

CONTENT: Moonlight and the Pearler’s Daughter will appeal to readers who enjoy historical fiction, strong female characters, mystery, and adventure. I was delighted by the ‘adventure’ aspect. A hurricane scene was… વધુ particularly well written. I was reminded of a book I loved as a girl about the daughter of a ship’s captain and her adventures across the Southern Pacific. Vividly descriptive writing kept me mesmerized and turning pages! It was an unexpected pleasure to be transported into another world as a young woman stands up to threats from man and nature in this debut novel. Author Lizzie Pook’s career as a travel writer translated beautifully to her novel set in late 19th c Australia’s pearling… વધુ

Those who loved Brilliant Life of Eudora, All the Lonely People, A Man Called Ove, or Have you Seen Luis Vélez would love this. Any recommendations on what to read next ?

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to recommend it:The Lincoln Highway by Amor Towles. As 18-year-old Emmett Watson and his 8-year-old brother, Billy, leave their home in Nebraska after the death of their father and the local banker’s foreclosure on their farm property, their intention is to drive on the Lincoln Highway (U.S 30 to the rest of us) to… વધુ California in search of their mother who left them some years ago. Their journey turns into a convoluted trip, however, with the unexpected appearance of two acquaintances of Emmett’s from the Kansas work farm for juveniles from which he had just been released. The two, Duchess and Wooly, keep things mixed up with diversions to New York to retrieve Wooly’s inheritance, and with Duchess’s absconding with Emmett’s Studebaker, putting Emmett and Billy on a freight train, trying to catch up with their ne’er-do-well friends. It turns into quite an adventure, with little actual travel on the planned route of the Lincoln Highway. I enjoyed this book as I have enjoyed both of Amor Towles’ prior novels: Rules of Civility and A Gentleman in Moscow.

NAME: Eisha Sarkar
CONTENT: My reading challenge 2022 is to finish 50 books that have been published/authored/set in 50 different countries. I shall post about the ones I have read, mention the country they are set in and where the author… વધુ is based. Instead of a review, I shall open a random page in the book and quote a line/para. My reviews and ratings are available on Goodreads, for those who wish to know. Book 25: A Man Called Ove Author: Fredrik Backman (Sweden) 🇸🇪 Genre: Fiction/Novel Set in: Sweden 🇸🇪 Page 286: ‘Ove has a heart problem …’ he begins in an anodyne voice, following this up with a series of terms that no human being with less than ten years of medical training or an entirely unhealthy addiction to certain television series could ever be expected to understand. NAME: Janis Robinson Daly
CONTENT: Does your book club choose non-fiction? Author, Jan Brogan joined us last night for a great discussion of her extensively researched account of racial strife, murder, legal proceedings, and family commitments… વધુ in mid-1970's Boston. The Combat Zone is as gritty, dark, and hideous as the four-block area for which it was named. Which means it's an excellent, well-written book from an author with a journalism background.

NAME: Deb Weber Kiley
CONTENT: After hearing Dolan Perkins-Valdez talk about her book at the Gaithersburg Book Festival recently, I couldn’t wait to begin reading. What an amazing and powerful story of what happened to too many women in the… વધુ 1970s.  The first sentence drew me in and didn’t let go, “A year never passes without me thinking of them.” Now I can’t stop thinking about them.  Family planning clinics took choices away from women, and girls, without their consent and/or full understanding. 5⭐️

NAME: Deb Weber Kiley
CONTENT: As a fan of historical fiction, I enjoyed the story of Eliza Edwards forging a new path as a doctor in the late 1800s in this debut novel, The Unlocked Path by Janis Robinson Daly. For book clubs, there is a… વધુ Reading Group Guide in the back of the book and a Book Club kit on the author's website. This story touches on many female issues of the time, with many continuing even today. Woven throughout the story is how family can make you feel connected and loved, whether it is biological or those people you consider family.  For book clubs, there is a Reading Group Guide in the back and a Book Club kit on the author's website. Thank you Net Galley for the ARC of The Unlocked Path by Janis Robinson Daly in exchange for an honest review.

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Just finished Z: The Life of Zelda Fitzgerald by Therese Anne Fowler  This was an excellent read! I kep wishing, as I read, that Zelda had been born in the current century. Her talents would ordered product hanky been noticed and rewarded far more than they were in her time. As it was, much of f her success was derailed by her husband along with… વધુ his heavy handed ( now out  of date ) rule over her life. I enjoyed the influence and presence of other famous people who were major players in Zelda Fitzgerald’s life: Hemingway, Edith Wharton, Ezra Pound, and many others. Hers was a world filled with people who are only historical ghosts to us today! The background historical details proved interesting as well. Vivid descriptions of WWI, the “Roaring 20s, Prohibition,  Black Friday, snd other notable events brought the narrative alive.  This book is a read that is difficult to put down!

NAME: زراعة الشعر
CONTENT: Dragonfly: A Sean O'Brien Novel Synopsis Expand/Collapse Synopsis Sean O'Brien knows that his close friend, Dave Collins, isn't a man who asks for favors. After three decades as a CIA officer, Collins learned… વધુ self-reliance from the best school in the world — the streets. However, after five years out of the agency, he stops looking over his shoulder. And then the assassinations begin. One by one. Five of the CIA's best former officers. Dave Collins' old colleagues. Local police can't protect retired CIA officers from ghosts of their past. Dave's life is on the line, and they are coming for him. Ghosts don't leave tracks. They leave bodies. But to get close enough to kill Collins, they'll have to get through one man who also learned survival from the streets and combat — Sean O'Brien. Dave Collins has been there for O'Brien. And now it's time to return the favor. https://www.kobo.com/ww/en/ebook/dragonfly-a-sean-o-brien-novel

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: A TRAIN TO MOSCOW by Elena Gorokhova was this month’s book club pick and this book is excellent! This is a well-written story that captures the post WWII political atmospheres in Russia. When this novel begins,… વધુ Sasha is 6 years old and 30 something at the conclusion. Sasha’s first love, Andrei, plays an important role in this story. Sasha’s dream is to become an actress which puts her at odds with family expectations. Andrei has the same determination to move ahead in life, but their paths differ. We found the historical information to be extremely interesting. Items of particular interest were the type of meals that were eaten, the items available to purchase in various cities, the customs… વધુ

NAME: Molly Wheaton Allen
CONTENT: Has anyone read In the Kingdom of Ice? A nonfiction of a late 19th century voyage to the north pole.  Have to admit, it was the title that got my attention. I read a few snippets on several pages to try and get… વધુ a feel for it.  I think it will read more like fiction - at least I hope so.  I don't want to necessarily read history.  Let me know your thoughts. And, I about squealed today when I walked in the bookstore I volunteer at.  Someone donated Amor Towles The Lincoln Highway- a signed copy at that! Guess who owns it now? Working through a seven book series my neighbor gave me to read and then have several more before I get to these.  Happy reading!

NAME: Cheryl Isaac
CONTENT: Another wonderful book of Elenaor Roosevelt's Pack Horse Library Project.  "Thanks to Roosevelt's Kentucky Pack Horse Library Project, Troublesome's got its very own traveling librarian, Cussy Mary Carter.… વધુ Cussy's not only a book woman, however, she's also the last of her kind, her skin a shade of blue unlike most anyone else. Not everyone is keen on Cussy's family or the Library Project, and a Blue is often blamed for any whiff of trouble. If Cussy wants to bring the joy of books to the hill folks, she's going to have to confront prejudice as old as the Appalachias and suspicion as deep as the holler. Inspired by the true blue-skinned people of Kentucky and the brave and dedicated Kentucky Pack Horse library service of the 1930s, The Book Woman of Troublesome Creek is a story of raw courage, fierce strength, and one woman's belief that books can carry us anywhere--even back home."  Loved this book .

NAME: Erica Gelabert
CONTENT: “What you need to do, Byron, is know who you are, and where you are, at all times. This is about you, finding and keeping your center. This is how you take on a wave. Then you might find that you need to… વધુ practice more, or there’s a storm swell coming in, or the wave is simply too much for you. You might even decide that you’re just not cut out for the surfing and that’s all right, too. But you cannot know which of these is true unless you go out there with your head in the right place.This was true of surfing and it was true of life, his ma said.” Highly recommend Black Cake by Charmaine Wilkerson. It’s a such a beautiful novel about a mother’s history and the impact it has on her family. A story of love, forgiveness, and family.

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: I finished The Secret Lives of Codebreakers by Sinclair McKay. It is an excellent read regarding the WWII code breakers based at Bletchley in the UK. Most of the stories in this book have never before been told… વધુ due to the Secrecy Oaths signed by these code breakers before they were allowed to begin working at Bletchley.  The origins of computers snd computer programming are woven throughout. It is amazing to me that I am typing this post on a small handheld cell phone whereas the  first decoder  machines snd, later , computers, were huge, taking up entire rooms! I found this to be a fascinating read!

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and discussed it with my book club this morning.  I think it is worthy of your consideration:The Strawberry Thief by Joanne Harris. If you enjoy stories with a mystical quality, such as Joanne Harris’ Chocolat, this will be a book you will love. Indeed, this is the fourth book of Harris’ in the series of which Chocolat was the… વધુ first.  It features some of the same characters as Chocolat, and I enjoyed it immensely, even though I have not read all of the other books in the series. Vianne Rocher, the chocolatier from Chocolat, is now established in the village of Lansquenet-sous-Tannes and has a young daughter, Rosette, who has her mother’s special qualities but who has not developed the ability to speak. There is a mysterious murder in the background of some of the characters. Reynaud, the village priest, and Roux, the itinerant sailor, are involved in the mystery in ways we must keep reading to discover. I love Joanne Harris’ unique ability to involve the reader in the mystical realism of the lives of her characters.

CONTENT: Tell me please that I'm not only one who struggle with Karin Slaughter The good daughter. This probably was the longest time I spent with a book - 16 days!!. Technically I would say it's a 2 books: one about the two sisters and what's happened to them and other one about the actual main crime. Definitely will not rush back to this author any time soon...

NAME: Cheryl Zalk
CONTENT: The prequel to "A Woman of Substance," "A Man of Honor" by Barbara Taylor Bradford takes the reader back to North Kerry in 1899. Here we are introduced to a young Blackie O'Neill whose sister has recently died… વધુ and who is about to embark on a journey to live with his aunt and uncle in Leeds. This is the backstory fans of the Emma Harte series have been waiting for. Although, I wish there was more meat to this book, it does give insight into what motivates Blackie and how Emma Harte enters into his life. Many questions come up as the story unfolds but remain unanswered at the book's end-- questions that, if they were to be answered, would add a substantial amount of detail to "A Man of Honor." If you've never read "A Woman of Substance," "A Man of Honor" is a good place to dip your toe in and begin your journey. On the other hand, if you have already read "A Woman of Substance," you may find this latest book in the series to be a disappointment and not up to what readers have come to expect from the Emma Harte series. Thank you to St. Martin's Press and Netgalley for the ARC.

NAME: Cheryl Zalk
CONTENT: Meg is a con artist with a conscience. She has the remarkable patience and ability to reinvent herself so that she can be exactly who she needs to be, in order to carry out her plans. Each of her cons, however,… વધુ have a deeper purpose than the reader is at first inclined to believe. It’s as though Meg is a modern day Robin Hood, a character with whom the reader can soon empathize. An incident in high school sets her on her path to uphold the “Girl Code” and the reader gets to tag along for the ride. Kat is a journalist who is relegated to writing fluff pieces and peddling them to various publications just to pay the bills. Meanwhile, she is on the hunt for that career-making story that has Meg… વધુ

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: My currant reads : Our Woman in Moscow by Beatriz Williams  The World Played Chess by Robert Dugoni Both of these books are excellent reads!  The book by Beatriz Williams fits into some of the background from… વધુ my previous read, The Secret Lives of Codebreakers by Sinclair McKay. Within the large group of WWII decoders were a few who became  double agents feeding top secret information to  Germany and Russia. ( Read in both The Secret Lives of Codebreakers and Our Woman in Moscow how Russia became “The Enemy” ).Beatriz Williams’ intriguing story follows these double agents through much of the 20th century.  The World Played Chess by Robert Dugoni  tells the personal stories of the Viet Nam experience through the eyes of several young soldiers.

NAME: Jean Kolinofsky
CONTENT: I was given this book to review from the publisher via NetGalley and I now have another favorite author to add to my list.  The book is one of a kind that made me laugh out loud one minute and tear up the next.… વધુ  Clive is dying of a brain disorder and one of the manifestations of his illness is seeing animals, whether it is the rabbits that filled his kitchen or rats that filled an eatery/bar where he used to play with a band.  His wife is losing patience, his son has been in rehab and his daughter just returned home after failing to show up for medical school.  It is a small town in NH where the ghosts in the local cemetery comment on what is going on, but can not meddle or they may explode.  How the family deals with the stress of the situation and comes together at the end is a wonderful story that I was happy to give 5 stars.

NAME: Cheryl Isaac
CONTENT: I recently finished reading quite a remarkable book - The Personal Librarian by Marie Benedict and Victoria Christopher Murray - a "little-known story of Belle da Costa Greene, J. P. Morgan's personal… વધુ librarian—who became one of the most powerful women in New York despite the dangerous secret she kept in order to make her dreams come true...She was born not Belle da Costa Greene but Belle Marion Greener. She is the daughter of Richard Greener, the first Black graduate of Harvard and a well-known advocate for equality. Belle's complexion isn't dark because of her alleged Portuguese heritage that lets her pass as white—her complexion is dark because she is African American.The Personal Librarian tells the story of an extraordinary woman, famous for her intellect, style, and wit, and shares the lengths to which she must go—for the protection of her family and her legacy—to preserve her carefully crafted white identity in the racist world in which she lives."

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and would like to recommend it:American Princess: A Novel of First Daughter Alice Roosevelt by Stephanie Marie Thornton. Alice Roosevelt is one of a kind! The daughter of that energetic, outspoken, adventuresome President of the United States, Theodore Roosevelt, inherited his verve and zest for life and brandished these… વધુ qualities with fervor. As a young girl, she was labeled “American Princess” by the press. In later years she became known as the “Other Washington Monument.” This historical novel is well researched and very readable. Alice’s adventures and cavorting and her political prowess learned at her father’s knee, all keep the reader going on to find out more. And even as she ages, the story does not let the reader stop rooting for Alice to make it through one more time!

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: Blending fact and fiction, THE CHRISTIE AFFAIR is a wonderfully clever take on Agatha Christie’s mysterious real-life disappearance in 1926 that I enjoyed very much. This story is told from the POV of Nan, the… વધુ mistress of Archie who becomes his second wife. This is a well-written mystery novel, with a bit of romance, and an entertaining take on “what might have happened” during those 11 days. de Gramont does a wonderful job of weaving one thread at a time to her intricate web of love and revenge, betrayal, murder and justice. Great book, highly recommend! I received this book from The Book Club Cookbook’s monthly book giveaway.

CONTENT: Someone mentioned Book Outlet earlier… on here or another page… so I thought I would see what the fuss was about. The selection was ok, not great if you don’t like to may a lot for books (like me). But I did find 13 books that I was interested in reading and only paid $41! 😊

NAME: Wendy Scott
CONTENT: MK Andrews never disappoints! In this, her thirtieth novel, she is on top of her game. This novel showed more depth than previous novels I have read by her and to quote from the book it had, “…more twists and turns than one of those winding staircases in one of Savannah’s famed historic mansions.” The plot just kept thickening as Hattie and her… વધુ father-in-law tried to complete another refurbishing of an old 1930’s beachfront home on Tybee Island.  Not only did this home go back in time so did the driving plot as Hattie gets her fil’s company involved in a reality-type tv possible series. The reader gets old time Tybee Island feel, reminiscence of high school drama, murder, Hollywood drama, romance and home remodeling trials and errors. Fabulous read! Thank you for this free copy of Housewreckers provided by St. Martin’s Press via Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.
