NAME: Katherine Bookss
CONTENT: To immigrants and exiles everywhere, the uprooted, the re-rooted, the rootless, And to the trees we left behind,rooted in our memories … "You think you can leave your native land because so many people have… વધુ done it, so why shouldn’t you? After all, the world is full of immigrants, runaways, exiles. Encouraged, you break free and travel as far as you can, then one day you look back and realize it was coming with you all along, like a shadow. Everywhere we go, it’ll follow us, this city, this island.’" "First-generation immigrants are a species all their own. They wear a lot of beige, grey or brown. Colours that do not stand out. Colours that whisper, never shout. There is a tendency to… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and recommend to you:Shadows of Berlin by David R. Gillham. This is a novel of World War II. The Jewish protagonist, Rachel Perlman, was a child during the war, fleeing or hiding with her mother and her Uncle Fritz. Rachel finally escapes Germany with her Uncle Fritz and arrives in New York City. There she meets and… વધુ marries Aaron Perlman. Her life in America is not normal however as she suffers from guilt feelings resulting from her traumatic life during the holocaust. This story is an intimate portrait of what life was like for the Jewish people in Europe during the holocaust and the toll it took on their lives after the war was over.

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: Such a powerful story. Shocking on so many levels. I found myself confoundedly conflicted many times and angry, disgusted, heartbroken and hopeful. Lots of discussion could happen around this book and the author notes are enlightening. If you're okay with highly sensitive topics/dialogue this novels deserves to be read.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: I received TREASURES of the MEXICAN TABLE by Pati Jinich from The Book Club Cookbook’s monthly book giveaway. This cookbook is truly a treasure to behold! Our book club got together and had a Mexican Fiesta… વધુ Night where each of us made a recipe. Pati explains that each state in Mexico has its own local specialties and there are big differences in the types of foods that people eat in different regions of the country. Each recipe has the historical information and explanations of local customs and traditions along with many beautiful photographs. None of the recipes were difficult to make and all were delicious. I highly recommend adding this cookbook to your collection!

NAME: Kathyrn Goecke
CONTENT: I just finished The Good Son by Jacquelyn Mitchard (who also wrote The Deep End of the Ocean many years ago). This is a domestic mystery/thriller that got my attention from the first sentence..."I was picking… વધુ my son up from the prison gates when I spotted the mother of the girl he murdered". I really enjoy books about redemption & this was satisfying. This book is about family, unconditional love & forgiveness. I gave this book 4 stars because it was slow in the middle & towards the end, but I wanted to know what really happened & I was surprised with the twist! Throughout the entire book I kept thinking what if this was my son ?? 💛📖💯

NAME: Bruce Burton
CONTENT: I enjoyed reading this book a great deal. I thought it was very well written, with an intricate meaningful plot that was well developed and thought provoking. The book raises some significant issues that are… વધુ very relevant to my everyday life, in that, how influenced am I by the thousands of "subliminal messages" I receive every day? I couldn't help but wonder how much of the story is reality and how much is just fiction! Just how much of my life is influenced by all these algorithms? The E.U. recently passed what's called the "Digital Services Act" which makes tech companies more accountable for the content created by users and amplified by their platforms’ algorithms. In effect, it’s the first major attempt to set rules and standards for algorithmic systems in digital media markets.

Then, on the ocean surface, a face appeared. It was that of a young lieutenant, the plane’s bombardier, who was struggling to a life raft and pulling himself aboard. NAME: Margaret Hammond
CONTENT: VANISHED -- Lynda La PlanteThis is a great read. For those of you that have already read the Detective Jack Warr stories it is a must. For others ...it is a stand-alone story as well.It has two murder stories… વધુ as well as a drug operation that runs world-wide. Detective Jack Warr is on the verge of marrying the mother of his beautiful baby daughter and he still finds time to chase down the crooks of the world. Sometimes I find ‘drug stories’ heavy and maybe a little too heavy to follow but not in this book.Great read, I couldn’t stop reading and look forward to the next book in this series soon to be released.

NAME: Karen Inkle
CONTENT: I've recently finished reading these 2 books by J S KENNEDY Green Gryphon and Green Mage. Paranormal, urban fantasy series that delves into the magical world of vampires, dragons, shape shifters where… વધુ everything is not as it seems. The graphic descriptions of characters and the surroundings easily spike your imagination into overdrive and you find yourself pulled right in. A creative plot with suprises and secrets that just keep coming. Strongly recommended. Next one out in Autumn, can't wait!

NAME: Gillian Morrison
CONTENT: Human nature. The consequences of our actions. The reasoning behind the choices we make. “But when I look around, it seems to me that so many of our lives are hampered by a virtue instead.” P. 495 It was an enjoyable read.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just finished reading this book.  Here are my thoughts:Magic Lessons by Alice Hoffman. We’ve all heard about the Salem witch trials in Seventeenth Century America. This book takes place in the late 1600’s and tells the story of Maria Owens, a woman gifted with the “Nameless Art” of healing, also known as “witchcraft.” As the last words of the… વધુ book proclaim: “These are the lessons to be learned: Drink chamomile tea to calm the spirit. Feed a cold and starve a fever. Read as many books as you can. Always choose courage. Never watch another woman burn. Know that love is the only answer.” For me, these words condense into a short paragraph the entire substance of the story. I found myself literally wading through the descriptions of curatives and spells. If you’re interested in witchcraft, this is definitely a book you will want to read.

CONTENT: Good audible book Love biographies just finished Miriam Margolyes its brilliantly funnyGood audible book Love biographies just finished Miriam Margolyes its brilliantly funny

NAME: Jody Carroll
CONTENT: Oh, the tangled webs we weave!!! Great read filled with lies and deceit!!! Another new author for me this year and really liking her!!

NAME: Jean Kolinofsky
CONTENT: Received this from St. Martin’s Press through NetGalley and I can not recommend it highly enough!  John “Lucky” Luckadoo was a pilot for the 100th Bomb Group in WWII.  In his 90s he decided to tell his story… વધુ while he still could.  From his training in the US to his missions over Europe and finally his assignments back home after 25 missions it is a story of fear, courage and teamwork.  As he faced flak and German fighters, you can feel the emotions that he must rein in as he sees the other bombers and the men that he knows perish.  At a time when there is so much division, it was wonderful to read a reminder of what we can do when we work together.  Definitely 5 stars!

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: The Beast's Garden-Kate Forsyth.  I've given it 4 stars.  I can't put my finger on why. The storyline was incredible ..but as Kate Forsyth said in her afterword...she had the maximum respect and doubt about how… વધુ to transmit such a horrific story with the dignity and respect needed....and I could feel it while reading. It was as though she was continuously walking on tenterhooks.  I contrasted all the character information...it was perfect...but they just seem to appear and dissappear...I hardly felt sentiment...just information.  The rest was a brutal love story in terrifying times and from the point of view of Nazis. Many many died plotting against Hitler when they realised that their idol… વધુ

NAME: Nancy Mayville Pacitto
CONTENT: I read a lot. I thought I would try to include a Classic a month.  Over the last six months, I’ve read and enjoyed Austen, Dickens, Steinbeck, and Twain.  I have never tried Faulkner and picked up this one for… વધુ $6 at Indigo.   Admittedly, I’m just one chapter in but….I have to ask.  Is this a case of The Emperor’s New Clothes?  A bunch of people tell us something is “a memorable masterpiece and one of America’s greatest novels” and everyone is supposed to nod and agree?  Did anyone really love this book and if so, why?  What is it that makes it a masterpiece worth reading?   It is rare for me to mark something DNF.  I usually have to know what happened.  In this case, I’m thinking of all the lovely stories out there to be found and think there have to be better options.  Maybe I’ll try Hemingway instead.

I loved her two other books 'A Little Life' as heartbreaking as it is and found 'The People in the Trees' fascinating and interesting. In my opinion she is one of the best writers of our time. This one is a masterpiece!

NAME: Sandy Steckler
CONTENT: The cover of this book caught my eye while volunteering at the library.  It's a gem!  My review is posted on Goodreads but it was more than I had anticipated.   What makes this book unique?  Diversity.  “The… વધુ authors, illustrators, designers, store owners, and bookstagrammers highlighted in this book are all Black, Indigenous, and people of color.”  Furthermore, these individuals lived in “spaces where they were marginalized by a dominant white society.”   By reading the books mentioned inside, the author hopes that the reader walks away with a greater understanding and the desire for better communication. We all desire a great life.   I highly recommend it.

NAME: Tina Ross Dalton
CONTENT: I just finished an excellent book that will be a perfect book club choice. It's full of issues that will spark discussion, and so very well-written. The book is "True Biz" by Sara Novic. True Biz is about a… વધુ girl, Charlie, who is deaf. She has a cochlear implant and has been in mainstream public school for most of her life. Her life in public school was quite frustrating because she couldn't hear to understand what was happening in the classroom. She'd never been taught ASL. But in her sophomore year, she has the opportunity to attend a school for the deaf, where she starts to learn not only ASL, but also deaf history. This book is a genuine work of art. ASL is woven throughout the book--readers will learn about ASL structure and deaf history along with Charlie. But we also learn about Black ASL, eugenics, Martha's Vineyard, Alexander Graham Bell, and many other fascinating aspects of what it means to be deaf. But all that aside, and it is just a really well told story.

Set in Seaside, this is the story of the Dunne family and how they are coping with the brain tumor that has befallen Brian, and how its effects slowly are taking away the Dad, Husband they once knew. CONTENT: I just read this book and enjoyed it:Behind Closed Doors by B.A. Paris. This novel is labeled a thriller, and indeed I suppose it is one. The characters, Grace and Jack, from all appearances, are the perfect young couple. He’s a successful trial attorney who has never lost a case; she’s a wonderful hostess, top notch cook, beautiful, gracious and… વધુ devoted to her sister who suffers from Down syndrome. But the more you read, the more the novel grips you as you discover that all is not as it seems… I highly recommend this one! You may want to read it all in one sitting!

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Vanderbilt by Anderson Cooper is an history of a famous family whose wealthy exploits awed a worldwide audience. Anderson Cooper’s writing style is not limited to “ just the facts.” He frequently adds personal… વધુ asides which give perspective to the actions and habits of the people in his story— his people. ( Cooper is the son of Gloria Vanderbilt). If you like to read history as it plays out in the lives of a larger -than - life family who lived it, you would find this book to be a fascinating read!

CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to recommend:Surviving Savannah by Patti Callahan. Having visited Savannah a few years ago and being particularly interested in this southern city because of the earlier novel Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil by John Berendt, I was pleased to receive an Advance Reader’s Copy of Patti Callahan’s new book… વધુ which just came out on April 5, 2022. This historical novel is divided into two intermittent parts: Savannah in the year 1838 when the steamship Pulaski, carrying wealthy citizens of Savannah up the East Coast for their summer sojourn in Saratoga Springs, New York, sinks in the Atlantic Ocean; and Savannah in the present day when, with the discovery… વધુ

NAME: M.L. Rayner
CONTENT: First off, I have read so many books that are based on historical events of the holocaust. The Tattooist of Auschwitz, Cilka's Journey, Last stop Auschwitz. The list goes on and on. And as heart breaking as… વધુ these stories are, they can sometimes become a little repetitive from a reader’s perspective. I finished Amalie by E.J.Wood and can’t stress enough how refreshing this was to read. It focuses on events of the holocaust, sure. But also so much more, following the main character (Amalie) as she seeks her vengeance towards those who wronged her. To put it simply. It’s not often I throw reviews or recommendations out that are not horror novels. But this was a win for me.  This author knows her history, and writes it in a way that keeps you hooked to the end. If you have an interest in this subject. this book is a must!

Both had more depth than expected from the plot blurbs, excellent reads! 5 stars: The Storyteller by Dave Grohl Razorblade Tears by S.A.Cosby The Violin Conspiracy by Brendan Slocumb The Unsinkable Greta James by Jennifer E. Smith 4 stars: Sons of Brutality by Daniel Jeudy Circus of Wonders by Elizabeth Macneal Crying in H Mart by Michelle Zauner The Swimmers by Julie Otsuka The Younger Wife by Sally Hepworth 3 stars: Killers of the Flower Moon by David Grann The Patron Saint of Second Chances by Christine Simon 2 stars: The Die Back by Grayson Steele

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: Our book club thoroughly enjoyed BLOOMSBURY GIRLS by Natalie Jenner. This is a book we received from GalleyMatch and the follow-up book to THE JANE AUSTIN SOCIETY. We loved that the author provided a map of the… વધુ century-old bookstore which gave a great visual of where all the activities were taking place. Also, the character list was a great addition. In this story WW2 is over but London is still not the same; women who had stood in place in the work force for the men at war are now being uprooted so the men can be back in charge. Bloomsbury Girls is about Bloomsbury Books and three such women. The bookstore is a stodgy, old place run inefficiency by men until Grace, Vivian and Evie decide… વધુ

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: I finally finished The wife upstairs by R. Hawkins. This was amazing book! I absolutely loved it! The story and characters and how twisted things was! I liked the ending and the fact that you have something to… વધુ guess made ending even better.  I am sad that I waited so long, as this is definitely a good book! Why I waited? After Verity hype there (I don't remember which group exactly) was a post that The wife upstairs is nearly like copy paste of Verify, or opposite, don't remember but this made me push this book away as I thought why I would read same story again? I was so wrong and definitely author of the post was wrong as this book was nothing like Verity!  If we want we can find some similarities in any book as the same things can happen with different people but in this book wasn't anything from Verity storyline!  I would say I could mark more similarities with The housekeeper by N. Barelli as Verity! So what I learned - do not push away any book just because someone shared opinion, make your own after reading the book ❤️

NAME: John Zenoni
CONTENT: What a great mystery series written by M. E. Hilliard about a librarian who loves - what else - mysteries! In “The Unkindness of Ravens”, Greer Hogan is a woman who has not only lost her husband, under… વધુ mysterious circumstances, but also loses one of her good friends as well that leaves everyone wondering if it was a murder or an accident. This begins the trail of Greer looking for someone that she believes murdered her friend and lives among the community, if not also works in the library as well. This is a well spun tale of mystery, suspense and very well written characters. This one definitely kept me guessing right up to the end and I cannot wait for Greer to go on her next journey of finding out who actually killed her husband. Definitely an enjoyable read and one that I cannot wait to discuss with my book club.

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Mrs.Sherlock Holmes is not the story of the wife of that famous British sleuth. It is the true story of the first female U.S. District Attorney and her most famous 1917 case of a missing girl that “ captivated… વધુ a nation.” Grace Humiston faced many obstacles as a lawyer and detective as she built her career during a time when women weren’t allowed to vote, much less carve out a career in the practice of Law. Grace persevered beyond obstacle after obstacle. Every page of her story demands to be turned quickly and read with a hunger for more! The story told in Mrs. Sherlock Holmes has relevance to the world today. Be sure to read the Epilogue and Author’s Notes at the end of the book to discover that relevance.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Dear Bookaholics: Curious, does anyone here keep a book journal or page tracker? I hesitate to post this on FB, as when I started using a page tracker over two years ago I posted about it, and in one reading… વધુ group got several hateful, snarky comments about the idea, basically calling me an idiot. Welll, this is my second year doing a book journal and between that and the tracker I have done more reading the last two years than in the previous five before that (at least), so hopefully am doing something right. The journal is on the left-han side below, the first few pages are blank shelves of books, and as I finish a book I color in another book and write in the title. Really cool, having one… વધુ

I liked the description of New York at that time. Part of the fault was due to the formatting, missing texts and puntuación of the digital edition...I didn't want  a refund  as I was into the book and Amazon said it was the fault of the editorial. The worst Kindle download I've ever bought. Anyway the ending left me a little in the air, so I presume there will be a follow up.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and enjoyed it:Never by Ken Follett. Another page turner by Ken Follett. This time the setting is present-day America and the world. The story could actually be happening in today’s world. At 800 pages, this book is too heavy to read in bed and too compelling to put down. I read it in less than a week, and although I usually… વધુ read at least a book a week, they are usually not 800 pages long. The thrust of the story shows us how the current interactions of nations may bring us to the brink of World War III, while at the same time revealing the intensely personal nature of the woman who is President of the United States.  There are so many levels of individual involvement that you’d think you would be confused, but the author weaves them together so skillfully that you find yourself turning the pages to find out what happens next, no matter which protagonist is currently starring on the pages. I remain a stolid fan of Ken Follett and his writings!

She has the mind, skill, and steady hands for the job, but being a woman makes it near impossible. 🩺 💀Kicked out of the lectures for being female, she seeks help from Jack Currer—a resurrection man—to steal corpses to study and practice on after she is granted the opportunity to still sit the exam. If she passes, she is awarded the opportunity of a lifetime to apprentice a well-known surgeon as well as opening their program to future women. If… વધુ

When children are being moved out of London to protect them from bombing, Ada and Jaime leave to the country where they find Susan. Susan loves and cares for them while war inches closer. The ending is truly beautiful.

NAME: AJ David Monijesu II
CONTENT: Some people have this tiny misconception that says, 'you're not supposed to laugh at books.' Films? Sure. Comedians? Without a doubt. The face a friend or relative make before sneezing? Definitely. But what… વધુ about when it comes to books? They consider books to be sacred and important matters. Do you share that viewpoint? That's not a good opinion, is it?  If that describes you, the problem is straightforward: you're not reading the correct books. Because a truly funny book will make you laugh loudly and proudly whether you want to or not. Enjoy some of the best rib-ticklers ever written, ranging from laugh-out-loud novels to cutting satires to memoirs by certified Very Funny Authors.

CONTENT: Cracked up to be Guys So was he cute Come hang out with us The little prick Cooking up dramas These are just a few of the expressions to be found throughout the book  Medusa, continously. Hence 2 stars as it… વધુ had me reading to the end. I've just criticised The Witch's Heart for it's bantering sessions and even so I gave it 5 stars, it was so original. I really don't understand all the 'hype' about this book. It was quite original storywise but it was a real strain to get through all these 'trivial and common' euphemisms in a book  on mythology. Not even recommendable as a young adult read, IMHO.

NAME: Anna Stefanovici
CONTENT: Evening reflections - well, evening for me here in Ottawa, Canada. Thanks to many of you in this group, I am proud - and grateful - to say that in the past couple of weeks, I've devoured both "Pachinko" and "Wild Swans."One fellow lovely reader here had asked for recommendations for multigenerational-spanning novels; my contribution to the list was… વધુ Ferrante's 4 volumes, but I jotted these two titles down for myself. So moved to learn about distant yet familiar worlds. I am a Canadian born in Romania, but I was 2 when the Revolution happened. I was aware of the hardship (and some real Messed up stories) my parents' generation lived through but I was less knowledgeable about China's tough decades. I so very much enjoy being part of this group and I thoroughly enjoy stalking postings on here 🌎👩🏻‍🎓💙

NAME: Dani Danielle
CONTENT: I read Then She Was Gone by Lisa Jewell as one of my last reads last year. I'd rated 3.75 star. Why?  First half took me 2 months to get through. I pushed through because of the raving reviews but it was slow.… વધુ I also found it predictable and the end no real shock. I'd have preferred a different outcome. Overall it was an all right read but 100 pages less would have been better. I'd put 4 on amazon to round it up.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: I Must Betray You by Ruta Sepetys What is the price of freedom?  In 1989 Romania under the brutal communist dictatorship of Nicolae Ceaușescu, it is weighed in suffering, deprivation, sacrifice and courage. … વધુ Ruta Sepetys shows us through the eyes of teens, what it feels like to be watched, spied upon, indoctrinated, and forced to become informers against friends and even family.  What it takes to rise up and pay the cost of rebellion.  Once again Sepetys brings to vivid life a time and place in history that deserves to be understood and remembered.  Gut-wrenching, powerful, hopeful, and filled with the strength of the human spirit.  Masterfully and emotionally narrated by Edoardo Ballerini.

NAME: Miranda Gears
CONTENT: (Please delete if not allowed) So we have a super awesome group here. With some super awesome people. And I wanted to take a moment and tell you guys about this great program Amazon has. There's this thing called Amazon Smile. It's a donation program that Amazon pays for. So basically you buy things, and Amazon uses a portion of what you spend… વધુ (0.5%), and donates to the charity of your choice—and there are SO MANY to choose from including LIBRARIES. And it's no cost to you. It's really easy to set up, in the Amazon app, you go to Settings (on the main menu, by the cusomer service button.) Click Amazon Smile, and pick the charity you want Amazon to donate to. It costs us nothing. And we get to help people when getting things we are gonna get anyway.❤

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and thought it worth mentioning here:Dear Mrs. Bird by A.J. Pearce. What a great story! Emmeline Lake is an aspiring war correspondent in London in 1940. She answers an ad in for a job at the newspaper as a “junior,” thinking she would be getting her foot in the door to become a full-fledged, dyed-in-the-wool wartime… વધુ correspondent. Her duties assisting Mrs. Henrietta Bird, the editor of Woman’s Friend, an advice column, are hardly the dream job reporting on the war front that she was hoping for.  The foibles of Emmie in coping with her duties at the behest of the intransigent Mrs. Bird are interesting, comical and endearing. This is a romp of a book, albeit the setting is wartime London during the Blitz. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

NAME: Bruce Kennedy
CONTENT: I just finished reading this book  ----- excellent, highly recommend     The Escape by Matthew Slater In the underworld, friendship and loyalty is  critical so when one of Bryan's closest friends betrays him,… વધુ revenge is paramount and all consuming.  He has spent 10 years planning, so when he is broken out of jail it is all about revenging the betrayal. Reading form the gangster perspective is amazing.  This fast moving criminal novel has all the twists and adventure I want in a novel.   Thanks Matthew - job well done (waiting for the next one)

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: Apart from the dreadful cover!!!! I found AMALIE  to be one of the best books I've read lately. Lightly gory....but not too descriptive..as we are talking about a female serial killer....product of the horrors… વધુ of Auschwitz(well described)....who actually endeared me to her...but really so!!  An original story, accurate historically, fast paced and enlightening, that introduced me to London's gangster underworld and the ways and endings of many other serial killers. Not my type of reading usually but so glad someone in the club published it...I looked it up as I just  couldn't believe that the cover would hold such a good read. 4.5 stars as in parts I found it confusing and had to re-track to find out where the character had appeared before. HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE.. Don't let the cover put you off...it is NOT a serial B chainsaw murder. Will read more by this author.

NAME: Erica Gelabert
CONTENT: “How do you find happiness?” Anna paused, then said, “You start by looking right around you for the blessings you have. When you find them, be grateful.”- Mark Sullivan “But someone very wise once told me that… વધુ by opening our hearts, revealing our scars, we are made human and flawed and whole. I guess I’m ready to be whole.”- Pino Lella  Beneath the Scarlett sky by Mark Sullivan is based on the true story of Pino Lella during the Holocaust in Italy. It’s truly an impactful novel that takes us outside of our lives and shows us faith, courage, resilience, love, and healing during hard times. I definitely recommend it .

CONTENT: I just finished reading this book  ----- excellent, highly recommend     The Escape by Matthew Slater In the underworld, friendship and loyalty is  critical so when one of Bryan's closest friends betrays him,… વધુ revenge is paramount and all consuming. NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and enjoyed:The Wicked Widow by Beatriz Williams. I saw Beatriz Williams’ newest novel on the new books shelf at the library and grabbed it. It did not disappoint. Told from two different time frames and viewpoints, the story takes place in 1924 and 1998. I have not read the other two novels in Ms. Williams’ “Wicked City… વધુ Trilogy,” but I gather from checking out the reviews of this novel that both Gin Kelly, the flapper from the 20’s, and Ella Dommerich, the modern day financial analyst, were the catalysts in the prior two novels in the trilogy. As you might guess, the portions of the story dealing with the 1920’s are full of rum-running, bootlegging, wealthy… વધુ

NAME: Janet MacGillivray Manning
CONTENT: Wow! this book had me riveted to the edge of my seat. An unorthodox therapist who lost her license is still as popular as ever. She offers a 10 step program that will save or end your marriage. Every character… વધુ is hiding a lie. This book will surprise you, shock you and most fun of all-It will keep you guessing right up until the end. Even the Therapist is hiding a lie. Each will be revealed cleverly and skillfully. Don't miss this one!

NAME: Kristine McKenna
CONTENT: If you enjoy classics, and I have been trying to read or re-read more, I found a great new series. It is from Canterbury Claasics and is called Flexibound Series. These are the Coolest Books. They are… વધુ beautiful, and made of a thick Flexible Material. Kind of hard to explain, but I bought mine at The Country Bookshop, in Southern Pines, NC. Think I can mention that. I had never seen them before. Also, have Engraved Quotes from the book on the Cover. Beautiful Inside, too.  So, I got The Great Gatsby, since I want to re-read because I am going to get The Chosen and the Beautiful, which is a modern retelling using a character from his book. Also, bought Anna Karenina. Very Reasonable Price, too for a Special Edition. Think $15 each.

NAME: Vasile Decu
CONTENT: Hi there. I’m a science journalist, book blogger, and ‘professional bookworm’. And here is my list of the best photo albums published last year. Yes, it’s a very subjective ‘shelf’ (aren’t they all?), and also… વધુ focused on nature and science. But I do think that I can safely say they are among the best books of 2021.From the microscopic world of seeds to the tectonic spectacle of fiery volcanoes, and from the flight of whales to that of the birds in the oceans above, these books delight us, inform us, educate us, and inspire us through joy, and awe, and pain, by distilling entire worlds and feelings in a single frame. And they all show how fascinating and fragile the world us really is.https://scienceborglibrarian.substack.com/p/best-photo-albums-of-2021?s=w

NAME: Jen Allard
CONTENT: How do you deal with a tough book? I read the first one in this series several years ago and gave it 4 stars. In an attempt to read from authors I know I like this year (instead of trying a bunch of new ones… વધુ and being disappointed) I knew I wanted to keep going in this series. I got about half way (the chapters are nice and short) but not a lot was happening to keep me engaged. I dropped it for about a week (no reading at all) and now I’ve picked it back up knowing I have to read 2 chapters a day to complete it in time to return to the library. The main thing keeping me going is knowing someone is next in line for it so I can’t renew it again. I should mention it’s a subject I never read about but the first one was recommended by a friend and I did enjoy it although I don’t honestly remember it.

NAME: Desiree Ann Hill Leonard
CONTENT: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Oh my goodness Riley Sagar has done it again!! When New York Times book interview said this book was deliciously scary they weren't joking such a roller coaster ride, this book had everything that you… વધુ need in a book to keep you hooked.  Quincy may think that she survived 10 years ago when six of her friends went on vacation and she was the only one to survive but now 10 years later she's again fighting for her survival will Quincy finally realize what it means to be a final girl grab your favorite snack and drink because you will not want to move once you start this book.

NAME: Alison Oshel
CONTENT: I really loved this book. Great character development, characters for whom you could root, a little suspense and some laughter. Plot is about a family in early 1960s small town America. Father is WWII vet… વધુ turned minister in a summer when several deaths occur and seem linked. It’s not a murder mystery so much as a coming of age story.

NAME: MichElle Colpo
CONTENT: I never thought I’d put “comical” and “murder mystery” in the same book review, but Liane Moriarty’s book, “Big Little Lies” defies all odds with this sugar-coated murder mystery. 🍭🩸 🤭Elementary suburban mom… વધુ drama is already filled with comical gossip, but Moriarty spices up the story with a dash of murder in such a way where you find yourself living amidst it all. 🪦  🇦🇺Jane is a quiet young mom who moves on a whim to the suburban town of Pirriwee Peninsula with her 5-year-old son Ziggy. She makes friends with Madeline—a funny, chatty mom who enjoys picking a good fight or two—and Celeste—a drop-dead gorgeous mom who is as humble as she is rich. With all their children in the same age group,… વધુ

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Goodreads Giveaway Kindle win from about a week ago; anyone read it, or her? Wanted to also post to mention that this is not just out now, but also on Kindle Unlimited for those who are members. Just fyi.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I'd like to recommend:Crying in H Mart by Michelle Zauner. This is a memoir by Korean-American singer, songwriter and guitarist, Michelle Zauner. This book covers a lot of ground: the relationship between mother and daughter through the years, coping with the emotional distress of learning at a young age (25) that her mother is… વધુ suffering from an incurable cancer, ultimately coping with the loss of her mother, her grandmother and her aunt within a brief period of time, and throughout it all learning to recreate her love for her lost relatives through the exquisite Korean foods her mother was so skilled at making for her family. This was a very different reading experience for me, but one that I found quite interesting.

NAME: Pamela Kelly
CONTENT: Very good book, though a little slow at times. The story weaves together themes of family, friendship and community with the history of Dahkota Indians in Minnesota, as well as the beginnings of corporate farming and GMO seeds.   Very interesting!

NAME: DiAnna Lynn Loy
CONTENT: I’ve just finished Broken For You by Stephanie Kallos for what might be the third time. The readings have occurred over the last 20 years so each time is like the first. I cannot recommend this book highly… વધુ enough.  “When we meet septuagenarian Margaret Hughes, she is living alone in a mansion in Seattle with only a massive collection of valuable antiques for company. Enter Wanda Schultz, a young woman with a broken heart who has come west to search for her wayward boyfriend. Both women are guarding dark secrets and have spent many years building up protective armor against the outside world. As their tentative friendship evolves, the armor begins to fall away and Margaret opens her house to the younger woman. This launches a series of unanticipated events, leading Margaret to discover a way to redeem her cursed past, and Wanda to learn the true purpose of her cross-country journey.  Both funny and heartbreaking, Broken for You is a testament to the saving graces of surrogate families and shows how far the tiniest repair jobs can go in righting the world's wrongs.”

NAME: Marisa Cammarata-Seales
CONTENT: This is my March Reading Pile. I’ve decided to chose the books in advance, and stick with a format. Since I tend to read mostly Historical Fiction, I want to try and mix it up with one book from each of these… વધુ genres: Classics, RomCom/Beach Book, Literary Fiction, Contemporary Fiction, Historical Fiction, Non Fiction, Regency Era and a New Release. I am also in the midst of reading the Maisie Dodd series by Jacqueline Winspear, and will read one per month, to stretch it out, since I’ll be sad when it ends! I also love Agatha Christie, and my goal is to read all of her novels, so I’ll throw one in a month until I finish. That’s my plan, and I’m sticking to it! Wish me luck!

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: THE DUTCH HOUSE by Ann Patchett was our recent book club pick. An exceptionally well-crafted American family saga which is set over the course of five decades. This is a richly moving story that explores the… વધુ indelible bond between two siblings, the house of their childhood, and a past that will not let them go. Maeve and Danny’s mother leaves the family and their father marries Andrea who turns out to be the proverbial stepmother. Their father dies unexpectedly and the inheritance goes to Andrea. Maeve and Danny are thrown out of their house with no financial support. The two siblings are each other’s rocks for life. They have difficulty moving forward in their lives and from time-to-time sit in their car in front of The Dutch House and talk about what should be theirs and what could have been. An insightful look into family bonds, the meaning of home, and love and forgiveness.  Book Club Menu: Hungarian Pastries

NAME: Mary Siudut
CONTENT: Highly recommend The Personal Librarian  by Marie Benedict and Victoria Christopher Murray.  The Personal Librarian is based on the true story of a brilliant African American women who passed as white in early 1900’s to be the art historian, curator and advisor to J P Morgan in the establishment of his Pierpont Morgan Library in NYC

NAME: Ember Chance
CONTENT: Just finished this great book by J.J Holt and I wanted to share.  If you enjoyed “The Thursday Murder Club” then you will LOVE “Signs of Life”. Brilliant. Funny. Clever.  If you are a Cozy Mystery fan I think… વધુ you are going to LOVE this!  I don’t know how to do this wonderful book justice.   In this fresh new series Holt introduces Bentley as a retired detective who is having a hard time adjusting to life without a badge.   He has a heart of gold and just can’t say “no” when help is needed, even when it puts himself in harms way and causes a riff in his family.   A real page-turner from the start, Holt touches on struggles facing young and old.  I found myself rooting for Bentley and friends that resulted in few late nights since I just couldn’t put it down.   Can’t wait for the next book to find out what happens to Bentley and friends. My cat Griffe gives it two paws 🐾 up since its been a while since I was so into a book I stayed in one place for multiple hours.   He got lots of snuggles this week.  I highly recommend!  https://books2read.com/signsoflife

NAME: Eisha Sarkar
CONTENT: My reading challenge 2022 is to finish 50 books that have been published/authored/set in 50 different countries. I shall post about the ones I have read, mention the country they are set in and where the author… વધુ is based. Instead of a review, I shall open a random page in the book and quote a line/para. My reviews and ratings are available on Goodreads, for those who wish to know. Book 9: In Other Rooms, Other Wonders Author: Daniyal Mueenuddin (Pakistan) 🇵🇰 Genre: Short Stories Set in: Pakistan 🇵🇰, France 🇫🇷 Page 142: "You know," she said thoughtfully, "the Seine doesn't divide Paris, it keeps the city together. It's just the right width, not a little stream but a public place in the heart of the city." Sohail leaned down and kissed her. "That's a great image, the river not dividing Paris." Flag score:  🇵🇰 🇳🇬 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿 🇬🇧 🇲🇽 🇮🇳 🇩🇪 🇦🇹 🇮🇹 🇷🇺 🇳🇵 🇮🇪 🇨🇿 🇵🇱 🇫🇮 🇱🇻 🇱🇹 🇪🇪 🇳🇿 🇫🇷 🇯🇵 🇧🇷 🇰🇿 🇺🇸 #50books50countries, #pakistan #pakistaniauthors #daniyalmueenuddin #penguin #vintage #readingchallenge2022 #bookstagram #bookoholic #booksoninstagram

NAME: Jessica Rae
CONTENT: Here’s something I love when I encounter it in books of fiction:  Maps.  As a frontispiece or the inside “wallpaper” on front and back covers.  Maps drawn of a country, or of a region or smaller area such as a town or village or a route, with drawn-in figures or houses or landmarks.  Maps as blueprint-like drawings of the interior of houses or… વધુ displayed like the playing board for Clue.  For me, they are such valuable additions to the story that I find myself frequently flipping back and forth from my place in the text to see where I am.  I find these special treats often in British mystery novels.  Does anyone else in the world find such maps to be a source of pleasure?

CONTENT: After reading this book I have explored many great ideas “100 things successful people do”  Some i want to share with my online family… KNOW YOURSELF: Get to know what other people already know about you… Other… વધુ people can be very good at describing us… ACCEPT YOURSELF: Stop comparing yourself to others and you might just realise that everything  is ok… ‘APOLOGIZE WHEN YOU ARE WRONG’’ Apologizing and seeking forgiveness are liberating… ‘STAY IN TOUCH WITH OLD FRIENDS’’ Do everything you can to keep your friendships alive… ‘’PRACTISE GRATITUDE’’ Be grateful and demonstrate sincere thanks… . . #100thingssuccessfulpeopledo

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: THE MAID by Nita Prose - I thoroughly enjoyed this murder mystery with tremendous heart. The story is about Molly Gray who struggles with social skills and misreads the intentions of others. I also enjoyed all… વધુ the words of wisdom that her grandmother taught her by breaking them down into simple rules that Molly could live by. Molly is a maid in a 5-star hotel who discovers a body in one of the rooms she is cleaning and then her world is turned upside down. You will want to hug and protect Molly and she will most certainly capture your heart. What a delightful read! Book Club Menu: Olive Garden Tour of Italy

NAME: Iva Söderback
CONTENT: I know there were mixed reviews and opinions on this one, but this book dragged me in from the first page; it is everything but boring!  Such a beautiful, sad, inspiring and heartwarming story with characters… વધુ who definitely captured my heart🧡 The characters who "touched me" the most (apart from Kya) were Jumpin' & Mabel🧡 Their kindness and good hearts without any prejudice were simply heartwarming and beautiful. The sceneries were so beautifully written i could actually see them and almost feel the sensations of the wild nature life. The book is very emotional and at some parts to the point it hurt; still loved it and will stay with me for a long time. 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 "Where the crawdads sing"  - Delia Owens

NAME: Erica Gelabert
CONTENT: “Growing old is a privilege, not a right.”  - Robert Dugoni  I would like to highly recommend this powerful and impactful novel, The World Played Chess by Robert Dugoni. This is the type of novel that gives us… વધુ perspective and makes us think of about our lives differently. It’s a coming of age story about a young man on the cusp of adulthood, a Vietnam Vet, and a father . The author did a tremendous job researching the Vietnam war and incorporating the experiences of vets in the novel. There is so much to learn about life from this book. If you loved Sam Hell, This Tenderland, or even The Great Alone , you may love this novel.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and wanted to comment on:The House in the Cerulean Sea by T.J. Klune. This was my book club’s February pick, and the reviews were mixed – i.e., some liked it a lot, some were lukewarm, but no one hated it. Fantasy isn’t really my favorite genre, but this story is definitely touching. For me, the saving grace was the fact… વધુ that, in the end, this book is really about unconditional love and respecting each other including or in spite of our differences. I ended up liking it, in spite of the weirdness of some of the characters. They were magical characters, after all, with problems and desires just like every other worldly being has.  If you like fantasy, this may well be a book you will treasure.

NAME: Janey Zellers Powell
CONTENT: Please, someone, give me a reason to continue reading A Good Neighborhood by Therese Anne Fowler. 45 pages in and I’m tired of being bombarded by every social and economic dilemma of our times - bullying… વધુ (slutty teens against a pure girl), boycotting certain foods for cruelty reasons, unethical business practices (cutting corners when building), environmental issues (those building issues colliding with a tree), racial issues (biracial boy and white virginal girl in a Romeo and Juliet romance), rich and not as rich issues, and a little white Southerner bashing thrown in for fun. For info on those things I can go watch the news. Is there a compelling story coming up in this book? So far I don’t see it.

CONTENT: When I finished Peter Swanson book "Before she knew him" there was coments suggesting his book "The kind worth killing" is much better. I just finished this book....  It was a great story but I must say I liked… વધુ his book "Before she knew him" much more better.  Usually I am managing to get close to the main character even if it's a killer but not in this case. I was hoping all the way through she will get what she deserves... There wasn't any crazy twist like in other book where I was literally left with open mouth and gasping loudly. I definitely recommend this book it is good but if you never tried other one, please read that one as well as I said, I liked it much better ❤️

NAME: MichElle Colpo
CONTENT: A love story mixed with the tragedy of war is a common trope we see in many books we read, but not like Stephen P. Kiernan’s novel, “Universe of Two.”  Expecting a cute romance with a victorious ending, I was… વધુ left sympathizing deeply for the couples part in ending a war, and coping with the new war of a guilty conscience.  Charlie Fish is a brilliant Harvard-educated mathematician who falls in love with Brenda Dubie, an organist in Chicago who is as stubborn as nails.  When Charlie is drafted into a top-secret project he can’t tell Brenda about, he is left with the torment of what the consequences would be in building the detonator responsible for the bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.… વધુ

As World War II continues, Hanni Kohn comes to the difficult conclusion that she must send her daughter Lea away to safety after a close call with a German officer in their hometown of Berlin. She seeks the help of a rabbi, but it’s the rabbi’s daughter Ettie who helps by creating a golem - a rare, soulless creature in the form of a woman named Ava who is bound to protect Lea at all costs. NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Thank you @Simon&Schuster and @BookClub Favorites for the free book.No Land to Light on by Yara Zgheib. This is a timely novel currently with immigration lighting up the news channels every day. It’s a story of two Syrian immigrants to the U.S. who meet, fall in love, and marry, with intentions of making their life here. Sama came to the U.S. years… વધુ ago as an exchange student at Harvard University in Boston. Hadi is a sponsored refugee from a bloody Syrian civil war.  When Hadi flies to Syria on the death of his father, he is detained and refused readmission to this country due to changes in the immigration laws. The story is beautifully written and carries the reader along between the traumas of both characters trying to exist and figure out how to be together again.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I love autobiographies, and well written biographies. This book I’m reading about Michael Douglas by Marc Eliot. It's got all the highlights of Michael Douglas' career and personal life, but it's too much like… વધુ a listing rather than a story. The beginning of the book is so much about his relationship with Kirk Douglas and his mother. Michael and Kirk have the same tastes in women and marriages. Throughout his book is pretty much boring because it talks about his career a lot than his personal life. As a result, he becomes a better husband and a father when he married Catherine. I liked his father because he’s very hilarious and of course he’s a rebel and a legend man. I would love to read his father’s biography book.

NAME: Jean Kolinofsky
CONTENT: I received this book from Blackstone Publishing via NetGalley and after reading it I can’t wait for Rick Bleiweiss to bring Pignon Scorbion and his quirky characters back for another mystery.  Pignon becomes… વધુ the chief police investigator in a small town in 1910 England.  He is meticulously dressed and regarded as a peacock when he first enters his friend’s barber shop until he is presented with his first case. He enlists the help of the barber, his staff and an aspiring journalist to question witnesses and suspects as he sets up his interrogations in the barbershop.  Ultimately, they assist him with three cases - a paternity issue, a murder at a traveling circus and the theft of an artifact and a farmer’s pig, which also led to murder.  Bleiweiss’ characters are a delight and Pignon’s interrogations offer clues that are sometimes contradictory, sometimes making the solution a surprise.  This is a quick read that Agatha Christie fans will find irresistible.

NAME: Jean Kolinofsky
CONTENT: I received an invitation from Random House/Ballantine Books to read this book and when I reviewed it I had to give it 5 stars.  When Byron and Benny’s mother Eleanor passes away she leaves a recording that… વધુ explains events in her life that leave them stunned.  It begins with a girl named Covey who grew up on a Caribbean Island.  Abandoned by her mother and raised by a father who drank and gambled, he arranged a marriage to a local gangster to cover his debts.  Her husband is poisoned at the wedding and Covey disappears.  What follows is a story of heartbreak and the loss of a daughter, who was taken for adoption.  Finally finding happiness and raising her children, she always hoped to find… વધુ

I would love to read her whole story if I find it. For me, she’s hilarious, I wouldn’t label her as famous people, but if I have met her in real life for a day; she would have made my day funnier. She’s easygoing, she’s straight forward to the point and of course she could be emotional when something she is passionate about.

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: My latest read: The Beantown Girls by Jane Healey For readers of historical fiction,this   book is an interesting , fun, informative read! Three fictional characters volunteer for overseas duty in  the Red… વધુ Cross Clubmobile Association. “Chosen  for their inner strength snd individual talents “ the trio of young women meet  snd master many obstacles thrown their way as the story progresses through the European fronts during WWII. Before I read this book I knew nothing regarding the Red Cross Clubmobile Women. By the time I finished reading this book I knew that this RedCross service  did exist and that the women who volunteered to participate in this service were strong and courageous and capable. I didn’t want the story to end! That the accounts documented in this book actually happened made this read more compelling  for me as a reader.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: Before we can figure out who did it, we must first figure out who’s dead. THE GUEST LIST is a well-written, atmospheric whodunnit story that takes place at a celebrity wedding on an abandoned island off the… વધુ coast of Ireland. The stormy weather closes in, the island is cut off from the rest of the world, the wedding reception has begun and then the body is found! The story is told in short chapters from the alternating viewpoints of different members of the wedding party. Such an enjoyable, suspenseful story. This is my first Lucy Foley; however, it won’t be my last.

CONTENT: I really love being part of this group - so many excellent recommendations! These are my January reads and I have really enjoyed them all, particularly This Tender Land (which isn’t well known here in the UK) and Magic Lessons (my first Alice Hoffman book). Feel free to suggest more!

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this biography and want to recommend it:Dutch Girl: Audrey Hepburn and World War II by Robert Matzen. As a fan of Audrey Hepburn, the star of such movies as Breakfast at Tiffany’s, Roman Holiday and many others, when I ran across this biography, I simply had to read it. Who knew that Audrey Hepburn was a child in the Netherlands during… વધુ World War II who lived through five years of Nazi occupation and the bombing and shelling when the Allies finally arrived to drive the Nazis out and liberate the Dutch citizens? Who knew that the Audrey Hepburn we so admired for her style, grace and beauty aspired more to be a ballerina than an actress but was considered at 5’7” to be too tall to star as a classic ballerina?  Who would have thought, with the War raging through the small Dutch town where Audrey lived with her family, that Audrey would still be training and studying ballet with her ballet teacher? This is truly an interesting and inspiring biography of an amazingly strong-willed woman.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: The second book I’m reading is called “Saved to remember” written by Frank Vajda. He’s a major figure known as Australian neurologist. I’ve enjoyed the book. He explained a short, incredibly detailed, the true… વધુ and most horrifying, harrowing, very graphic most brutal and barbaric that have snatched his grandparent’s, father’s business, their homes, their families, and their friends. He also describes his ideology and pays a tribute to the those people who did not survive in the Holocaust, including his father and the rest of the others who were murdered by Nazis and a fascist Hungarian militia. His book is very interesting and is very, very similar to Elie Wiesel, Eddie Jaku, Phillip Maisel, their ideology as well. As a result, he was a very lucky boy because his mother was a nurse and had more privilege resources that saves them both by a legend man named Raoul Wallenberg, a Swedish resistance who risked his life to save Jewish lives.

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: January Reads1. The Tattooist of Auschwitz - Heather Morris. Harrowing story of one man’s experience of the concentration camps during WW2. Told to the author by the man himself. 4 stars because I felt the writing was a bit dry.2. Damnation Spring - Ash Davidson. Set in logging country. A small relies on logging for its livelihood. What happens… વધુ when things start to go wrong? It’s an ok story. Takes a while to get going, but I really liked the characters, so they kept me interested. 3 stars.3. Violets - Alex Hyde. Not for me at all. Lots of blank verse. Very confusing story. Couldn’t engage with any of the characters. Not released until Feb 3rd. Maybe if you like poetry you could get on board… વધુ

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: A lovely story about aging and purpose and dying with dignity. Eudora is feisty, smart, articulate, responsible and entirely self-alienated. A new family moves in next door and a young girl opens her world back… વધુ up. Eudora isn't always a willing participant but these interactions create relationships that are foundations of love and friendship. The story moves between present and past where we learn why Eudora is the way she is.  The characters  are relatable. The dialogue is quick witted and thoughtful with just enough humour. And the storyline moves along at the perfect pace. A fine balance of good and bad -- just like real life.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: Notes on an Execution by Danya Kukofka I nearly stopped reading this dark, disturbing novel early on, but I'm so glad I hung in there. Ansel Packer was abandoned by his parents in a cold shack without food when… વધુ he was four, and left with instructions to take care of his infant brother.  As the novel opens, he is on death row for killing four women and has 12 hours until his execution.  Through flashbacks, we follow his life through the eyes of the women who knew him, grew up in foster care with him, and some of whom loved him.   Their stories are what saved the book for me, gave me perspective into Ansel's life, and provided moments of hope.  This deeply character driven novel was powerfully moving, beautifully crafted, and absolutely haunting.

Although it deals with Covid-19 and its tragedies, it does so in a… વધુ caring and respectful way, giving our heroic medical professionals the credit they deserve for their profound and exhaustive efforts to preserve patients' lives while risking their own. But there is much more to this story, believe me! One of the best books I've read in months.

Have read "Have you seen Luis Velez?", "Seven Perfect Things",… વધુ and "Sold on a Monday".  Mitch Albom is a great author too. I received a copy of this through NetGalley and I would have given it more than 5 stars if I could.

NAME: Michelle Reimer Herzing
CONTENT: I loved pretty much every book I read this month, but my favorites were The World Played Chess by Robert Dugoni and The Bright Side Running Club by Josie Lloyd.  5-stars also went to From Hollywood with Love,… વધુ which is a historical overview of romantic comedy movies and The Keeper of Happy Endings, wonderful historical fiction.  I did not love the audio version of Trejo, though I thought the story of Danny Trejo's life was fascinating, he read the book himself, and let's just say he is not the smoothest narrator.  I found his word-by-word reading distracting.  This is one celebrity memoir I would have preferred in paper copy. 5 Stars: The World Played Chess by Robert Dugoni The Bright Side Running Club by Josie Lloyd From Hollywood with Love by Scott Meslow The Keeper of Happy Endings by Barbara Davis 4 Stars: Billy Summers by Stephen King The Christie Affair by Nina de Gramont Josh and Gemma Make a Baby by Sarah Ready Her Hidden Genius by Marie Benedict Uprooted by Peter J. Boni The Maid by Nita Prose 3 Stars: Trejo by Danny Trejo

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: Omg! What can I say about this author Ronald H Balson. Thanks lot, I never weep a book ever. He wrote a another phenomenal and fascinating story once again. The book is called “Karolina’s twins” by R. H.… વધુ Balson. His third book. This is fictional which Lena Woodward isn’t the real name. It is inspired by the real of Fay Schaefer Waldman, she’s a survivor and a Polish hero woman. Balson, is a skilled storyteller who knows how to write a story that has your entire focus and energy, he also manages to throw many cliffhangers and twists where he writes an easy, flowing read where you have to keep reading to see how it all ends. I couldn’t put it down. The story unfolds about 89 years old Lena asked her lawyer Catherine Lockhart and her husband Liam Taggart, a private investigator, in the present day in Chicago to help find Karolina’s twins. The lawyer-detective couple agrees to put all pieces together as a result, after 70 years. Did Lena get her wishes? You can decide?

NAME: Jen Allard
CONTENT: Any Shopaholic fans? I started reading these YEARS ago when I was in a reading rut. As a teenager I was reading all the VC Andrews books and getting tired of the same plot with each family. My sister lent me… વધુ this series one by one and I remembered them as being amusing and somewhat funny. I borrowed this from the library and was not disappointed! I was pleasantly surprised so I will keep reading this series. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: Nancy Wake is my new hero. I'm just ecstatic that these "real" stories are becoming popular about women's roles in the war. I say this because I majored in History and Political Science in University AND… વધુ studied WWII for an entire year and there was nothing about women's roles in the strategy or the tactical.  Yes this is a work of fiction but it's drawing a lot on real facts as evidenced in the Author's Notes at the end of the book. Fast paced and a real page turner. I stayed up late to finish this and it was worth the lack of sleep :-) If you like historical fiction, you will thoroughly enjoy this novel.

NAME: Marcy Goulart
CONTENT: Just finished Winter Garden by  Kristen Hannah. The story of a family who's mother survived the Leningrad during WWII it wasn't an easy book to read in the middle of Winter but was truly wonderful- about sisters, mother and the human spirit to triumph. Well worth the read!

NAME: Beck Kane
CONTENT: Has anyone read ‘Will Grayson, Will Grayson’? Without giving any spoilers, can you let me know whether there is any death, self harm or abuse in the novel? Thanks! NAME: Catherine Molloy
CONTENT: Behold the Dreamers by Imbolo Mbue . I just finished this book this evening and highly recommend it. It’s a while since I’ve read a 5 star ⭐️ book !!! A compulsively readable novel about a young Cameroonian… વધુ couple trying to make a new life in New York in 2007 just as the Great Recession hit.  They were just trying to live the ‘American Dream’ but sadly it didn’t all go to plan, and reality proved much harsher.  Highly recommend. A poignant  and wonderfully character- driven book .

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: The book I’m reading is very interesting and phenomenal book. The tile is called “First one in and Last one out” by Marilyn Shimon. She is the aunt of Murray (Mongid) Scheinberg. She explained a short,… વધુ incredibly detailed, the true and most horrifying, harrowing, very graphic most brutal and barbaric that have snatched him, his life, his business, his family and friends who have betrayed him. He has suffered for the last 6 years of his life. He was an honourable man that everyone knew him back in Poland. He was a Polish Jew and was the first 8 men to enter as a political prisoner in December, 3rd, 1939, in Auschwitz and the last man out and escape from Dachau then sometime in April 29th 1945, he was liberated by the Americans. After the war, he changed his name from his real name to Murray. He even wrote the book in 1968 but the publisher rejected the book because it would be a shock to the public and hurt the readers. His aunt republished his book in March 2009 as a result.

NAME: Jennifer Murdoch Martucci
CONTENT: I need a new book to read and since it is International Holocaust Memorial Day, I was considering making it one of the following. Please let me know which one you would give the highest recommendation. Thank you! 😀

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: At last a 5 stars for me. It's been a long long time since I've given one.  Once I got over the shock of modern  day bantering and idiomatic expressions, I was suddenly plunged into the most exquisite prose all… વધુ faithfully contasted(by myself)and found to be perfect, according to the Norse mythology.  I knew the story but not from this original perspective.  I've cried, laughed and.. yes...dreamt and been astounded by facts I didn't know. The main personality is incredible as are all the others. So strong and fragile at the same time..a 'Witch..Giant..Goddess' with human sentiments. A wonderful debut and I hope to read more by this author ...if the 'powers that be' don't 'corrupt 'and she doesn't get 'blinded' by success. The only reason I nearly took away a star, was that I could have done without the 'bantering' and modern colloquial expressions. I almost closed the book after the first few pages. I also considered the feminist touch...which seems to be the mode in new books...unnecessary IMHO. A thoroughly enjoyable read.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: If, like me, you love stories that kidnap your intended schedule because you just keep turning the pages, then I highly recommend T.J. Newman’s debut novel FALLING. You just boarded a flight to New York. What… વધુ you don’t know is thirty minutes before the flight your pilot’s family was kidnapped. For his family to live, everyone on your plane must die. The only way the family will survive is if the pilot follows his orders and crashes the plane. T. J. Newman has clearly brought her knowledge and experience as a flight attendant into play. The writing is so descriptive; you can see and feel every movement in the book and the characters are people in whom I felt totally invested. This is a fast-paced, action-filled story with twists. Your captain has switched on the seatbelt sign. Buckle up - this is a flight you will not forget.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This is the second celebrity book I’ve ever read since Jimmy Barnes. This time I’m reading a book about Demi Moore. She writes a book is called “Inside Out”. I must say Jimmy and Demi have a similar experience… વધુ upbringing. Demi was born in Roswell, New Mexico with her brother Morgan. Her life was confused, no nurturing, no compassion and no love from her parents. Her parents were only young and were thinking of themselves; the hardcore partying, drinking, drugs and sex abused. Demi moves a lot, change schools so on. Her father committed suicide when he was only 34 years old. Her mother took her to meet men to get attention and was used as a sex, until she was introduced to Freddy Moore, a… વધુ

A Great sequel and nail biting mystery #hollyjackson #GoodGirlBadBlood

The reader is brought on a journey of self discovery and awareness and perhaps some self forgiveness. It touched my heart even though it hurt. I am grateful this story found me

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: ’ll admit, I had a hard time reading this book. As many of you know I love to read WW2 historical fiction that is based on a true story book. The book I’m reading “The brothers of Auschwitz” by Malka Adler. The… વધુ story describes very moving, harrowing and stunning, really well written and heartbreaking raw. It was very bleak and depressing. It made more sense to me in the author’s note at the end to discover that author was originally from Hungary and it was based on a true story. Yitzhak lived with her family when she was a baby right after the WW2 ended and she grew up with her as part of her family. She interviewed both brothers and wrote this book as result.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and think you might like it:The Last Garden in England by Julia Kelly. A historical novel that follows a house through the decades, from 1907 through 2021, this story is told in three separate timelines – 1907, 1944 and 2021. Highbury House is a grand English manor house, and in 1907 its newly wealthy owners desire to surround… વધુ it with sumptuous gardens to further show off its beauty. They hire garden designer Venetia Smith to plan and design the gardens. In 1944 during the Second World War, Highbury House has been taken over by the British government as a hospital and convalescent center for the war-wounded. Land girl Beth Pedley drives a tractor to assist in the war… વધુ

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: Sally Rooney's Normal People is a deeply character driven coming of age novel that explores love, communication, and whether "normal" even exists as a human category. What does it mean to be damaged, broken,… વધુ alienated, good or evil? Can you be both friends and lovers? What are the influences of family, class, popularity, values and vulnerabilities? How can you counteract being seen through the perceptions of others, and what is necessary to become whole? This was not an easy novel and it ended without answers. Beautiful and brilliant, Normal People left me feeling flayed to the bone.  I listened to the audio version, which was excellent.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m so excited to read for the first time, one of Australia author James Moloney, who wrote the book called “The Love That I Have” by J. Moloney. I’m glad I did read his book. It was beautifully written and a… વધુ moving love story set in one of the most terrible times and places in history. He tells the story that shows, love, loss, courage, bravery and determination. The ending was a phenomenal twist that we didn’t see that coming once again. The story, Margot, 16, she’s bored with school took her sister’s job as a Mailroom. A young innocent German girl who works at a concentration camp in Sachsenhausen in 1944. She soon realises she learns her job is to burn letters that the prisoners have written back home to their loved ones. She learns she must not contact with the prisoners. She decides to read one of the prisoners’ letters, Dieter Kleinschmidt was writing a love letter to his girl who was in Auschwitz – her name was also Margot. Did she find him? Did he lose her? You can decide?

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is an incredibly moving and powerful story called “Lily’s Promise” written by a Holocaust survivor and her great-grandson Dov Forman who wrote the book together. She made a promise to her father that… વધુ she will look after her siblings and she did. Her great- grandson, 16 years old, he was determined to record and write his great grandmother’s story. He tells about her life before the war, during the war and after the war. An incredible, beautiful written page turner, I didn’t want the book to end- and not only because the story shows, photos which are interesting and was very suspense that keeps you riveted from the start to the end. She is 97 years old, an incredible woman that has survived the camps, and went through so much hope, love, strength and yet she has survived Covid-19. I think this book should have made into movies. This book should be in schools to teach students around the world. I couldn’t put it down.

I questioned the statement under the title which says:” “ a tale of madness, medicine, snd the murder of a president.” Madness, medicine snd murder in the life of dull, little known President James Garfield? Partway through the first chapter I realized that the words in the subtitle are true! I was hooked in! I read the book straight through!! An exciting  read with the  bonus that the story is true! Destiny of the Republic by Candice  Millard.

She researched and manages to piece together, learning about her grandparents survival story through the WW2. I enjoy the story because the romance was flirtatious, and fun, and flows from the first to the end. As a result, it was a twist, we didn’t see that coming.

Her second book, Lost Roses, was about Caroline's mother Eliza set during the period before WWI. In Sunflower Sisters, the third and final book in the series, we meet Caroline’s ancestor Georgeanna "Georgy" Woolsey who aids the Union Army during the Civil War."  Due to the tragic subject matter,  I had to put down books 1 and 3 and read other books in between.  So glad though that I finished reading all three.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: A book I just read with my book club, and we all loved it: "The Mystery of Mrs. Christie" by Marie Benedict.  One of the most famous mystery writers of all time, Agatha Christie, creator of the incomparable sleuth, Hercule Poirot, is the subject of this historical novel.  I personally did not know that Agatha Christie mysteriously disappeared for… વધુ an eleven-day-period in 1926, generating a very large manhunt by the police and law-enforcement authorities in England.  Told in segments occurring from 1912 through 1926, with the early segments by Agatha Christie, and the later segments during the December 1926 search for her from the viewpoint of her husband, Archie, the reader experiences the growing discord between the couple.  It seems uncanny that the author, Agatha Christie, seemingly created a puzzle to solve her own personal problems that is at least as difficult to solve as those comprising her mystery novels.  Marie Benedict has done her usual exceptional job of recreating the behind-the-scenes world of Agatha Christie.  If you love mysteries, this is a book not to be missed.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book I’m reading is very unusual and different is called “knife-edge path” written by Patrick T. Leahy. This isn’t a Holocaust survivor story. This is a fictional story, but Holocaust happened. The story… વધુ unfolds about Geli Strub is the wife of a German officer, her circumstances, her control, her rations have been cut off and she faced a difficult situation, because her choice was starving versus reviving. She’s a spy for a German Officer, Kurt, in Berlin. She finds herself falling in love with a man who believes she is someone else. I have to say the story in the beginning was just bit difficult and it doesn’t follow the main characters in the story to put together. Yes, it was bit of a thrilling and a suspense. I can’t say this book is fantastic, but I can say this is the least of worst book I’ve ever read. You can decide if that’s book is for you.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book does remind a bit of the book and the movie called “the boy in striped pyjamas”. It hooks you from the first page. It is at such an emotional, touching and heartfelt story called “The Watchmaker of… વધુ Dachau” written by Carly Schabowski. She did an incredible and beautiful writing style really brought the story to life. It’s a story focusing on the goodness of people, in particular horrendous circumstances where Issac and Anna formed a friendship where they share their experience and relationships. I particularly enjoyed the narrative of Frederick and his developing relationship with Anna and Isaac and the fact that he had not felt hatred for the Jews as his parents’ evil is. I also enjoyed how Greta was looking out for everyone cooking and feeding the prisoners when she could, putting her own life at risk. It is a magnificent story ever I read.

NAME: Helen Frost
CONTENT: What are some of your favourite quotes, from the books you have read? Some of mine are: "All the privilege I claim for my own sex (it is not a very enviable one: you need not covet it), is that of loving longest, when existence or when hope is gone!” "We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us, with nothing to show for our progress except a memory of the smell of smoke, and a presumption that once our eyes watered."

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book for your consideration: "Daisy Jones & The Six" by Taylor Jenkins Reid.  I just finished this book and tears are rolling down my cheeks.  It was not a sad book, but the ending touched me to tears.  This is the story of a rock and roll band in the 1970’s, told in the voices of the band members themselves.  It’s fictional, but it feels… વધુ factual, if that makes sense at all.  The author has said that the book was influenced by Fleetwood Mac, after she watched one of their concerts on television, and the interaction between Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks (of Fleetwood Mac) as they performed onstage.  This was a book that was so easy to read, so easy to actually see the characters in your mind’s eye and feel their emotions and attitudes – it was really a very enjoyable reading experience.  Kudos to Taylor Jenkins Reid on another fascinating story!

NAME: MJ Sativa
CONTENT: Passion in Paradise by Will Espero is about two families in Hawaii involved in politics and business. A wealthy hotel executive wants to be governor of Hawaii but his rival has other plans. Their adult children… વધુ fall in love, and a Waikiki fashion festival is the scene of a mysterious accident involving a past lover of a main character. An extortion scheme and restaurant shooting add to the suspense of this novel.

CONTENT: Did you ever reached the point that you must put the book down because its getting too intense? 😂 I am so close to the end of the book and things gets so intense that I can't read 😂😂😂 taking small bits and with… વધુ "oh no no NO" putting down 😂😂😂 I want to know but can't handle the pressure 😂😂😂 I know there is next book coming after this so there should be some big development just where it will go? I could bite my nails now 😂😂😂 Book I am reading now is "Until I met her" by Natalie Barelli, next one "After he killed me" scarry me as HE is wrong, so bloody hell what's will go wrong???

NAME: Eedge Eeva
CONTENT: Hi, I am new one here. Excuse my mistakes as English is not my first language 😎 but I love reading 😍 usually I am sharing things just when really excited or really disappointed 😂 On Monday I started a book by… વધુ Alice Feeney "Sometimes I lie" and book was just so good that I  finished it already yesterday. What an amazing story with so unexpected turns and ending. When I thought I know what will happens, happened completely different things... This book was like a puzzle where you fitting in piece by piece. Good news, there will be a TV series 📺 all in progress! I was so excited that I decided to put in my to read list other Alice's books and today I started "His and hers"... I didn't done anything at home as I could not stop the book. I needed to know, what will be next. I just finished...  OMG what a story! All the way through you keep guessing who did it? and every time you think you know, you are wrong! Everyone fits in to be a killer but who is the real one? Absolutely unexpected ending! Great book and highly recommend to everyone who like a good twists in the book!

CONTENT: This book is a saga from 1-4. I skipped the book 1. Last time I read the book 2 about Hannah’s conflict- a Jew girl who joined in the resistance as a Parisian fighter. Ingrid thought her world was perfect and was brainwashed by Hitler until her father was executed by the Gestapo. Her world turned upside down. She learns her ex lover Sebastian was responsible for betraying her father. She vowed not to let another man win her heart. NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m glad I grab this book from local library. I’m reading a fascinating story of the Rosen family and how they survived. But this is a historical fiction and yes Holocaust has happened. The book is called… વધુ “Eli’s promise” by Ronald H. Balson. The story is a moving and suspenseful where he knows how to write a story that has your attention and energy, he also manages to throw many cliffhangers where you have to keep reading to see how it all ends. I wanted to know what happened to him and his loving family. There had to be people like Max, who profited from the war. I enjoy the way the author brought us back and forth through three time periods. The unfolding begins where Eli living a peaceful and quiet life in Lublin, Poland when suddenly his entire life is turned upside down after the Nazis took over Lublin. Life for Eli and his family becomes trapped. I recommend anyone to read this.

CONTENT: This book I’m reading is incredible, fast moving, thrilling, action with suspense, romance story called “The Berlin Escape” written by Warren Court. This is something different from what I normally read. I must… વધુ admit Warren knows how to write a story that has your attention and energy, he also manages to throw many cliffhangers where you have to keep reading to see how it all ends. It is about Aubrey Endeavours, a country girl like me, she’s not afraid to accept the challenge, (probably not me). If you’re a fan of Mr. bond movies, it’s for you. She was in a plane crash one year and half ago and then in 1936, she was on an assignment to spy for her country, in Germany as a journalist for exhibitions. What a thrilling story isn’t. You decide?
