NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: An interesting and short summary of Elvis life. The great king of the rock ‘n’ roll pop. The book I’m reading is called “Elvis: behind the legend” written by Trina Young. I wasn’t born when Elvis was singing or… વધુ when he died. My mother said she was his number one fan. She still loves his music, songs and movies which still showing on the tv, when I was a child. Every middays I would watch him on a screen when he is making movies and singing at the same time. I love his movies and the songs. I am a rock roll chick. Sadly, it has been 45 years since his death. This book describes his relationships with his parents, in particular, his mother, the Beatles and how his life was shaped and how he was involved becoming a music from a young age. I learned so much about Elvis life.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This was the second book I had read by Lily Graham. The first book I read the title “The German Girl” I didn’t enjoy the book because the story wasn’t unexciting for me. The second book is called “The Secret… વધુ Paris” I finish reading today is way intriguing and beautiful story about love, war and family tragedy which I enjoy the story because the writing is beautiful and flows from the first to the end. The story is about Valerie, where the story begins in recent times, but there are long flashbacks to the war years of 1940-1942 and 1962-63. The last time she was in Paris when she was 3 years old. She had to send away to England to live with her aunt and uncle. She decides to return to Paris to meet her grandfather Vincent. She pretended to work for him at his bookshop. He doesn’t know that woman is her granddaughter. Valerie wants to know what happened to her parents during the ww2 and she also fell in love with her best friend Freddy. You can decide?

NAME: Linda B Matthews
CONTENT: Okay, All, I am seeking a creepy suspense novel that will grab me on the first page, and not require my stressed old brain to memorize more than a few characters...Edge of seat Scarey is fine; gory and/or hurt kids and any kind of torture is not. And I DETEST characters in big cities with fancy careers. Surprise endings such as found in a scarey [movie] like "The Others" is most welcome.  Ideas??

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: There's a lot of story lines. A lot of characters. And the imaginary versus real dialogue can sometimes be confusing until you get into the rhythm of the writing style. I read her first book, Clay Girl in 2019… વધુ and loved it. Reading this sequel, almost 3 years later, I was grateful that the author reminded me who was who and what was what or else I would have been completely lost.  The fact that the author worked in social services and used real life experiences to write this story is a horrifying thought. Children, people, actually live like this. Holy hell. I mean, I know intellectually about poverty and abuse and childhood trauma but to know the author actually met people who were living… વધુ

CONTENT: I just finished This Tender Land by Krueger.  Excellent story but remarkable how similar in story line and character profile it is to Lincoln Highway which I read this month as well.   Both are very enjoyable entertaining books but I’m sure my memory will mixed them up.

The story is a moving and suspenseful where she knows how to write a story that has your attention and energy, she also manages to throw many cliffhangers where you have to keep reading to see how it all ends. The story unfolds about Hannah is a Jew in Germany during WW II. She is working to help smuggle Jews out of Germany despite the dangers. She caught up with Sebastian, who she thought he was dead and had no contact with him for years. She loves him… વધુ

CONTENT: If you know me you know that reading is one of my breaths of life. Last year I read 113 books out of a goal of 75. The previous year I set a higher goal because of COVID and met that as well. Reading this many books gave me the desire I wanted +. I was able to make recommendations to many people looking for a book to meet that blank space in their… વધુ mind that needed filled. What I didn’t expect but was an added blessing was strangers walking up to me in stores asking for book recommendations; people out of state that didn’t know me from Adam and asking for recommendations for themselves and their teenagers. Do I have former teacher tattooed to my forehead??? It was a great feeling, thank you Lord for using me with what you have blessed me with these past 2 years.

NAME: Argeline Plarisan Albior
CONTENT: The Woman In the Window Book Review (ebook) A.J Finn. CONTENT: This is my 3rd book of 2022. This is another incredible book called “The commandant’s dog” by Shmuel David. This is probably a special and a one-of-a-kind, but inspiring story written book about the… વધુ commandant’s master dog, a Great Dane, a vicious that trained to kill, which is also capable of compassion, feeding one who is 17 years old young girl, and saving her life. She has always loved dogs even today at 94 years old. She recounts her story to her neighbour, Tom about her experience, because he is willing to write her for her. She, Nina, recounts her story to Tom in Israel, Tom. In the book, Yula wasn’t her real name. Her fortune teller told her she will lead a long life as a result. I’ve enjoyed the book because the wording is easy and it is YA, and of course, it has got me engaged from the first to the end. I couldn’t put it down.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This is my fourth book of 2022. I finished an interesting story is called “Heart Songs” by Barbara Buchsbaum Gilford. A heartfelt memoir about enduring love and what it means to be second-generation. The book… વધુ shows many photographs and describes where the author tells the story of the relatives she never knew who were lost in the horror of the Holocaust: her paternal grandmother, Oma Clara; her aunt, Gretl; and her eleven-year-old cousin, Susi. It is also gives us insight into the lives of her family members fleeing their homes from Czech, to other parts of the world. By correspondence letters between mother and son is so beautiful and looking after each other’s. Both are trying to reunite with each other. I did enjoy the book because it’s tender, sweet, sad, and beautifully written.

CONTENT: I just read this advance reader's copy of a memoir to be published on April 6, 2021, and thought it worthy of mention here: “My Broken Language: A Memoir”:  This memoir, so gorgeously written, takes us into the life of Quiara Hudes with her family of Puerto Rican immigrants in a barrio in Philadelphia.  Hudes writes with a poetic zest about her… વધુ training to become an accomplished and very talented musician.  She produced a musical during her early years at Yale and went on to become a prize-winning playwright with the Broadway hit “In the Heights” and her Pulitzer-prize-winning drama “Water by the Spoonful.”  While Hudes’ world is certainly different from my world, with the Puerto Rican culture and Spanish innuendos, this is a story to be savored and a young woman to be admired for her perseverance and dedication, not to mention her immense talent!

CONTENT: I finished another fantastic story of tragedy, love and heartache written book called “The Other Blue Sky” is one of the most interesting and powerful books I’ve ever read, by, Shari. J. Ryan, once again did a… વધુ phenomenal job of telling the story of Annie (Lucie) a missing baby from a concentration camp and she is searching for answers. The story unfolds about her crazy family who adored her and her husband Fisher, who would do anything to make her happy. It tells between the past of young Annie, she meets Fisher and present where she describes how she feels when she lost Sky. This book explains about survival and healing for a family who were part of this atrocious time in their history. This is a page turner and interesting which this story follows with the first book called “Last words” that flows perfectly together.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I read another romance story I loved and enjoyed reading by the same author named Shari. J. Ryan. This book is called “The Bookseller of Dachau”. This is a powerful and heart wrenching story. I must say this… વધુ author’s research really wonderful which is an open page turner and the story written is very captivating and riveting that I simply can’t put it down that it took me within a few hours to finish. The story unfolds about a gentile German girl Matilda and a Jewish boy Hans. They were childhood sweethearts trying to survive the hatred and suffering of Germany through the WW2. Matilda protects Hans that he is in danger of hiding him in her attic for months, smuggling food and communicating in whispers until his fate comes to worst. It shows between the past and present day, the granddaughter of Matilda, Grace, receives a letter from Germany about her grandmother’s bookshop in Dachau from America in 2018. She decides to travel to Germany to discover her roots. She learns about her long-lost grandmother, Matilda, and the sacrifices and most remarkable life she led as a result.

NAME: Linh Kelly Chu Sramek
CONTENT: I’m still reading this book, The Sacred Willow: Four Generations in the Life of a Vietnamese Family by Duong Van Mai Elliott, and have learned so much about my culture and country during the times she wrote… વધુ about. Even though I haven’t quite finished it yet, I highly recommend it as there are many varied aspects, not just political, presented in her family’s story. One point that stands out as I was reading last night: the acceptance, albeit reluctant and resigned, by so many married women (and society in general) of their husband’s philandering ways and having concubines/2nd wives. It may be hard for us Vietnamese growing up in America to understand this, and it’s unbelievable that it still occurs today, yes, even in America. But sadly, it’s also the story that runs in many of our families. I could never accept this as a cultural “norm” and would not EVER let a man hurt me this way. Why do women have to continue to accept the subjugation to men’s needs and wants?? We have to be stronger than that and stop allowing it to happen. WE control our narrative!!

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: TOP 10 BOOKS BLOG POST UP! www.booksinaminute.blogspot.com Not a bad reading year, 2021. No major slumps, some brilliant writers and stories, even some surprises - including a few highly-anticipated… વધુ reads/authors I fully expected to be on this list, but for one reason or another fell short.  There may be books I read in 2021 that I gave higher star ratings to than a few listed here, but I've come to realize that, by end of year, what makes my Top 10 Reads list are those books that have stuck with me. Stories and characters I still think about weeks (or even months, in some cases) late; books that have left a permanent mark like a visceral punch to the gut. These are those ten. To put it in… વધુ

Volume 1 of Les Miserables completed. It’s quite an undertaking at 35 hours… વધુ reading, so I’m treating it like a series and reading 1 volume per month. Now down to a remaining 27 hours. Loving the story. Victor Hugo has a very good handle on human nature. Times change but our responses to other people and events never does. 3. This Lovely City - Louise Hare. NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: A truly inspiring, beautiful and powerful written story of Eli Reismann, born in Czechoslovakia. He shared his childhood memories about his family, home, friends, schooling, and life in Czech. He also describes… વધુ every happy memory he shares with his grandparents who he loves them dearly. He was deported in May, 1944 and arrive in Auschwitz- Birkenau on his 15th birthday and against all odds, he was saved five times, survived a living hell on his own. He was lucky. As a result, he married Miriam and have three children, 7 grandchildren and 11 great grandchildren. He built a successful career as a film producer. The wording is so easy, because he explained so much intriguing, original, that filled with so many photos that is like we are living within his story. I couldn’t put it down.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I always loved a old soul of a romantic story book called “Unspoken words” by Shari J Ryan. This is a short three series of books. This book is similar to the book I previously read “Love and Hate”. I must say;… વધુ an extraordinary storyteller the author wrote this book. The Holocaust isn’t easy part to write or read. It gives a great insight to things to some good German people wasn’t aware of the madman (evil) time in history. This is a heart wrenching love story between Charlie and Amelia. Charlie’s story unfolds the past in the beginning (their past) and present (their future). The Charlie story goes back when he was 12 years old, he had no idea why he has to change schools (Youth camp) he was forced to hate the Jews. But until then he meets a Jewish girl, Amelia, of course they should hate each other but they fell in love. I simply can’t put down as a result, I’ll continue to read another book called “Last words” which is Amelia’s side of the story.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This time the story is about Romania Jews. The title is called “The Fortress” by Jonathan Hillingers. He wrote this book based on his mother’s childhood memories story. His father’s side family all were… વધુ murdered in Auschwitz expect his grandfather and great grandfather have survived Auschwitz, then later when they were released great grandfather died. Nelu escapes from his home and become homeless and find shelter with other homeless children. Daniel comes from a wealthy Jewish family. On the New Year’s Eve, Daniel’s family had to flee and Daniel told his father, where he saw other homeless children hidden that called “the fortress”. Once the Nazis came closer they had to escape and breaking up into groups of three; they escape to Palestine; some find fighting alongside the ally forces against Nazis; some stay in Palestine. This book, in the first few chapters was bit slow, however it is a great story of how the street kids survived the war two and grow into beautiful adults people. I’ve enjoyed the book because it’s easy, short and brilliant story and I couldn’t put it down.

Little does she anticipate the lifestyle that Sam will lead her into.  He is a schemer, a manipulator and a con artist. Bit by bit he trains her to recognize “marks” and to devise scams. His mode of operation is to find wealthy passengers on cruise ships from whom he can steal, whether it is jewels, personal information or cash for his… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is totally the opposite view during the war from the eyes of a 16 year old German boy. It is a very uplifting, intriguing and captivating story written book by his daughter E.A. Dustin called “Save me… વધુ twice” it gives the different perspective of being a teenaged German (not Jewish, not Nazi) boy during the war, and his experiences, thoughts and feelings. Karl, his older brother Hans and Hermann were forced to join Hitler youth group. One night the SS knocks on the door of Karl, and forces him and his older brother, Hans, to join the German army, which they had no idea and had no choice to obey the rules. I found it intriguing because it explores an aspect of the war that is not much discussed in our history books as a result.

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: I read this at lightening speed. I suck at math and yet this story is about math but it's also about so much more: who are we, do we belong, where do we belong, why are we the way we are? And within this line… વધુ of questioning -- where do women belong? How society creates a path for men and alters that path so it's unachievable for women to traverse.  I loved how the author was able to take complex mathematical theories and describe them in laymen's terms. So intriguing and expanded my mind and my curiosity.  The historical aspect of the story and the personal journey of our main character is wholly satisfying as well. The weaving of all these different aspects is done handily. It is rich in the telling and generous in sentiment.  Every single woman should read this book. Not because of the character or even about her personal family story but because it's a searing observation about how society regards and actually treats women. Brilliant, truly.  And after you've read it, share it with all the men in your lives please.

The granddaughter found her grandfather’s memoirs book he wrote about his life during the War two from June 1941 until January 1945. She wanted to translate all his original words. The story has got me engage from the fist sentence to the end sentence because this is neither YA or adult. You can decide.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book you might like: "The Burning Room" by Michael Connelly.  Having read 23 of Michael Connelly’s novels, most of which have featured LAPD Detective Harry Bosch, and being an avid fan of Michael Connelly, you are probably jumping to the conclusion that I will be touting this novel.  And you’d be right!  I thoroughly enjoyed Harry Bosch’s… વધુ pursuit of an “open-unsolved” case with his new young partner, Lucia Soto.  The in’s and out’s and up’s and down’s of pursuing a case twenty years after the crime was committed will keep you turning the pages of this one.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: Brothers on Three follows an incredible basketball team from a reservation school in Arlee, Montana to multiple state high school championships.  They survive in the face of hardship, generational trauma,… વધુ cluster suicide and discrimination because they gather their strength from love of family and community, an intense connection to the land, and their devotion to native values and culture.  Thrilling basketball scenes and tournament battles, a vivid sense of place, and the authentic portrayal of complex individuals pull this story together.  Abe Streep has crafted a moving and powerful book of heartbreak, inspiration and hope.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: Heads up fans of epic fantasy!  Scorpica, by Greer Macallister hits bookstore shelves February 22, and you don't want to miss this one!  Scorpica takes place in a richly complex and magical matriarchy of five… વધુ queendoms which are held in peace by a truce that becomes fragile when the "drought" strikes.  Year after year there have been no female children born. Suspicion grows, deception lurks, and queens scheme for control, until  an enormously powerful sorceress threatens to destroy them all from within. Greer Macallister's incredible world building has provided an epic framework for heroes and villains to emerge in a generational battle for their civilization.  I can't wait for the book #2! Thanks to Simon & Schuster for an Advance Copy.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: A beautiful story, a powerful short, simple and beautifully written book; A moving page turner called “I carried them with me” by Sara Lumer. She is a Holocaust survivor and author. She was born on a Christmas… વધુ Day, in 1927, a town called Sekernice, in Czechoslovakia. She has two older brothers and one younger sister. When she turned 16 years old, she moves to Budapest, Hungary, to be closer to her older brothers. Her two older brothers take a good care of her. She worked as a seamstress. During 1944 in March, the Nazis invaded Hungary. She was sent to two different labor camps and experienced two long death marches. She was liberated by the Americans. She and her two oldest brothers have survived the Holocaust. She also lived until 92 years old. The story has got me engaged from the first sentence to the end sentence because this could be neither YA of adults for me. You can decide?

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I read this wild and easy going woman who is an author and a Holocaust survivor, the other day. Her memoirs book called “Vera” by Vera Wasowski with Robert Hilman. He was interviewing a 80 year old Vera. I… વધુ enjoy her book, what a miracle, wild , funny, and sad life she has led. The writing is a bit complicated for me, maybe not for others? You decide? She is a famous journalist. Her story is one of an child surviving hell. She grew up in Lwow, Poland and when she was 7 years old, she was only an child, the Nazis invaded her hometown and was forced to live in the ghetto. She watched her father took his life and her mother was sexual blackmail with her uncle in exchange for survival. After the war, she, her husband Jan and son migrated to Australia, Melbourne.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: A wonderful book, beautifully written and a beautiful page turner are called “Surviving the War” by Adiva Geffen. She wrote the book and the narrative story the voice of a 90 year old grandmother was telling… વધુ her grandchildren about her life. A remarkable true story about a strong woman in a horrible time. I have read so many Holocaust stories since last year, but this one shows that how she, Shurka went through so much pain, loss, courage, happiness and love. This is all about survival and hope. This book reminds me of the movie “Defiance” I did enjoy a tremendous book all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down as a result.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and thought I'd tell you what I think of it: "Malibu Rising" by Taylor Jenkins Reid.  I guess one would call this “chick lit” – a tale full of “beautiful people” with money, a tale of California teenagers born to surf the ocean every day, a tale of people impressed with stardom and other beautiful people.  The party the… વધુ Rivas throw every August to signal the end of summer is large with over 200 of those “beautiful people” together drinking, doping, sexing, and doing outrageous, damaging things.  This is a story of the “me generation.”  I can’t say that I loved it, but I read it avidly – it’s well written, it was compelling, and it paints a picture of a world of which I am glad I am not a part.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: It is an incredibly powerful and emotional story that is very well written by Ulrich Alexander Boschwitz and he is an expectational novel called “The Passenger” he wrote the book in 1938. He wrote this first… વધુ book at just 23 years old. He left Germany in 1935 for Oslo, Norway, studied at the Sorbonne in Paris, and wrote two novels, including The Passenger. He comes from a Jewish background. Such a huge tragedy also that this talented young writer did not live long enough to create more brilliant works that capture the zeitgeist of the second world war, and Nazi Germany. In this book, he wrote a very moving page turner, I didn’t want the book to end- and not only because the story was very suspense that keeps you riveted from the start to the end. I did enjoy the short book. It was really easy wording and the language is for young adult. It doesn’t show any graphic violence or sexual violence in the book. This story of a Jewish man Otto Silberman on the run. You can decide?

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: Though I saw this coming - she herself had completely stopped from posting on her own page some time ago, questions about whether she was okay going ignored - it breaks my writer and especially reader's heart… વધુ to learn that Anne Rice has died. 'Interview With the Vampire' remains one of my top ten favorite books of all time, more than 40 years after reading it, and Rice's talent at putting you in a scene with her characters was always unmatched. Truly a sad, heartbreaking day. 😥

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: It is an incredibly powerful and emotional story that is very well written by Gabrielle Saab, called “The last checkmate”. This book is not just another Auschwitz story. It focuses on resistance prisoners at… વધુ the camp, where is that it focuses not on the main character's romance (though there is one), but on Maria's friendships with other women, namely, Irina and Hania. The story itself is fast-paced, the structure and ending executed to perfection, the writing emotional, making the reader feel as if we are in Maria's head, experiencing the hunger and cold, looking across the chessboard at her tormentor, embracing her friends, as guards walk by and the wintry, relentless air fills with smoke,… વધુ

He meets Kristin, a model, a Jewish lady. Every Jew people called her 'The Blonde Poison'. Her real name is Stella Goldschlag. She has been helping the Nazis to identify other Jews to save her identity and her parents. This is a bit difficult to follow, but it is a love story. I did enjoyed the book.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I'd like to recommend: "Our Woman in Moscow" by Beatriz Williams.  One of my favorite authors of historical fiction, Beatriz Williams, has come up with another fabulous tale.  This one is about the Cold War, the struggle after World War II in the 1940’s and early 1950’s between communism and democracy.  The basis of this story is the… વધુ infamous Cambridge spy ring made up of British citizens recruited by the Soviet spy agency, the NKVD, later known as the KGB.  Twin sisters, Ruth and Iris Macallister, are estranged.  When Iris and her husband, Sasha Digby, a British diplomat, disappear with their two children from their London apartment in 1948, it is a notable and mysterious… વધુ

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Read this book with a large box of tissues close beside you in your reading place! I read this book in one sitting , riding an emotional roller coaster all the way to the end ( by which time I could hardly see… વધુ through my tears! ). A well told story about life snd love, regret and repentance, beginnings snd goodbyes.  Fly Away by Kristen Hannah .

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: Another extraordinary true story about the nine females all were under their 30s when they joined the French resistance fighters in France. There were 6 French, 2 Dutch, and one Spanish. They were neither… વધુ students or secretaries. A beautifully written by Gwen Strauss. She explained how Helene podliasky and other eight women during the second war,  they escaped a German forced labor camp and made a ten-day journey across the front lines from Germany back to Paris. I really enjoyed reading the true stories of ordinary. People's life that they endured during the darkest time of our history. I read all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down.

NAME: Kelly Faas
CONTENT: Loving this one thus far. I think this group recommended this series. I am tired of Michael Connelly’s direction with the Harry Bosch series. I needed a new, interesting detective series. I admit I was a little in love with Harry……….but, time to move on.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book I’m reading is called “Those who saved us” written book by Jenna Blum. The story sets between the past and present day. Anna is a German, a 19 year old girl, who lives in Weimar, a small village in… વધુ Germany during WW2. She meets a Jewish boy Max Stern, a doctor. She took him in and hides. She falls in love with him. Her father is a Nazi officer, he found Max, he denounces him and he was sent to a camp. She learns she’s pregnant. She escapes to hide in a local bakery, an owner who is in the resistance and she had to stay alive for her daughter Trudy. She was forced to be SS mistress. Anna and Trudy 3, have survived by the American and she married Jack, an American solider. Trudy is now a professor of German history in Minnesota. She decided to complete a project about ww2 survivors and interviewing them. She wanted to know who her real father was and Anna refused to talk about her past and her earlier life. I really like the true stories of ordinary. People's life that they endured during the darkest time of our history. I read all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book I’m reading is about “The Last Daughter”, beautifully written book by Belle Ami. The author describes the young life of her mother Dinale, (Dina) through six years of torture, heartbreak, and courage.… વધુ It is a remarkable, love, hope, and survival. She endured so many challenges in her young life and was the only family to have survived. She was only ten years old when Nazis invaded Radom, Poland. They evicted from home to resettle in the ghetto. Dina was relocated several times before she was sent to Auschwitz and she became tattooed with A-14569. She later went to Bergen Belsen camp and saw the Frank sisters. She was liberated by the Americans. I read all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down. The story was riveting read from the first sentence to the last sentence. It is easy to follow because it feels like a YA book for me.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and loved it: "While Paris Slept" by Ruth Druart.  This novel paints a very vivid picture of the Nazi occupation of France in 1944.  Many French citizens of the Jewish faith considered themselves immune from the threat of the concentration camps.  They were first and foremost French citizens, after all.   In the crowded Drancy… વધુ railway station in 1944, only a few days after giving birth to their son, Samuel, Sarah and David Lafitte were arrested and being herded onto the train to Auschwitz.  Jean-Luc Beauchamp is working on the railroad in Drancy and feeling discomfited by the litter of children’s toys and personal belongings discarded near the train.  Sarah collides… વધુ

What. Fun. by Chandler Baker The Magnolia Palace by Fiona Davis Game On by Stephanie Evanovich Pirate Girl Falls Through Beaver Dam by Wren Godfrey Chapman   A Cold Heart by Jonathon Kellerman   Man of Honor by Barbara Taylor Bradford  The Lincoln Highway by Amor Towles 3 stars: Sunshine Girl by Julianna Margulies The Color Purple by Alice Walker Fine Time for Exercise by Mike Dales

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is another romance thrilling story called “Playing with Matches” by Lee Strauss. This was an excellent story on the other side of German people in World War 2. It shows and tells us a view of those in… વધુ Germany who did not want war and who were not fans of Hitler. This is an excellent book for young adults. I'm an adult and I could not put it down. Sadly, the voices are those of children/teens and tell of the horrors they experienced. This story is about Emil Radle, his family and friends living in Passau, Germany. The German people who refused to join the Nazi party were especially watched closely by their Nazi neighbors. Soon Emil and Katharina are falling in love, Moritz, the only Jew in the group hides from the gestapo and the other boys end up in the war front.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I always loved a romance story. The author Ryan Armstrong is incredible writer. The book is called “Love and Hate” the story is a real eye opener because it’s riveting and fast paced packed adrenaline. The… વધુ story has got me engage from the first sentence to the end sentence. It is intense and tragic love story between young German soldier named Hand and a Jewish girl called Lilo. I learned Hans have a soft side as well. He hates his father but loves his mother dearly like Lilo. He was orphanage and was adopted from a good loving parents. His adoptive brother is a psychopathic is also a sadist soldier. It shows and explains the past and present The plot twists will shock you. You can decide.

CONTENT: This is a young adult book, this time. This is my second book I’ve read today about a boy went on Schindler’s list. The first book I read earlier this year is about a girl named Rena Finder. Her book title “My… વધુ survival; A girl on Schindler’s list”. She wrote exactly when I watched the movie about her and her mother walk in and gave Oskar birthday cake. He was drunk and kiss the mother’s lips. The second book is called “The boy on the Wooden Box” by Leon Lyson. He grew up in Poland and was one of the youngest people on Oskar Schindler’s list of Jews, number 289, Leon died in January 2013 at the age of 83, just before this book was published in August 2013.  He was only ten years old when the… વધુ

CONTENT: November Reads 1. Half Sick of Shadows - Richard Abbott. A fantastical take on the story we probably know best as The Lady of Shalott. Very short - a couple of hours at most. Held me captivated from beginning to end. Read it in one afternoon. 2. The Darling Buds of May - H E Bates. This is our book club choice for this month. What a cheerful,… વધુ rollicking read. You can’t help admiring such a relaxed attitude to life while at the same time rolling your eyes, half in horror, half in laughter. If only it could all be so simple. 3. NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: I know there is a lot of bias, by adult readers, when it comes to reading YA or kidlit of any kind (spoiler alert: if this is you, you have NO IDEA what you're missing)-but I also know that I try to very rarely… વધુ dole out 5-star ratings for books, and I already was giving this one five stars about a quarter of the way in .... and, incredibly, still felt the same when I finished (a rarity)! I believe it's listed as middle grade, though with how people are today I wonder if some of the imagery/"violence" later on in the book might be a bit much for sensitive kids or parents ... but this puppy is sure to be on my Top 10 Reads of 2021 list, and for days now have felt the need to share, so here we are. Cover image below, will include link for those wanting to see what it's about; definitely not your average Christmas book. I read it on Kindle via the library, now dying to own a "real" copy. Yeah, THAT good!  https://www.amazon.com/Christmas-Dinner-Souls-Ross-Montgomery-ebook/dp/B074824MFN/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=christmas+dinner+of+souls&qid=1638121769&sr=8-1

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Kya is a mere six year old child when she is abandoned by her family. She faces the grim reality of surviving alone on the marsh property where  her family has scraped  out a living for longer than Kya’s short… વધુ life. Kya learns to not only survive but to thrive on her own. Though she keeps to herself, she learns to love and  trust some special people from “town”. When the dead body of a prominent “townie boy “ is found  near Kya’s marsh shack,  she becomes the prime murder suspect.She is ridiculed and mistreated while imprisoned during the trial, but Kya’s heart is true and she refuses to lose faith in those special  friends who have earned her love.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m reading a short book called “Buttons in my soup” written by Holocaust survivor and author Moshe Ziv. This book is a open page turner and was a incredible written book. It carried amazing depth and… વધુ information as if it were written the day of events, who with great insight, resilience and strength of character survived the horrific experience of the holocaust. He was born in Miskolc, Hungary. He was 15 years old when his family was deported to Sararv camp, then he passed the selection at Auschwitz, then survived at hard labour Buchenwald, then arrive at Magdeburg camp to survive. When he was liberated only 40 people, including him when he was 17 years old. He went to France as orphan them emigrated to Israel. He raised a family and built an agricultural farm in Moshav Bnei Zion. 50 years later he began telling his story to his wife and later his children. Sadly, he passed away in 2008.

CONTENT: Did I drive two hours on Sunday & spend another 4+ putting this bookcase together, just to have this moment of pure satisfaction of seeing all of my books put away? I sure did. 😮‍💨 As I finished it, I got… વધુ excited thinking about posting this in my FB book groups because I know you guys appreciate things like this. 🥺 I can’t stop staring at it; it especially means a lot to me because I lived in a studio for 4 years with no room for a bookcase. Happy Reading y’all ❤️

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book I’m reading is called “I am Sasha” written by Anita Selzer. She wrote this book in honour of her father, Sasha and grandmother, Larissa. Sadly Larissa died in 1994 the following years later Sasha died… વધુ in 2006. Anita stated the names aren’t their real names, but it is still a true story. It is a remarkable, love, hope, and survival. It is a simple story where Anita writes the connections, both main characters, where a single mother isn’t easy to go through terrifying during the war to protect her son Sasha to became a girl, Sala. She is teaching him how to behave like a girl: his clothing, voice, hair, manners so on and was on a forge paper as Catholics. I read all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down. The story was riveting read from the first sentence to the last sentence. It is easy to follow because it’s YA book.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m reading a short book called “The song of the stork” by Stephan Collishaw. It is an outstanding story of love, hope, and survival. It is a simple story where Stephan writes the connections, a female… વધુ character, where Yael, 15, and a Jewish girl who is on the run from the Nazis. She finds a shelter on a farm and meet Aleksei. He is mute. They formed a friendship where he took her in his home and to feel safe and sheltered, of having food and water to wash, of being able to sit in front of a warm fire through the winter. The German comes back, Yael force and join the Parisian in the forest to find another place to shelter. I read all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down. I love a romance story because the story was riveting read from the first sentence to the last sentence.

NAME: Paul Bowen
CONTENT: THE ESCAPE by MATTHEW SLATER. Wow! A rollercoaster of a gangster crime thriller. Dealing with backstabbing, two-faced scumbags is all part and parcel of criminal mastermind Bryan’s world, until a deal goes… વધુ south on him. Left for dead, Bryan manages to survive only to find himself sentenced to life in prison, with a minimum of 30 years.  In keeping with the title, Bryan escapes after ten years. Starting over again from rock bottom, his search for revenge takes him through the city’s backstreets. You can almost smell and taste the garages, apartments, and takeaway joints. Like the novel, they felt all too real. Not only does Bryan have a depth of character, but so do those around him. Often,… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: The book I borrow from the library is called “Because of Romek” by a Holocaust survivor David Farber and Anna Vaisman. This book is the second edition which he got the help of his granddaughter Anna to write… વધુ book together in 2006. When David got a letter from the German government to ask him to testify the war crimes and he agreed to testify against the Nazis. He began to tell his story about the horrors of his experience. He survived 9 concentration camps. He had witnessed his brother died in front of him by the Gestapo, his parents and 5 of 6 sisters were murdered. He was only 13 years old at the time and when he was 18 years old he was liberated. He went to find his old sister who stayed… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is another interesting short story. It must be very difficult for the boys during the war broke out. This book is called “A good Nazi” by David Canford. During the mid 1930s, Torsten, a good German… વધુ boy is pushed by older kids. Joseph, a Jewish boy saved him. They try for a place on the German ski team for the 1936 Winter Olympics. Joseph father help Torsten to work with him become a good shoemaker. Torsten’s father becomes depressed and suicide himself. His mother remarried Guber, a Nazi. He and his sister hates stepfather. Later Torsten sister Irigid become involved with Joseph. She was pregnant with his child. His mother decided to take her away so no one to be seen. Guber soon… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is historical fiction, and I read all afternoon and I couldn’t put it down. I love a romance story as well. The book is called “The Star and the Shamrock” by Jean Grainger. Ms. Grainger wrote a… વધુ splendid story about intrigue, suspense, a mixture of characters, and love. It also shows no horrific violence, just a straightforward WW2 love and spy story. The story recounts Ariella fears that her husband never came home. She decides to put her two children on a kinder transport to stay with Elizabeth Klein, which Ariella’s cousin Rudi’s wife to take care of her children when things were bad in Germany.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read: "The Fifth Avenue Story Society" by Rachel Hauck.  Here’s another page-turner by Rachel Hauck, author of "The Wedding Dress."  The story features five New Yorkers, all of whom receive a mysterious invitation to the Fifth Avenue Story Society in the Bower Room at the Fifth Avenue Literary Society Library.  None of the five… વધુ is familiar with the Literary Society or its members.  Curiosity brings them together each Monday evening, and as they become acquainted with each other, they exchange their life stories, some of which are exceedingly difficult to impart.  Each of the five has a viewpoint, and the story is deftly told to encourage the reader to press on through the book to learn the untold stories of the five protagonists.  I enjoyed this book and recommend it for your reading pleasure.

NAME: Christine Finnegan
CONTENT: I just finished Extreme by Joan Gelfand. I loved it -- the story is set against the backdrop of a silicon valley high-risk gaming startup  peopled with world-class skateboarders and power-hungry executives. I started it on Saturday and finished it today -- I could not put it down!

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: The Story of an Incredibly Brave, Strong, and a Courageous Woman named Ruth Uzrad. She is a survivor and is the author of this book called “A girl called Renee”. She was a teenage woman who has common sense and… વધુ through her years of the hardships travel through Nazi to freedom. She was also strong and independent. Later, Ruth joins the Jewish underground movement in France and takes on a false identity. With her new name, Renee, she does everything she can to save as many Jews as possible, knowing that it could cost her life. It was really a one person story and made the reading easier to follow and I’ve enjoyed the book. It recounts the story where she born in 1925 and she’s oldest of three daughters to a religious Jewish family. When her father got arrested from their apartment. Her mother sends their girls to escape for their safety.

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: Just finished Maggie-Lena Kennedy.  Three Stars. What can I say...I read it through without stopping...60%  interesting and I even got emotional...which is unusual for me. Maggie I found so naive and everything seemed to ocurr by, chance, coincidence or good luck. The rest was a typical 'and they all lived happily ever after'. I don't really take… વધુ to romance novels as such or 'chic or choc  lit' The last 40% reminded me of that, although that type of lit per se didn't exist as such at the time it was written.  I was a Catherine Cookson reader for a few years and quite honestly I became an avid reader at that time. Now SHE brings out all the essence of N.E. England's rural poverty in the 19th and 20th century,something lacking in this debut novel of Lena Kennedy.  Would appreciate some thoughts 😊📚📚📚

CONTENT: This book was cute, fun and warm-hearted. The ending was a little contrived and a bit unbelievable but it didn't detract from the book. It took me a short time to get used to the narrator, once I did all was fine. Truthfully I don't usually listen or read romances but this one was free. Enjoy!

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This is the true story of three young sisters, their brother and parents, members of the Kroch family from Leipzig who escaped from Germany in 1930s by being smuggled into Belgium, France, losing all their… વધુ material possessions, but not their optimistic outlook on life. The author, Celia Clement, is the daughter of Alexandra and the niece of sisters, Judith and Eva. Celia wrote the book based on her family where she explains the voice of her mother, age 11, and her aunt Eva, 15, and Judith, 14. They share their story about their escape from the Nazis. It is a short interview that has a 178 page interview with the story of uplifting, incredible people, strong, loving, loyal, with many bonds of friendships with both families and friends helped each other. It is also beautifully written with photos, historical references and questions for any age readers will learn something new to educate them in schools and make this book to convey into movies.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: The short book has only got 189 pages. The book is called “The footsteps of Anne Frank” by Ernest Schnabel. He is a German journalist. He had written two novels by the outbreak of WW2. He translates this book… વધુ from German to English. He was asked by Otto Frank to write a book to help. He researched really excellent and interesting. He interviews brief information from people who knew Anne, and told what they knew and little interactions with her from the secret hiding, Westerbork transit camp, Auschwitz, and Bergen Belsen. It makes sense and gives more detailed information and more insight into the type of person Anne was. I’ve enjoyed the whole story about war and politics.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read: "The Maidens" by Alex Michaelides.  This is a murder mystery.  It grabs your attention almost immediately with the brutal murder of a young student at Cambridge University who was a member of a group of Greek mythology students called “The Maidens.”   The name refers to the cult of Eleusis in ancient Greece, whose… વધુ followers worshipped Demeter and Persephone.   The combination of modern-day views of Cambridge University mixed with the brutality of the murders and the references to Greek mythology makes for a story that caught my interest and didn’t let go until the very surprising ending.  Michaelides’ first book was the best seller “The Silent Patient.”  It will be interesting to see what he comes up with next.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: The book I am reading is called “A Champion Cyclist Against the Nazis” by Alberto Toscano, this author is an Italian journalist, writer and political scientist. This book only has 190 pages and is based on a… વધુ true story written book about the Italian cyclist and world legend man. It is great a mixture of history, sport, and the legend man Gino Bartali. I’ve enjoyed where Gino lived, how he grew up and why he makes these choices. He grew up in Florence, Italy. He follow to be a cyclist in honour his older and younger brothers tragically died from cyclists. As a result he risked his lives to save 800 Italian Jews and children from deportation by forged papers. A such a beautiful and interesting story ever I have read.

What is a society? And what are we ready to sacrifice to protect them? It has been two years since everything that no one wants to think about happened, everyone has tried to move on but something with this part of the forest never really allows us to do it. The small town where the story takes place reminds me of the small town where my family and I lived for many years. The people take care of each other no matter what life throws at them. This book is now on my list of classic stories I will never forget!

Very good characterization, an excellent and credible plot, a realistic conclusion make this novel a real page-turner. I also learned a lot about Rome under the German occupation. Highly recommended!

NAME: Nikki Hughes Looney
CONTENT: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue was our book club selection this month.   I was worried going in, because it has had so many negative reviews.    I found it absolutely beautiful!    The book is slow starting,… વધુ but once you finish, you discover that it really isn’t.   It is so profoundly done that it really ties into the theme of the story.   I realized, thinking through the comments that we rush so much in our world, and sometimes I think we rush the storyline in the books we read.   I would encourage anyone willing to go there, to sit back and savor.   There is a LOT to savor in this story, just like there is a lot to savor in our lives!.   (Hence all my ”little nuggets” to bring to discussion!) 4.5⭐️

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and enjoyed: "The Paris Bookseller" by Kerri Maher.  A historical novel after my own heart, "The Paris Bookseller" is an intriguing story of one of the most famous bookstores in the world, Shakespeare and Company, in Paris, France, starting in 1919 when Sylvia Beach first opened it as the first English-language book store… વધુ in the French capital.  The prominent writers of the 1920’s and 1930’s frequented Shakespeare and Company, and it became a gathering place for people like Ernest Hemingway, Ezra Pound, Gertrude Stein and, of course, James Joyce, whose novel "Ulysses" Ms. Beach published in segments.  This is an interesting glimpse into a time when prohibition was on in the USA, and many artists and writers escaped to Europe to enjoy the lifestyle, and the discussion of banned books and pirating manuscripts was enlightening.  I enjoyed this book immensely!  I was privileged to read an advanced reader’s copy, and the book will be published on January 11, 2022.

NAME: Tim Price
CONTENT: Thoroughly enjoyed this one; a bit like Midsomer Murders meets Shrek.  If you thought nursery rhymes were for children, think again!  The question of who killed Cock Robin is still unanswered as the trial of… વધુ his alleged murderer collapses and the investigating officer disappears. DI Jerome Devereaux and DC Polly Huckabee are sent to South West England and the little-known independent Kingdom of Dumnonia to reinvestigate the murder and find the missing sheriff.  Dealing with his own inner demons, Devereaux, along with Huckabee, discovers a land full of mystery and intrigue whilst having to deal with its bizarre inhabitants. As their investigation takes a series of disturbing twists and turns, they uncover more about a world of characters many of whom you will recognise but know very little about.  Until now………

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: Portugal, 1755, an artist, Pêro Manuel Pires we know about next to nothing apart from making famous artful tiles! Cut from the Earth, by Stephanie Renee Dos Santos . (first book) The author has masterly woven… વધુ with what she knew the life the artist might have led.  Pêro is not only a tiler, he is also a padre who seeks to save slaves by buying them free. For that he works hard along his wife, also an artist but forbidden to work as she is a woman. He leads a good life until a catastrophic earthquake literally destroys life as he has known along with Lisbon... What I particularly enjoyed in this novel is the extensive research the author has successfully interwoven around the characters' art… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: A deserved break from reading for 3 weeks. This book is a long reading which is over 400 is called “The Light at Midnight” by Tom Ruppert. This was an exceptional book. Great lead, a female, Rivka. Great each… વધુ charters tells story in the past and present times, which I have enjoyed the story. She grew up in a small town called Nashok, Lithuania. Nazi massacre her family. She spent her years fighting against Nazi as partisan and force to throw in Auschwitz and was liberated by the U.S. Rivka soon faces a Nazi man who have massacre her family. Her turn to become a Nazi Hunter. Did she get her revenge? You can decide. The lives of those lost in the Holocaust should never be forgotten.

NAME: Kristine McKenna
CONTENT: Can’t wait to this book comes out. About Rosalind Franklin who did extraordinary work documenting the double Helix. Remember going to Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, NY and seeing the statue, but she was not… વધુ mentioned. Love Marie Benedict’s books. History is so interesting to me about this story. Glad she is finally getting credit for her work. Amazing and brilliant Woman. 🧬🧬🧬 I am trying to get this incredible book. Tomorrow, think the publisher will contact me about approving this book or not. Wish me luck. Women who are geniuses, just the same as James Watson deserve the credit for their incredible achievements.

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: This was a very good read despite its distressing topics while remaining thought provoking all the way through! Dark Dreams, by Ann Thorsson . Maggie has to fight many inner conflicts: loss of her father, a… વધુ gang rape, her own sexuality, a pregnancy at 16 along with her mother's attitude to the situation. In the 1970's, being a single mother was definitely a difficult situation! Add to it, rape, a baby and infanticide, Maggie's psychological and emotional state is at its lowest. Keeping those vital secrets from her mother, Maggie is trying to deal with her life, trauma, guilt, freedom, revenge, justice... I read this novel in one go, not only because of its shortness, but also because Maggie woke some emotions in me (compassion, anger, helplessness) and I wanted to know whether she will be saved from herself. A touch of supernatural haunts the novel, not overwhelming though as the reader knows.... A conflicting, intense read which I highly recommend!

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: Just finished this in-between book Bring Me Back. The second or third I've read by B.A Paris...who by the way everyone seems to rave about.  Three stars as I couldn't put it down. I thought that something… વધુ different would happen. Thank goodness it was a short read. By about 25% of the book I had deduced everything.  A lot of loopholes and incidences that went on and on. I can't say much not to give a spoiler...but quite honestly I thought the 'twist' a bit far fetched...was the chap 'dumb' or something??? Much prefer K.L.Slater and others. I don't regret reading it but wouldn't recommend it.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I'd like to recommend: "Never Have I Ever" by Joshilyn Jackson.  I am a Joshilyn Jackson fan!  Her books have never failed to engage me, and this one is no exception.  The dilemma in this story involves keeping secrets throughout one’s life – I’m not talking small secrets – and dealing with the events that threaten to reveal those… વધુ secrets to those whose love and trust one has worked so hard to nurture and build.  I guess you could call this book a “thriller,” but this is no ordinary thriller, and its twists and turns will keep you turning the pages till you find out how in the world this story can ever end.  Ms. Jackson pulls it off without a hitch.  I loved it!  Hope you do too!

NAME: RJ O'Neill
CONTENT: Vacation? Staycation?  Try salty, spicy, and sweet for a TREAT!!! You'll be THANKFUL you did. Just GOBBLE up all four today! THE OBX ROMANTIC THRILLER SERIES  by Desiree DeMond #Romantic #MultiRacial #Thrilling… વધુ #Mystery #CrimeStory #Playful #MultiCultural #Inclusive #Exciting Wonderful depiction of the OBX with love, steamy passion and seduction, and murders to solve. Full of plot twists and page turning action. My memories of time spent on the Outer Banks come alive. These books kept me reading all night. If you like a blend of romance and crime thriller, I definitely recommend this series. ORDER on Amazon (E-book or Paperback) or ask your local bookseller to order a copy for you. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08KTL2R3N

CONTENT: Does anyone know this quote in which book? I read it in my mother tongue- Vietnamese, but I know it's not in any Vietnamese book. I tried to translate it back to English, so maybe it's not entirely accurate. This is the quote: " My life has become so degraded that if I had to choose between falling in love with a woman and reading a love book, I would choose the book."

NAME: Donna Brossette
CONTENT: If you like books about WWII, "Beneath A Scarlet Sky" is a true story about an Italian teenager's "incredible courage and resilience during one of history's darkest hours".  Another book that kept me up all night!

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: A true story again which I have found extremely interesting! I have spent all Saturday evening and all Sunday reading this novel I could not put down. A 5* novel. (Published on December 7th, 2021). John Brown's… વધુ Women, by Susan Higginbotham . The life of the Brown family is definitely well worth telling! Fighting against slavery before the American Civil War, John Brown has been backed up by his whole family, starting by his seemingly unassuming wife Mary. The same is true about his daughters and daughters-in-law. One might think they were in the background. However, not because they were obeying wives, but because they fully embraced John's views about slavery, they did everything they could… વધુ

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: Prepare some tissues for this very touching memoir! And the Little One Said, by Elizabeth Coffey . How can I review this moving, poignant and thought provoking memoir? I was touched by the author's honesty, the… વધુ closeness of her family and her intimate thoughts on all deaths, accidents surrounding her and her family. Her way of dealing with the amount of grief always with a reach for wit made me grieve with her but also laugh! This has helped a lot to read the book because it is quite heavy emotionally speaking! However, I could not put it down! This memoir is a tribute to unconditional love which I am glad she can enjoy to survive all she has had to endure. A great read!

Read it slowly but try to allocate time to it so you don't get busy and have to refresh your memory. A great read, IMO.

NAME: Wendy Scott
CONTENT: Thank you NetGalley and St. Martin’s Essentials for this free copy in exchange for my honest review. This was a 5-star read in my opinion, taking a story told time and time again and making it new. This story… વધુ is nothing new; we’ve all heard it before. What the author does here though is what is new and different. The imagery that his writing projects into the readers mind is artistic. The first quote that caught me was, “…she uttered a bray that was like a pump gone dry.” Then in the Notes and References the reader learns that it was ‘pilfered’ from Elizabeth Bishop. Fine. But it paints the sound in the readers mind. Another, the flies reconnoitering on the wall of the ox’s stall. That is an… વધુ

NAME: Mags Tam
CONTENT: FINISHED!I loved On Gold Mountain by Lisa See. Here is a synopsis:In 1867, Lisa See's great-great-grandfather arrived in America, where he prescribed herbal remedies to immigrant laborers who were treated… વધુ little better than slaves. His son Fong See later built a mercantile empire and married a Caucasian woman, in spite of laws prohibiting interracial marriage. Lisa herself grew up playing in her family's antiques store in Los Angeles's Chinatown, listening to stories of missionaries and prostitutes, movie stars and Chinese baseball teams.With these stories and her own years of research, Lisa See chronicles the one-hundred-year-odyssey of her Chinese-American family, a history that encompasses racism, romance, secret marriages, entrepreneurial genius, and much more, as two distinctly different cultures meet in a new world.Lisa See has written several books in a variety of genres.  I have read and enjoyed all of her books.  I think my most favorite of all was this one about her family.

NAME: Amy Hammond Hagberg
CONTENT: I read some really great books in October, and a few duds. Isn't that always the way? Which of these have you read? America by Mike Bond (3.5), The House of the Spirits by Isabel Allende (3.5), The Last Mrs.… વધુ Parrish (3.5) by Liv Constantine, A Devotional Journey through Proverbs by Our Daily Bread (4), The Night Watchman by Louise Erdrich (5), The Stolen Baby by Diney Costeloe (5), Cloud Cuckoo Land by Anthony Doerr (4.5), The Dogs of Winter by Ann Lambert (3), and Lethal Agent by Kyle Mills (4). My reviews are available on my blog and on Goodreads: Amy Hagberg.

NAME: Sahanaz Khanam
CONTENT: Change or Die:: Abuse to Addiction to Abundance. A powerful emotionally poignant true story written with humour and showing how life can be transformed. Kindle Edition This is a revealing true story that will… વધુ engage, shock, and make you laugh. It begins in an impoverished environment of abuse and violence. Years of drinking eventually resulted in being sectioned in a psychiatric hospital as an alcoholic with mental health issues. After a number of months, I escaped from this hospital and managed to continue to make a complete mess of my life. At 34 I tried to stop drinking. Silly me! I ended up in a coma on my death bed with delirium tremors (DTs). This time I was sent to a rehabilitation… વધુ

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: October ReadsThe Harbor - Ernest Poole. The story of man whose life revolves around the Harbor. He vows to leave but is drawn back. I hadn’t heard of Ernest Poole until I read his Pulitzer prize winner His Family, which I liked. I like The Harbor even more. Set in the days when America was growing and changing. I think this is the better book - but… વધુ there was no Pulitzer Prize when it was written.2. Home Stretch - Graham Norton. I never thought I would read Graham Norton - no particular reason, I just wasn’t attracted. This book though, is excellent. I’m so glad it was recommended as our book group read. And the discussion it provoked was even better. Set in Ireland from the late 50s up to… વધુ

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: Oh dear, another excellent novel I highly recommend!  Beyond the Ghetto Gates, by Michelle Cameron. Set in Ancona, Italy in the Jewish Ghetto during the Napoleon's Italian Campaign, this novel has left on me a… વધુ lasting impression! First on a historical level, and second by the various themes broached upon. From history lessons about Napoleon at school, I forgot a lot. However, what struck me then and what I never forgot is Napoleon's concept of religion: the people need religion to get a moral structure, guidance. He reinstated the right to religious faith and soon church bells started to ring again. (He was also the first to officially open Jewish Ghettos gates! ) I started then to view… વધુ

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: What a fully captivating story from the very first page! The Woman at the Gates, by Chrystyna K. Lucyk-Berger . I held my breath during most of my reading this novel set in WWII and first taking place in… વધુ Ukraine! Sitting between the Russians (who already had had a hold on Ukraine and wanted it back) and the Germans, Ukrainians relentlessly fought for the independence of their country! Based on true events and the writer's family history, I felt with all main characters fighting for their lives and their country. What I particularly enjoyed in this novel lies with the extensive (though not overwhelmingly) historical background, but also with the characters. Not only fighting for their country… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I read a short book called “Catriona’s War” by Jean Grainger. It has only got 11 chapters, 81 pages. This book was an eye page turner, short, moving, suspense that keeps you riveted from the start to the end. I… વધુ did enjoy the short book. It was really easy wording and the language is for young adult. It doesn’t show any graphic violence or sexual violence in the book. Catriona's father is Irish and her late mother was French and she spent 12 years in a boarding school in Belgium and was thus tri-lingual (French, German, English). Her father is an Irish journalist for the French spy. When her father went missing. She adores her father and she is all she got. They contact Catriona in London, where she living. She helps them to continue the work that her father had started “turning” a Nazi officer who hated Hitler and the Nazi party. It was a daring, dangerous where she put herself at risk decision where she able to find the truth about her father and her family.

CONTENT: I'm sharing with you the last book I read in October.  I have read several  books by Stuart MacBride before but this is one of the best.   Couldn't put it down.  Great suspense, a  little but of humour and "A wee black doggie" for those of us who can't resist a dog.

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: I don't know why I have not read this book earlier as it was published in 2011 😂😂!! Probably busy with my kiddies💚💚 ! The Midwife of Venice, by Roberta Rich. I really enjoyed this novel set in Venice as well as… વધુ Malta in 1575. Hannah is a midwife, she is also Jewish. So, when she is asked to help a Christian woman to give birth, Hannah is confronted with moral dilemmas as it is unlawful for a Jewish midwife to assist Christian mothers. She accepts however and asks for a lot of (ransom) money who is needed to get her husband back from Malta. Isaac had been taken prisoner and sold as a slave after his ship had been captured... What I loved about this novel  rests in all the details regarding Jewish midwives' work as opposed to Christian midwives' work in those days. Fascinating on a religious/historical point of view. I also found interesting to read about Malta, its pirates and their prisoners' conditions... This novel is very entertaining, with much action and good historical background.

CONTENT: Eyes overloaded with information, a new generation for whom the rustle of the page may not hold the same magic... I wonder.  WIll audio books become the norm ?

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is new that have published this year in June. It’s called “One Girl in Auschwitz” by Sara Leibovits and Eti Elboim. Eti is the youngest daughter of Sara, a Holocaust survivor. An incredible written… વધુ and easy to read. This book is very captivating, unbearable, and it was very hard not to put the book down. It was horrendous to see how evil, monstrous, and influence Nazis was. It was also uplifting of love, loyalty, and family in the book because it explains the past and present in between with the mother and daughter experiences as a result after 70 years later

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m reading a book called “Yellow Star” by Jennifer Roy. This author who wrote this book is Sylvia’s aunt. Sylvia real name is Syvia. When Syvia was nearly 5 years old when world war broke out. She have spend… વધુ her childhood in the ghetto of Łódź since when she was ten years old. I did enjoyed the story from the author aunt version of when she was a child. This is just beautiful written, simple wording and anyone wouldn’t have trouble understanding this language. I’m shocked the Łódź ghetto was spared, only 1,200 people were allowed to stay behind to clean up, only 12 children and 800 adults survived the ghetto. If it wasn’t for her father’s wisdom and actions. Her family wouldn’t have survived. What a legend his father was.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and enjoyed: "The Wedding Dress" by Rachel Hauck.  This is chick lit, no two ways about it, but it’s also an interesting story about a wedding dress that is passed down through the years, starting with its design and completion in 1912 for a young bride who went against the wishes of her mother and the mores of the times… વધુ to have the dress made for her wedding, continuing to its wearing by another related bride in 1939 and a third one in 1968.  In current times, Charlotte, the owner of a bridal shop, impulsively buys an old trunk at auction at the urging of a little man in a purple vest who assures her that it’s hers.  When she discovers the contents are a beautiful vintage wedding dress and a sachet containing a set of military dog tags, the mystery begins to unwind.  I found this to be an interesting light read; maybe we could call it a modern-day fairy tale.

NAME: Don Salieri
CONTENT: 13 Spooky Read Recs for Halloween! Off the top of my head, not meant to be my top 13 or an all-inclusive list (and I purposefully did not include well-known horror classics). Note: #13, Dead & Buried: I can't… વધુ remember a thing about this, except reading it as a teen on a summer family vacation to a Minnesota cabin, and lying in bed ALL NIGHT LONG staring at the light shining through the flimsy curtain on my bedroom window of the cabin, waiting in sheer, silent terror for a silhouette to appear in it. For that reason alone, I put it on the list.

NAME: Kristine McKenna
CONTENT: Does Anybody Have a Favorite Book about Pets? Also, pictures of your Pet would be great to See 🐾🐾🐾 Can be any type or any pet. In my Winter group last year, someone had a pig as a pet and another woman raised… વધુ goats. I am partial to my dog, Jasper. Here he is reading + my latest book that I loved reading. It has so many cool places to go with your dog.

NAME: Paula New

NAME: Nancy Basham
CONTENT: I know I am a bit late in reading the book "American Dirt." I was turned off by the title, and didn't read it until a friend lent it to me. After reading it, I will never feel the same about any migrants from Mexico, Central, or South America or other countries where people live in fear of their lives because of drug lords. Yes, maybe some of the… વધુ drug smugglers are getting through to the United States, but I feel that the protections we have at our borders are reasonably effective. We need many more personnel to sort out our current problems at the Mexican border. But this is a commentary about a book, not a political rant. I highly recommend this book simply as a wonderful story. I could not put it down!

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: It's all too possible I've rated this so highly because I had zero expectations that I would enjoy it. I'm not usually a YA reader. I sometimes find the topics in YA novels are no longer relevant to me.… વધુ However, this was an eye opener --  how the author dealt with loss, grief, bullying and mental health issues. The honesty and explicitness of how it's articulated was enlightening. The love story portion was beautiful journey. I'm so glad I read this book.   5/5

NAME: Jaime Angell
CONTENT: This YA book is wonderful! I am a high school English teacher and we read silently at the start of every class for 10 minutes. Yesterday, about 5 mins into reading, I finished it. I had to interrupt my students… વધુ because I was so upset to be done with it- I wanted to be with the main character longer. (It is one of those books where there is a chunck of extra pages at the end. So I didn’t realize when I turned the page, the story was going to be finished!) Suddenly, something overcame me and I got teary! A girl turned to her friend and said, Is she crying?! I said, Yes, the story was so beautiful, I just wasn’t ready to be done yet!

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: After a couple of reading disappointments, I greedily jumped on this novel I knew I would enjoy: The Chainmaker's Wife, by Rebecca Bryn. This excellent novel is the second book of a trilogy. I was again fully… વધુ immersed in Rosie's family life as a chainmaker's wife from 1910 until 1918). Rosie had fought in the first book for women's wages along with Mary Macarthy (a real character). In this novel, her life situation has changed for the better. However she had loved fighting for her rights and needs new battles! The suffragette movement attracts her.... What I really enjoyed in this novel is on the one hand, the clever way the author enmeshes the different ways of fighting for universal vote within the characters' daily life: words (letters) as opposed to deeds (action); on the other hand, the author gives an original insight into WWI. This, along with the family story (full of surprises!) makes this novel a captivating and highly interesting book on a social as well as on a historical level!

CONTENT: One of the worst crime thrillers I've ever read. How can one create such a horrific theme as domestic violence and child murder and leave me absolutely cold. NAME: Kristen Keen Olson
CONTENT: I won an ARC copy of The Woman They Could Not Silence by Kate Moore and just finished it. Moore gives voice to a little known woman in history- Elizabeth Packard. It is an amazing story of how one woman did not… વધુ give up on exposing the abuses of the mental health system, such as it was, during the mid 1800’s. Although it’s a nonfiction book based on extensive historical research it reads more like historical fiction, my favorite genre.  I found Kate Moore’s writing style highly readable and it made me want to keep going to find out how it would all turn out. Moore not only brought to life Elizabeth Packard but she also delved into how the insane asylums were used to put away women who did not conform to the society of that time. I highly recommend this book for book clubs as it would give a lot of food for thought.

NAME: Carole Parkes
CONTENT: I’ve always loved really frightening, horror type thrillers, but as it’s coming up to Halloween and I’ll soon have my fill of terror, I chose a gentler read this week, a cosy mystery. It’s the second book in a… વધુ series and I read the first one a couple of weeks ago. This one is called FOUNDATIONS, FUNNY BUSINESS & MURDER by Christa Nardi. I enjoyed the first book in the series, so I’m looking forward to reading this one too. Stacie is now a widow and her husband, before he was murdered, named her as one of the board members in a charity foundation he requested to be set up in his will. Judging from the book description, not everything goes to plan with how it’s set up. Looks like some dodgy dealings are afoot. I wonder if she suspects and what she’ll do about it? Most of all, I'm wondering who get's murdered this time, lol Who else likes cosy mysteries?

I cannot recommend this book enough.  “One of the clearest memories I have of my dad is of him sitting on our couch with his glasses on, a pencil in his hand, reading my latest writings. He printed out every short story I wrote or full manuscript I dreamed up, and sat in the living room until he read the first word to the very last. He was my… વધુ

NAME: Janet MacGillivray Manning
CONTENT: Well this one was a surprise. I expected the typical Three Pines novel but what I got was one heck of a deep convoluted story, filled with murder, mystery and mayhem. Usually these books are light with a good… વધુ mystery but this one was much darker. I'm sure it was written during the pandemic. It made me realize just what a terrific author Louse Penny is and how wide her writing capabilities are. I really liked it.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just finished and want to recommend: "The Latinist" by Mark Prins.  I received an advance reader’s copy of this novel from BookBrowse.com in exchange for the promise to write a review.  I found this book to be a bit difficult to get into, since the subject matter involves early Latin verse including the mythical romance of Daphne… વધુ and Apollo.  Not my usual genre as you might imagine.  But once into the story involving Tessa, an American student working on her doctorate at Oxford University, and her advisor-mentor, Chris, I found myself eagerly navigating through the Latin poetry and nuances to discover the current story of Tessa’s scholarship abilities and Chris’s obsessive behavior.  A very different reading experience, but one I thoroughly enjoyed.  I believe that I have enriched my reading experience through this novel.  Thus, I feel confident in recommending it to you.

NAME: Evia Tor
CONTENT: Can't stop raving about this book! It's now one of my personal favorites. Totally unexpected, btw.  I usually just read books when I first read positive reviews. But this one caught my attention because of the… વધુ humor in the title 😃 No regrets. I'm glad I read it and I can't recommend it enough. The author is a brilliant writer and she didn't hold back in sharing her story. This is a memoir so lots of personal experiences.  What I love most is that the author is a simple woman. She's a mom, a wife, a friend, and a mental health advocate. In her book, she talked about pains that are shared by many of us. * her struggles with people-pleasing * low self-worth * seeking validation from others * needing other's approval before she can like herself * making other people's needs more important than her own well-being Her life story unfolded beautifully with every page. At the end of the book, I thought, "wow that was brave!" This book truly lives up to its title -  Uncensored 😉 Read it if you have a chance. You will meet this beautiful soul who is brave enough to be SEEN through this book 🙂

NAME: Wendy Scott
CONTENT: My review: This story makes me want to take the 5 stars away from every book I’ve honored with that rating so far this year. Nothing is better than this! If you loved The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe you… વધુ will love this. You could read this book without reading The Chronicles of Narnia by C.S. Lewis and it’s still a very touching novel with the protagonist, Meg’s, discussions with Mr. Lewis, Jack. Meg, a Math and Physics scholar, goes to Mr. Lewis, an English Literature Professor at Oxford,  to ask him where Narnia is and if Aslan exists because her eight year old brother, George, is dying from a congenital heart disorder, and is a fan of Mr. Lewis and Narnia and has asked her to find out… વધુ

NAME: Elayne Harris
CONTENT: I listened to Dark Vanessa on audio, and considered it unusually complex, tricky in a fabulous way, and very fine, indeed. Wish I had more telling  words to use….the writer tells a disturbing story in a bland way, leaving the reader to realize the disturbing element.  I suppose I could go off and read the reviews and then paraphrase them as mine.… વધુ When I read reviews, I recognize many of own thoughts said in ways I could not articulate, but I am trying to push myself to write better comments on books, and would prefer to be helped by comments from other readers (who aren’t paraphrasing reviewers). Anyone else who read/listened to the Dark Vanessa willing to say more? Try harder,too?

NAME: Janet MacGillivray Manning
CONTENT: I really loved this book. This is not a minute by minute historical bore. Anderson and his co-writer managed to cover the Vanderbilt's lives over decades in such an interesting way. Their wealth was incredible… વધુ at one time. So many worked hard for the money and others only knew how to spend.  Even Anderson's Mother spent money like it was water when she married his Father who was very wealthy. When Anderson's Father was dying-he was worried she'd end up broke. We all know though that she surprised everyone w/her Gloria Vanderbilt jeans and made her own fortune. Unfortunately Gloria went through most of her money. She really didn't know what it was like not to have it. You'll be surprised at just what Anderson Cooper inherited and how he handled his own earned money. Gloria was wild and free and totally eccentric. This book is not all about Anderson and his Mother. This is about many different and interesting members of the Vanderbilt family. It is non-fiction but at times you'll forget that and think you're in the middle of a novel.

NAME: Secille Siverio
CONTENT: How many of you have read Bellman & Black? Did you enjoy it? I’ve had this novel in my Nook for a few years and just can’t get into it. I loved Settlefield’s The Thirteenth Tale, and am disappointed in this one.
