NAME: Swati Tayal
CONTENT: Book Name:- swift horses sharp swords Author :- Amit Agarwal Pages:- 500 Amazon Rating :- 4.6/5 Genre: Indian medieval history The Author's maiden literary endeavour, “Swift Horses Sharp Swords- Medieval… વધુ Battles Which Shook India” is based on India’s turbulent medieval past. Although there are several books on this subject some of which are serious and historical in nature, this one stands out for its wide coverage of the topics of economy, geography, polity and social structures so as to make us better appreciate how our present is derived from this period. Most history textbooks of older times were generally mostly about Mughals and various slave sultans, wherein an obscure sultan like… વધુ

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: This novel set in the Black Country in 1901-1910 is well-worth reading if you want to learn about  women chainmakers' conditions in those days. I had no idea! The Chainmaker's Daughter, by Rebecca Bryn. Forget… વધુ your comfortable home, forget your warm and comfy mattress, forget a tasty Sunday lunch, forget the NHS. Now, you can start imagining the heat and dangers of a forge, the perilous state of a home, the constantly hovering threat of starvation, poverty that gives children rickets. This novel is based on true events which affected millions of women and their families: lower wages for women and the fights to get minimum wages. Mary Macarthy, the first woman to stand for parliament, will… વધુ

NAME: John Zenoni
CONTENT: What an absolutely stunning novel! It is ironic that I start my review with that statement because initially I was not too sure I was going to like it because of the writing style. The narrative is told by the… વધુ main character, Adunni, a fourteen-year-old Nigerian girl who wants nothing more than an education. This, her mother has told her, is the only way to get a "louding voice"—the ability to speak for herself and decide her own future. Adunni tells her story in broken English, combined with her native Nigerian tongue. It is definitely something that you have to get used to. But I stuck with it and am so glad as what a story she has to tell! I became concerned about her safety, was… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m reading a book called “Finding Rebecca” by Eoin Dempsey. This book isn’t a true story, not even a Holocaust, but it is a love story. The story is about Christopher and Rebecca. He was a German and she was a… વધુ Jewish. They grew up on the island of Jersey. He met her at the beach where she was hiding from her abuse parents, both were only were six. He hides her in his room, not until his father discovered them. He falls in love with her. When she was deported to the unknown. He must find a way to find her. The book is very incredible and captivating which I have enjoyed the story plot. The wording is so easy because it keeps you riveting with many suspense and a bit of romance story.

CONTENT: I read the prologue 3x before I even started chapter 1. I loved the beauty of the composition and the context. It's a love story. It's a story about overcoming the pain of guilt. And you will be drawn into the world of scent. This should be a scratch and sniff book!! I do recommend. 4/5

Langan portrays an upper middle class neighborhood full of secrets and lies. I found the novel creepy and eerie, but in a good way, couldn’t put it down.

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: An intriguing story set in Germany mainly during the early WWII era  leading to thought provoking events! The Humble Courier, by JT Maicke. Harvi is a Catholic priest of the small village where he was born.… વધુ Sounds like a boring life? Oh, no, not for Harvi! He is consummed by a deep sense of justice... That's only the beginning of Harvi's trail of thoughts.... What I particularly enjoyed in this novel, lies in the writing style. All along the plot, the author gives a summarised account of the political situation in Germany along with the reactions of the Allies from the end of WWI on (French occupation after the Versailles Contract had been signed). I learned details I was not aware of, particularly about the role of the Catholic church at this time. Harvi referred many times to the Bible (though not overwhelmingly) in order to find a way to find justice. That was for me very interesting and definitely thought provoking! The characters are fictional, some events and real people made fitting the story, but all made sense. A compelling novel!

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: I've shocked myself with a rating of 5/5 I'm grappling on how to communicate what I felt about this story. It's definitely a mystery/suspense genre and romance and also, classified Christian -- which is not… વધુ really my wheelhouse. Not to get into a debate about religion because as avid readers, I think we all agree that we read to experience/learn about places and people, cultures, traditions and history as well as war, peace, loss, love and faith. We meet characters and witness situations through our stories that we'd never necessarily experience in person. So for those of you who aren't Christian maybe you're stepping away from this story but maybe you should dive in and be open to the fact that there's many who grapple with the idea of God and others who fully embrace but stories about faith in all forms exist aplenty. The religious aspect played a role in the overall story line but not the main focus.  This was a fast paced dual time line with surprise endings and completely engaging. I read it at lightening speed and I did NOT guess the end in either timeline.

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: This novel exactly fits my expectations of a historical novel:  The Queen Of Last Hopes, by Susan Higginbotham. A perfect historical fiction novel! Margaret of Anjou is made so vivid that you feel with her,… વધુ want to talk to her! Extremely well-researched, I followed her through her life with much compassion and admiration for her. I obviously learned a lot, and found interesting to read this story from a French side even if her life was embedded with England history! A new author for me, and I can't wait to read more novels written by her! Highly recommended!

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: If I had read this book while at school, I would remember much more than from my history lessons! Anne and Louis: Passion and Politics in Early Renaissance, by Rozsa Gaston. I enjoyed this second book of the… વધુ trilogy much more than the first one: not so much romance! An entertaining novel which focuses on the relationship between Anne and Louis. Though an arranged marriage, theirs was also a marriage founded in love. However, men being men (wishing to go to war), women being women (wanting independence and children), life was not easy for these 2 ! Life has not been gentle with Anne (loss of so many of her babies), always bearing in mind the future of her beloved Brittany, her legacy.....  Very interesting, I learned a lot about conflicts/betrayals/promises involving France, Italy and Spain in the early 1500's.  I am now off to read the third book...

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: The Glass Ocean" by Beatriz Williams, Lauren Willig and Karen White.  This one is a book to read, relish and enjoy to the fullest!  Three authors, each writing from the point of view of a different character, tell the story of the voyage of the RMS Lusitania in 1915, with a present-day search in Devon, England, for information to uncover the… વધુ mysteries that occurred during this voyage that led up to the beginning of the First World War.  If you know your history, you know that in May of 1915 the Lusitania was torpedoed by a German U-Boat and sunk on its voyage from New York to London.   All is not as it seems aboard the Lusitania, and the schemes and vagaries, romance and discord, all keep the reader propelled to the end of this grand retelling of history. "

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: September Reading List Stoner - John Williams. Described as ‘the best book you never read’ by a review in the Sunday Times - and I agree. I hadn’t heard of it until it was recommended for our book group. It is a quiet book. The story of an ordinary man’s ordinary life; but so much depth. There was a variety of opinion. Some were bored stiff with… વધુ it; others, like me, were enthralled and held captive from the opening sentence. Breathe - Elena Kravchenko. A story of the Boxing Day tsunami and one man’s search for his missing friends. This book brings home the sheer brutal force of events of nature, the chaos which follows and makes you realise that survival can be more by luck than judgement.… વધુ

NAME: Cheryl Zalk
CONTENT: Just finished this book. I really liked it. Here’s my review.  Ray Carney has his feet planted in two different worlds. By day, he is a respected business owner of a furniture store. After hours, he takes in… વધુ electronics and other ill-gotten gains for which he acts as a fence. Carney is only trying to make a better life for his family, as he finds ways to make ends meet so that he and his wife and child can someday move into a better apartment on a better street to live a better life. Carney is aware that his successful in-laws think he was the wrong choice for their daughter and it is this knowledge, along with his sense of family responsibility, that drives much of what he does. When his… વધુ

NAME: Nancy Mayville Pacitto
CONTENT: Sending the kids back to school in person with the oldest starting high school made September a bit stressful. When stressed, I indulge in what I consider my comfort food reading - which for me, is picking a… વધુ Nora Roberts trilogy and re-reading it.  Nora’s facebook page was pulling quotes from this one so I picked it up again.  For the others, the Rose Code is excellent,  We Were Never Here just ok (think I’m ready to give Reese picks a rest) and Untangled is a parenting book - some useful, some “if I actually used some of these suggestions, her eyeballs would roll right out of her head”. Currently into Sandford’s “Rules of Prey” and starting “We Begin at the End”.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: A beautiful story written book called “The two girls in the attic” by Marius Gabriel. It is a story of war, hate, fear and violence however it’s a story of love. Max Wolff was a soldier of the reich. He was… વધુ sent home wounded, he learns his mother hides two teenage Jewish women Heidi and Lola in their home. He was furious at the first, then he developed a bond with Lola and sooner he learns the truth about his father imprisonment. His world has changed and he has risked his life for his mother and the girls. The experience for main character Lola, a Jew and max, a soldier was going through many hardships, emotional and uplifting which gave a lot of insight as to the sufferings of the normal German citizens. I enjoyed “love story” book. I couldn’t put it down in one night. This also should have make into movies with subtitles.

NAME: Heather Hudak
CONTENT: I saw Dooryard Books in a clip of Rockland, ME, which was where some winners on an episode of "My Dream Lottery Home" were house hunting, and when I googled it, learned the store owner had retired and when he… વધુ closed the store, gave away the books for free so that they would go to people who loved books 🥺 (how's that for a run on sentence 😅) “I’m giving them away to people who love books,” he said. “I’m happy. If I had to put them in the dumpster, I wouldn’t be happy.”

CONTENT: Lovers of books and history might be interested in this 'hygienic library', which now houses my favourite cafe in Melbourne, Australia. Back in the 1930's, books were sterilized and fumigated in an effort to ward off polio, TB, and diphtheria. Thankfully, we now have vaccines to protect us from these deadly diseases.

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: Most of the books I have read since the beginning of the pandemic are recommendations from my various Facebook book groups readers. Really most of them are gems! This one is again no exception! The Woman They… વધુ Could Not Silence, by Kate Moore. This non fiction story is based on the life of Elizabeth Packard. This extraordinary woman fought for her own freedom (she was wrongly interned in an asylum in 1860 in the USA). As if this was not enough, she went on fighting for women's independence (from their husbands), and their long due place in society. What fascinated me is the unusual strength as well as energy Elizabeth has always displayed over years and years! I was exhausted just reading… વધુ

She wrote the book based on her mother’s life, Lilia, she was a young girl from an Italian family when she was 7 years old was horrified and devastated by the horrors of war. She grew up in the rural village of Mussons, during World War Two in northern Italy. Linda describes her mother’s experiences.… વધુ

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: My second novel by the author, and oh! did I love it! The delightful Natalie makes the reader smile a lot, prepare nonetheless a couple of tissues! The Wartime Nanny, by Lizzie Page . Natalie is made to leave… વધુ Austria at 16 to work as a nanny in England, to escape the steady uprising of the Nazis in 1936. She will try to find ways to get her family out as well....  Natalie is a delightful young woman, still very naïve as to life generally speaking, and to what really goes on in Austria. Her reflections are witty and I laughed a lot! She matures throughout the novel, and so do her reflections.... What I particularly enjoyed in this novel (apart from Natalie herself) is the cleverly way the author has dealt with the unbelievably cruel acts perpetrated by the Nazis.  Shown through the eyes and words of a naïve woman who cannot believe in the unbelievable, the horrors become even more incredible, unacceptable. (No graphic violent scenes). The plot is realistically conceived; the story reflects many lives of the time, and the characters are convincing. A great, great read!

NAME: Susan Nucci
CONTENT: Just finished You Can Run by Karen Cleveland. I couldn’t put it down. I’ve read all her books. The first was Need To Know - which made me an immediate fan. Her stories involve CIA (she was a CIA analyst) and spies and the endings all have a surprise. I recommend this highly.  PS her sister is Kristin Harmel who has written several great books. What a talented family.

CONTENT: These two books by historian Tracy Borman are recommendable.  Not heavy reading but informative about the Houses of Parliament and the gunpowder plot plus the persecution of 'witches' in that era.  There is a third one  The Fallen Angel but I haven't bought it yet.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: For all you mystery lovers out there, here's a book I just finished and enjoyed: "Win" by Harlan Coben.  If you like mysteries as a reading genre, then you may already be a fan of Harlan Coben, who spins out mysteries regularly.  In this story the protagonist, Winston Horne Lockwood III, is a rich, handsome, smart guy with suave manners and… વધુ excellent combat skills.  Win, as he is known, is drawn into the investigation of the murder of a man he does not know because of a painting and a piece of luggage found on the premises.  Coben manages to hook the reader fairly quickly with all the twists and turns of a mystery that compel one to keep reading to find out what’s going to happen next.  Win has appeared in other Coben mysteries but never as the “star.”  This is the first of the “Win” mysteries, but something tells me there will be many more.  I’ll be watching for them to come out.

NAME: Colour Ful
CONTENT: Used books from libraries and thrift shops have the most interesting bookmarks which the previous reader must have left behind. One time, I found a leaf, and another time, a faded electricity bill. Have you ever had such experience? What strange things did you find between the pages?

The name of the people in the story have changed it but it is still a true story. The story is about about Marek and Annette who escaped from Poland in 1939 to France to live a simple and happy life with their young children. Their Christian neighbor, named Helena, she’s a dancer. She came from Italy to pursue her dreams of becoming an actress.… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m reading a remarkable story book called “The Nazis Knew My Name” by Magda Hellinger, Maya Lee with David Brewester. Magda’s eldest daughter wrote the story with the help of David. She’s telling us her mother… વધુ Magda Hellinger remarkable story. She was selected for leadership to put in charge of 30,000 women in block 10 in Auschwitz. She risked her life saving people lives and and the helpers to save hers by avoiding gas chambers or execution. Her daughter wrote a story that is very incredible and captivating which I enjoyed the story plot. The wording is so easy and comfortable because she explained so many interesting, original, that filled with so many suspense which add a bit of romance and emotions. She was a remarkable lady. She was only 25 years old kindergarten teacher when she deported to Auschwitz camp with the first 1,000 other young woman in March 1942.

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: This novel is based on a real Jewish community (the author's family) and their journey through life from 1871 till 1923. Shavlan, by Eunice E. Blecker. For me, this was a fascinating story which I could not let… વધુ rest till I finished the whole book! The biographical novel starts in Shavlan, Lithuania. The tight Jewish community enjoys a life which becomes more and more complicated because of the negative attitude towards Jewish people, whether on a political or a human level. Many want to emigrate, mostly to the USA, but also to South Africa. Families are separated: either the husband leaves first to try and build up a better somewhere else; others send one child to America to relatives; others still will be conscripted in WWI. Others will be deported to Russia... This means for many of them that the women will have to take charge.... I learned a lot about being Jewish, in Lithuania and in America... I learned a lot about Lithuania's history. This is indeed a story well worth telling and which will not leave you unmoved.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’m reading the short book called “The neighbors from Bergen-Belsen” by Yaakov Barazilai. I find it confusing and had hard time because the story doesn’t follow through from beginning to the end. It has no… વધુ warnings, because it’s going back and forth different times for families and fantasy where he often dreams in the story. The wording is easy, if the author write better in alphabetical order, then we would love the book although, it is still a good book. The story is about a 11 year old boy living with his parents and sister in Hungary and they were force out of their home in 1944 and live in the ghetto then went to Bergen- Belsen in Austria. He often add in the story about his mother is doing everything possible to protect her two children.

NAME: Mark Swt
CONTENT: Check Out 'The Ubiquitous Masquerade' . . .A collection of short stories by Buck Starmer exploring the themes of alienation, the search for personal authenticity and the ultimate nature of humankind.  The tales… વધુ frequently give the impression of supernatural events unfolding, using them as a metaphor for wider significances. With their supernatural imagery, brooding melancholy and bursts of grotesque, wry humour, one might describe them as a collection of fairy tales for the modern age.  See www.BuckStarmerBooks.com

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I never read a book about the Italian resistance fighters. This book I’m reading is called “The girl from Venice” by Siobhan Daiko. This book is truly impressively splendid, I couldn’t put it down. I love how… વધુ the author Siobhan brings a heart-rending story of love, loyalty, family and friends during the World War Two. The experience that the main character (Lidia) was going through many hardships, emotional and uplifting which is a beautiful written book. It sets in the past and present back and forth, Lidia De Angelis is an Italian and Jewish girl. She only lived with her father. When the German invaded Venice in 1943, she must flee the city, she joined the partisans in the Venetian mountains where she meets David, an English soldier to fight for the same reasons. Years later in London, Charlotte the granddaughter sorting her grandmother’s belongings which she discovered a Jewish prayer book, unopened letters written in Italy and photographs. She decides to visit Italy to find the truth about her grandmother’s life and so on.

NAME: Lefki Georgiades
CONTENT: I've just lost what I've written,so once again. 🙄 Good afternoon from Spain. I'd like to recommend my series of in-between books. In Google the list can be found. The blessings of Kindle. I have them on file. I also have other authors medieval detective series. e.g. C.J. Sansom. CONTENT: Light Perpetual by Francis Spufford is a story about life. Using a historic missile attack in 1944 London as the starting point, Spufford creates and follow the lives of five children from the day of the attack… વધુ through the end of life. As these five fictional souls move through the reel  of time, the reader experiences their intimate dramas “ as sons, daughters, spouses, and  grandparents;as the married, remarried, separated and bereaved.” Spufford’s story is at times warm snd beautiful, sad and cold. But always the theme of the preciousness of life wins out until the end and all is dust.

CONTENT: Book title: We were the lucky ones  Author: Georgia Hunter  An astonishing story about the Kurc family, a polish Jewish from Random, Poland, who were separated during the World War Two. When Addy becomes a grandfather, was in the photo with Georgia in the end of the book. Georgia Hunter, she was 15 years old, she learns she came from a family of the Holocaust survivors. CONTENT: Where The Apricots Bloom, by Gina Wilkinson. I had this book downloaded for a few months and finally got around to reading this riveting and profound book!  I loved the three main characters who had to confront trust, white lies, friendship, motherhood and even betrayal really just to stay alive!  Loved how this new author, for me, told this story.  Highly recommend to give it a try!

NAME: Hong Minh
CONTENT: Good day lady and gentleman! So, I'll get to the point. I have to do a research paper on Virginia Woolf and feminism aesthetics or I must say how some of her works have become key figures for feminism movements… વધુ in post modern day. So far, I've bought A Room Of One's Own, To the lighthouse and Orlando and ready to devour themm. However, I would love to collect more data from someone who've read Woolf in the past. Therefore, I'll be more than happy if anyone have any input to help with my research. Thank you soo much you kind people.  Please, feel free to say whatever comes to your mind about Woolf, anything is valuable to me.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and want to recommend it: "The Good Sister" by Sally Hepworth.  This may not be a book you will say you loved upon finishing it, but the farther into the story you get, the more compelling it becomes.  It is a tale of twin sisters in their 20’s, Fern and Rose.  Fern is tall and slim with some autistic and sensory issues, i.e.,… વધુ bright lights, loud noises, smells and fragrances set off her reactive sensibilities.  Rose is short and stocky (her mother refers to her as “Rosie Round”) and is very protective of Fern.  The story is told from both Fern’s and Rose’s viewpoints.  The family secrets, the twists and turns of the plot, and the character studies will keep you wondering which of the sisters, Fern or Rose, fulfills the promise of the book’s title.  This book has enticed me to look into reading more of Sally Hepworth’s work.

NAME: Jim Morrison
CONTENT: At first you might think that not a lot happens in this book. People meet by appointment or by chance, or are invited to other people’s houses where they meet other people and have a conversation with them.… વધુ However, soon you can tune into the narrator’s thoughts that would pass in a flash between being addressed and responding. Should he tell all or be discreet? A common dilemma in 1930s upper middle class English. Women are becoming less inhibited in what they do and what they say in public; shadows of WW1 remain in the thoughts of those male characters who fought. Another war with the same country may be on the horizon, yet even with these shadows the dialogue is extremely funny and you are charmed to keep on reading.

NAME: Lori Lindsey Allen
CONTENT: I love it when I find a FREE book on Audible that causes me to drive around the block an extra time or keeps me up well past when I should be long asleep. Tell Me Lies by J.P. Pomare was one of those books. The last 4 minutes are 🤯!  Tell Me Lies https://g.co/kgs/HWQ1hx

NAME: Linh Kelly Chu Sramek
CONTENT: I found this book while browsing the shelves of Magic City Books. The title alone grabbed my attention. I just finished reading it today and WOW, what an awesome story! The book has certainly earned its title! I highly recommend it!

NAME: Donna Liberman
CONTENT: Has anyone read A Rebellious Woman by Claire Griffin?  The cover caught my eye because I LOVE reading about real historical figures.  I had never heard about Belle Boyd before.  She was quite the firecracker! … વધુ You may not always like her but, if anything, she was consistent!  She wore many hats--spy, actress, traveler, POW, divorcée, etc, all in the 19th century!  This novel is set during the American Civil War and tells the story of the real woman who believed in the Confederate cause.  Lovely chapters in a slave's (Eliza's) POV as well!

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: It's truly a beautiful story. The characters are described with love infused. The subjects covered are done thoughtfully and with care. There were so many poignant lines that made me stop and reread/think. So… વધુ why not a 5/5 rating for me. Because I found it a bit to "preaching from the pulpit" towards the end. But this should deter no one from reading this book. I do believe that this could be a book that could make the high school English class reading lists -- and if it doesn't that would be a huge miss.

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: Firstly, I need to admit that I thought this would be a completely enjoyable fluff book. I was right about the enjoyable and completely wrong on the fluff. Beth O'Leary handles the issue of… વધુ emotional/mental/psychological abuse with absolute care. I was astounded by the way she wove it into the story and the eventual realization from one of the main characters, Tiffy. Brilliant. There were plenty of light-hearted moments too and yes, a romance blooming. A lovely book to spend the weekend with indeed.

It takes place 20 years from now in a village that is 10 minutes from ours, and has lots of local places in it that our group would all know, but the other 2 are so good!!

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I just finished reading this book called “The Girl with the Silver Star” by Rachel Zolotov’s great-grandmother during the ww2 in Russia, within a day. The story sets earlier and present in Russia. A heartfelt,… વધુ tense, deeply moving and touching, and beautiful written with so much love. It is based on a true love story between Raisa and Abraham. I have read many stories of Polish and German Jews, but not the Russian Jews. Rachel has a writing style that is very captivating, unbearable and it was very interesting and doesn’t bore me one minute. It gives more insight into the main character so you can see all sides of the story so perfectly that you feel exciting, smile, bitter, challenge, weep… વધુ

NAME: Christine Boos
CONTENT: This book will stay with me! History, by Kyra Robinov . What a beautiful and highly captivating memoir! I had read Red Winter, a novel also based on the author's family. I had  loved it! Her father, Michael,… વધુ was then a child in remotest Siberia. His incredible mother managed to save the family from sure murders by the Reds. Maybe you remember, I reviewed it a couple of weeks ago... This memoir starts at the end of Red Winter when the family escaped to Japan. We meet then an unusual youth, later a genial man! Through his acute business sense, luck, perseverance and courage, Michael will achieve great things. Starting from zero (licking stamps), handshake agreements, Michael will lead an exceptional life in different continents (he spoke several languages). I don't think he went through one boring day! Many pictures, dialogues impregnated by Michael's thoughts, the honesty of the comments make this memoir a family album as though Kyra's father was showing the pictures while marrating his numerous life experiences. The conclusion is poignant and perfect.  A full 5* read!

NAME: Kristin Paquette
CONTENT: Just finished #WeAreNotLikeThem last night and it is seriously a MUST read! (The Kaepernick Effect is up next.) 'We Are Not Like Them' is the story of Riley and Jenny, best friends since early childhood. The… વધુ story alternates between the perspectives and experiences of each woman. Riley is a news reporter with aspirations to become an anchor. She's worked her butt off and is already so close to reaching her goal when the tragic death of an innocent child becomes her next assignment. Riley knows this assignment will bring her closer to her goal. What she doesn't realize is how deeply affected she will be personally by the experience. Throughout the unfolding events Riley must remain objective,… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to recommend: "The Keeper of Happy Endings" by Barbara Davis.  Soline Roussel came from a long line of Parisian dressmakers with a special gift.  It was said that a Roussel gown would guarantee a lifetime of joy.  This story alternates between the events in Soline’s life from World War II in Paris and her life… વધુ after she immigrates to the United States, continuing until 1985 when she rents the building housing her former bridal shop to Aurore (Rory) Grant.  There is a touch of mysticism in this story, which always intrigues me in a book.  There turns out to be some surprising relationships among the characters.  All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book, and may look into reading more by this author.

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: Our book group read this month was Stoner by John Williams. Some loved and some found it bored them stiff. But it provoked some very good discussions. Personally, I loved it. It was one of those books that I had to sit with for a while before I could move on.  Our discussions ranged around: The inability of Stoner (and his parents) to communicate… વધુ effectively. Why might this be? The hardship of their lives? A natural shyness/ introversion? Or the restriction of the times they lived in?  The strange behaviour of his wife - her cruelty in the guise of love, her aversion to sex - and then her sudden change to wild abandon when she decided she wanted a child.  One member read out a couple of… વધુ

CONTENT: This is my first entry into the investigative world of Auntie Poldi and it was pretty good, I have to admit. The way she cut cracks toward her nephew, another central character in this story, and others was hilarious.  In this novel, Poldi is planning on enjoying her retirement in Sicily when suddenly she is surprised by the appearance of her ex-husband, John. He is also a detective who reaches out asking for her help to find a mysterious item that is worth ten million dollars. The only catch is… વધુ

NAME: Katherine Bookss
CONTENT: Lovely book.Meet Harold Fry, recently retired. He lives in a small English village with his wife, Maureen, who seems irritated by almost everything he does, even down to how he butters his toast. Little differentiates one day from the next. Then one morning the mail arrives, and within the stack of quotidian minutiae is a letter addressed to Harold… વધુ in a shaky scrawl from a woman he hasn't seen or heard from in twenty years. Queenie Hennessy is in hospice and is writing to say goodbye.  Harold pens a quick reply and, leaving Maureen to her chores, heads to the corner mailbox. But then, as happens in the very best works of fiction, Harold has a chance encounter, one that convinces him that he… વધુ

CONTENT: First, a huge thank you to Simon & Schuster #BookClubFavorites for the ARC for review! 'The Forest of Vanishing Stars' captured and held my attention from the very first page! The story begins with Jerusza - an… વધુ ornery, mysterious old woman - who spirits away with a toddler in middle of the night. That little girl, Yona, is fated to be a strong light in a world that is all too often filled with darkness. Jerusza felt compelled to save the girl from an uncertain future with a father who adored Hitler. In the years that followed, Yona will be reared in the forests and she will be taught the vital lessons of survival, self defense, hunting, healing, and self-sufficiency.  While Yona often yearns… વધુ

NAME: Katherine Bookss
CONTENT: Love Paul Iverson's life changes in an instant. He returns home one day to find that his wife, Lexy, has died under strange circumstances. The only witness was their dog, Lorelei, whose anguished barking brought help to the scene - but too late. In the days and weeks that follow, Paul begins to notice strange "clues" in their home: books rearranged… વધુ on their shelves, a mysterious phone call, and other suggestions that nothing about Lexy's last afternoon was quite what it seemed. Reeling from grief, Paul is determined to decipher this evidence and unlock the mystery of her death. But he can't do it alone; he needs Lorelei's help. A linguist by training, Paul embarks on an impossible endeavor:… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: It is another interesting story book that I really enjoyed and the story doesn’t bored me one minute and I couldn’t put it down within a day. I’m reading “Anna at War” by Helen Peters, she writes this story… વધુ about the voice of Daniel’s grandmother Anna who is 90 years old who have survived the Holocaust. Her grandson Daniel is learning about World War Two in school, and asks her about it. She prepares to share her story to him. The grandmother tells him where it begins in November 1938 on Kristallnacht, the night of the broken glass, which the Nazi attacked Jewish people, and properties in a night of violence. Fearing her safety, her parents decided to put her, 12 year old daughter on the kinder-transport to England to placed in foster homes. Helen Peters has managed to balance the need to explain a harrowing and deeply sad period of history with the desire to make it accessible to a young audience.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to recommend: " Georgia" by Dawn Tripp.  You may be familiar with the well-known artist, Georgia O’Keeffe.  As a longtime admirer of her art, I have visited the museum dedicated to her work in Santa Fe and also Taos, New Mexico, where she spent a lot of time and owned a couple of homes.  "Georgia" is a historical… વધુ novel about Georgia O’Keeffe’s life, beginning in 1915 when she was a young art teacher in Texas and just discovering her talents as an artist.  O'Keeffe was an independent thinker, an interesting and often difficult position for a woman living in those early days of the 20th century.  She sent some of her abstract drawings to Alfred Stieglitz in… વધુ

NAME: Claire Griffin
CONTENT: Shame the Devil, historical fiction by Donna Scott, is totally enjoyable in every way. The time period is one not usually used as the background for a historical novel. You will learn a lot about the English… વધુ Civil Wars in the 1600s, led by Oliver Cromwell, that resulted in the beheading of King Charles I. The cast of characters are the kind we love. Or love to hate. From the determined Emma Hardcastle, daughter of a viscount; to her true love, the disinherited Scottish laird Colin Blackburne; to Emma’s friend, the hapless Alston Egerton, regularly abused by his pious and hypocritical father; and finally to the nefarious Captain Kitts, whose misdeeds are too numerous to mention. The plot keeps the reader entertained with many surprising twists and turns. And the ending is beautifully written and immensely satisfying. Readers will not be disappointed in Shame the Devil! Highly recommended.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book and have to tell you about it: “The Four Winds” by Kristin Hannah.  This story covers so many aspects of life and is so compelling that, if I were the giver of awards for excellence in writing, I would have to give Kristin Hannah the Oscar, the Emmy, the Nobel, the Pulitzer, all the prizes that cover any aspect of excellence… વધુ in writing.  A quote from the book gives a glimpse of what to expect from this reading: ‘Hard times don’t last. Love does.’  If you’re familiar with Kristin Hannah’s books, you’ll expect that the reading will be emotional, and this book brought me to tears many times – tears of pity, tears of joy, tears of sorrow – but the author never lets you down, never lets you put the book down either.  I simply cannot say enough about how much I loved this book and the story it tells.  The author of “The Nightingale” and many other excellent novels has written another winner!

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: What a remarkable narrative story written “Only Hope: A survivors stories of the Holocaust” by Felicia Bornstein Lubliner and her son Irving Lubliner. He wrote the voice of his mother’s story that she describes… વધુ her life in the pabianice ghetto and Auschwitz. Irving describe each story with many photos in the book which I have enjoyed reading and I couldn’t put it down. I recommend anyone to read this.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: Finally I read a popular author by Roberta Keegan who wrote the book called “Luisa”. It was short and quick series saga. This book is very captivating, unbearable, and it was very hard not to put the book down,… વધુ because the story written was very simple and riveting. Yet of course it was horrendous to see how evil, monstrous, and influence Luisa was. She was main character and no wonder why things came back to haunt her. It was impossible for me not enjoy this book.

NAME: Carole Parkes
CONTENT: I recently read THE ESCAPE by Matthew Slater and it’s every bit as fast-paced as the reviews state. It is exceptionally so. In fact, the pace never slowed at all and I was left quite breathless at the end of… વધુ it. If it's true that females like a bad guy, then they could well fall for Bryan, the kingpin gangster whose fortunes take a tumble when his best friend and partner, Tony, double crosses him on a deal, leaves him for dead, and takes over all the assets. Thrown in jail for 30 years, Bryan vows to get his own back on Tony. Another friend, who was also nearly killed in the double-cross breaks him out of jail and together they plan their revenge. Nothing goes to plan as every other criminal they rope in for their expertise is out for their own ends too. This is one heck of a scary ride about dirty gangland dealings. Don't expect any romantic sub-plots, Although there is the merest mention of the attraction of women, they certainly don't feature strongly in this book. It's hard-hitting and violent. If you really want to see how bad guys think, this is the book to read.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to comment on: "The Family Upstairs" by Lisa Jewell.  In the beginning I felt that this book was swimming in characters with whom I had trouble connecting.  By the time I was about a third of the way into the book, I was able to piece together the various relationships.  The crux of the story is that a well-to-do… વધુ family in London’s posh Chelsea neighborhood allowed another family access to their spacious home.  Gradually, the impostor family led by the father, David Thomsen, takes over the house and dictates all the actions of all the occupants.  The story has some interesting twists and turns.  When I became more involved in the story, I felt compelled to finish it to learn how it all came out.

NAME: Joan Grathwol Malchow
CONTENT: If you are looking for some non-fiction, Isabelle Wilkerson writes beautifully and clearly. While persuasive, her writing is not preachy. In Caste, she makes a case for the existence of a caste system in America. In The Warmth of Other Suns: The Epic Story of America’s Great Migration, three main characters are followed on their journey out of the… વધુ Jim Crow south during the great African American migration, 1916-1970. Both of these books are non-fiction and contain reliable, well-researched learning. They are also highly readable. Highly recommend.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This is the second book I have read from another classmate and a friend of Anne Frank. Nanette Blitz Konig wrote her memoir book and told her side of the story. They had meet at the Jewish school and she also… વધુ attended at Anne’s 13th birthday, then again they were reunited at Bergen-Belsen camp and she hugged her for the last time before Anne died. Nanette was a such beautiful, incredible brave, and determination whose heart won’t allow her forget her stolen family away from her. I am glad she survived to tell and share a powerful book written and simple wording that everyone must read and should be read in schools.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: What Could Be Saved by Liese O'Halloran Schwarz. It's 2019.  Two sisters, one confident and bossy, the other introverted and resentful, continue a lifetime of squabbling as they care for their elderly mother… વધુ diagnosed with dementia.  Their lives are thrown into upheaval when they receive a phone call that the brother who disappeared in 1972 when the family lived in Bangkok has been discovered. Told in dual timelines, we come to intimately know and love this family, see the effects of an enormous tragedy, and discover mistakes, betrayals, and redemptive love.  This extraordinary, beautifully crafted novel broke my heart, but made me vow to live a better life.

CONTENT: Radar Girls by Sara Ackerman is a story about the WARDs —-Women’s Air Raid Defense— a group of highly trained women based in Hawaii whose work “brought the Flyboys home.”  “This inspiring tale of pioneering,… વધુ unsung heroines vividly transports the reader to Wartime Hawaii, where women called to military duty found strength, courage , snd sisterhood.” A well told story for both fiction and nonfiction readers.

NAME: Jo Shryock
CONTENT: This book gets published tomorrow, I read an advance copy and enjoyed E.Spurr’s writing style. The story is set in Australia and the premise is a young girl abandoned and trying to survive on her own, a sweet… વધુ dog that is her constant companion, and a neighbor with problems that she bonds with. The story deals with mental Health issues and at times can be dark but in a realistic way and not graphic. Spurs does a fantastic job writing about this subject and as a debut author, I was impressed. I personally couldn’t put it down. I hope this author writes many more stories!

I love the way that she wrote the book it was really like you were living it not just reading it I absolutely loved how even at the end of the book you still were left guessing wondering which was true what really happened definitely an amazing author and I look forward to reading more of her work since this was the first book I ever read of hers. NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just finished reading: "Ordinary Grace" by William Kent Krueger.  Frank Drum, the narrator, is an adult telling the story from his life as a 13-year-old boy living in New Bremen, Minnesota, in 1961.  Frank’s father was the town minister, who served three different protestant congregations in the area.  Unexpected, unsolved deaths… વધુ have occurred in New Bremen, beginning with the death of a young boy, Bobby Cole, who was killed by a train while he was on the tracks of a railway trestle over the river – an event that caused Frank in his quest to understand Bobby’s death to call it “the “awful grace of God.”  Four more deaths occur that summer, and Frank, a perceptive boy with a gift for listening in on adult conversations, is instrumental in solving most of them.  To quote Simon & Schuster, the publisher:  “It is an unforgettable novel about discovering the terrible price of wisdom and the enduring grace of God.”  This is a book I personally savored.  Mr. Krueger has a wonderful ability to draw the reader in and never let you go till the story is finished.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: This book! This book is in the first place spot of all the books I have read this year. An unforgettable story of four orphans who travel the Mississippi River on a life-changing odyssey during the summer of… વધુ 1932. Odie, Albert, Moses and Emmy are placed in the Lincoln Indian Training School, a place of horrific abuse. Odie is one to challenge the punitive and arbitrary system. After Odie commits a terrible crime, they are forced to flee. They steal away in a canoe down the Mississippi River and are looking for a place to call home. They meet a cast of colorful characters along the way and at the same time learn about each other and themselves. Our Bookclub had a fabulous discussion. Our hostess had the perfect dinner table props: a canoe, snake, skelton; and, of course, the harmonica! Menu:  Strawberry-Brie Phyllo Cups Buffalo Chicken Dip Veggies and Dip Ham and Cheese Quiche Roasted Potatoes  Fruit Salad Apple Crisp

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and thought worth mentioning to you: "The Vanishing Half" by Brit Bennett.  I must confess that I spent the first half of this book trying to convince myself that I liked it enough to finish it.  But now that I’ve read this story of racial identity, I’m glad I stuck with it and didn’t give up.   This story takes place… વધુ during the period from the 1940’s to the 1990’s.  Desiree and Stella Vignes are identical twins raised in Mallard, Louisiana, a town exclusively populated by light-skinned blacks. When the twins decide to escape the stultifying atmosphere of their small town, one of them disappears and reinvents herself as a white person.  It’s a story filled with secrets, discrimination, scholarship, determination and ambition.  Ultimately, I found it to be interesting and very readable.  Sometimes you just have to persist with reading until you reach that satisfying moment when you can no longer turn back.

NAME: Jean Kolinofsky
CONTENT: At a time when there was a need for women to fill the workforce as the men fought in WWII, Emmy, a journalist for a women’s magazine, writes a series about the women in a munitions factory.  She has befriended… વધુ one of the women and they were proud of the work they were doing.  One of the biggest problems that had not been addressed was the care of their children while they worked.  How can Emmy show only one side of the story without helping these women?  This was an inspiring story of what can be achieved when people work together.  I received this book from NetGalley and it was a book that I thoroughly enjoyed.  5 stars

Each character is strong… વધુ and has their own story to tell. Twist at the end to keep the pages turning. Read in two days and I’m a slow reader! Highly recommended for book clubs too.

NAME: Derek Lu
CONTENT: 🔥 After some debate with my wife, I put together a list of the Best Books of The Past Decade, that just so happened to be adapted. I find that oftentimes, our culture gets too wrapped up in the adaptation often… વધુ looses sight of the original source. In short, I think adaptations can dilute the original cultural impact of the book. So this list is goes against the grain. What do you think of this list? What am I missing that’s on your list?? ❤❤

NAME: Arnetta Reed
CONTENT: Reading The Obsession.

NAME: Kathleen McComb
CONTENT: Someone asked for recommendations re historical fiction (non-romantic) a few weeks back. I just finished The Sweetness of Water a debut novel by Nathan Harris which I would like to recommend to that person. It takes places in a Southern town immediately after the end of the Civil War during Reconstruction when the town is still being occupied by… વધુ Northern troops. It involves two Young Freedmen who begin working on a farm bordering the plantation where they grew up with a family whose son has just been reported killed in the War. Don’t want to give away too much of the plot so will just say that when one of the brothers witnesses something someone would prefer to keep secret it causes a cascading series of events that changes the lives of the brothers and the family they work for in profound ways. I love books that take place in tumultuous times.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: We Are Not Like Them by Christine Pride and Jo Piazza.  Thanks to Simon & Schuster for an Advance Copy of this amazing novel. Pub Date:  10/5/21 Two women, one black and one white. have been best friends from… વધુ childhood. But now their relationship may be shattered as they find themselves on opposite sides of a police shooting of a 14 year old unarmed black child. Two authors, one black and one white, tell a gripping story of friendship, family, grief, race, love, and loyalty in a heartbreakingly authentic way. Minds and hearts will be opened by this powerful novel. #ChristinePride #JoPiazza #simonandschuster

CONTENT: I’m getting ready to choose a book for my book club. Have any of you read “The Extraordinary Life of Sam Hell” by Robert Dugoni?

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Paper Daughters of Chinatown by Heather Moore details the true story of Donaldina Cameron and her  rescue work in San Francisco, California. Donaldina Cameron was a major figure in the fight against sex slave… વધુ trafficking in San Francisco , California.  The Rose Code by Kate Quinn  tells the once hushed and hidden  story of the code breakers from England’s Bletchley Park and their contributions to Allied victories  in WWII. Quinn’s true story includes a prince and a traitor!  Both books are excellent reads.

CONTENT: I highly recommend The Hate U Give and The World That We Knew.

NAME: Desiree Ann Hill Leonard
CONTENT: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Neil Olson knows how to grab your attention on the 1st page while keeping it all the way till the last sentence!.  I absolutely loved this book, there was a combination of great characters as well as the… વધુ perfect amount of information for the story line all mixed together. Will only remembers only bits and pieces of what happened that horrible night when he was 5 and no one will talk about it even when he starts to have vivid dreams now that he's older. When. A horrible accident happens he is forced to come home to help take care of his mother when there he is determined to find out the truth no matter what the cost is with the help of his oldest friend Sam a girl who is called weird because of her ties with the old coven and her still uses in madgic. But is he ready to take on the curses, History of witch craft and betrayal?  Be ready to stay up all night to finish this book becouse once you start you won't want to put it down. #summerreading2021 #NeilOlson #beforethedevilfell

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just finished a book you might find interesting: "Perfect Match" by Jodi Picoult.  Jodi Picoult is an author I have read over the years, sometimes with great enjoyment, others not so much.  "Perfect Match" is a very readable, engaging story about a mother, who happens to be a prosecuting attorney, who avenges the rape of her child by a priest. … વધુ It is at times contrived, and in the end just downright unbelievable.  The small portions of the story told from the child’s point of view were poignant, but the conduct of the adults, from the mother, the father, the mother’s long-time male friend, even the judge who tried the murder case against the mother – all were at times over-the-top unbelievable for me.  Having said that, I am not sorry I read the book.  As it happens, it was the July pick for my book club, and we had a very interesting discussion about it this morning.

NAME: Anna Louise
CONTENT: I really want to share this unusual memoir. I have not read anything like it. It is so vivid and descriptive you can get lost in it like a fiction. It's set in Australia and is flecked with humor and bizarre… વધુ stories, usually involving how other people treat the author. The author spontaneously approaches intriguing strangers on the street and photographs and interviews them. Then it becomes like 'Educated' and gets very dark as she loses her childhood faith and goes insane and turns into 'Girl Interrupted.' Then she is bullied beyond belief by grown women and it turns into 'Mean Girls.' There are so many entertaining and thought provoking stories inside this one autobiography. Absolutely five stars and it is still haunting me... (It's one book but is in two parts)

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and thought you might find interesting: "Hello, Sunshine" by Laura Dave.  Perhaps the quote in the forefront of this book is the key to the dilemma of Sunshine Mackenzie, the protagonist.  It’s by Groucho Marx: “The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing.  If you can fake that, you’ve got it made.”  Sunny Mackenzie… વધુ wakes up on her 35th birthday to find she has lost her job, her husband and her home due to the ultra-glamourous but fake life she has been leading.  The thing that keeps you turning the pages with interest is how Sunny deals with these cataclysmic events in her life.  While I might not rate this book quite as highly as Dave’s latest novel, "The Last Thing He Told Me," or an earlier one that I loved, "Eight Hundred Grapes," it was definitely readable and held my interest right to the end.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This is my 39th book, for me, it was interesting book, a spirited girl named Baba Schwartz wrote her book called “The May Beetles” was born in Hungary in December 1927, from a warm, and loving Jewish family.… વધુ She did describe every detail about her earlier years within full of innocence and excitement as she remembered, until the Nazis arrived. She lost her father. She, her mother, and her sisters survived the concentration camps and slave labour together. Luckily they escaped from the death march and were liberated by the Russian army.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: This book is an children’s classic and is very uplifting incredibly and interesting because many children/teens have been through so much during the ww2. There's basically no romance in it, and no graphic… વધુ violence. Amazing and heartwarming book all about what it was like for children in Poland. This is a moving story of life during and after the Second World War. THE SILVER SWORD by Ian Serraillier is an unforgettable World War II survival story. Three Polish children were separated from their parents when they were captured by the gestapo. The children quickly matured and learn to take care of themselves. They befriend another young boy Jan that he knows where their father is and they travel together to reunite with their family.

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: What an amazing life, the story I read about Sabina Wolanski who work alongside with Diana Bagnall who help her to write her book called “Destined to live”. She was only 12 years old when Nazi invaded her… વધુ hometown of Boryslaw (at the time of Poland but now with Ukraine boarders). I couldn’t put it down, the written was intriguing, honest story of love, loss and survival. She was one of her whole family to have survived the Holocaust.

After reading the book which needed a good editor, I felt that Tarantino should stick to what he's good… વધુ at-films. My feelings could be generational. I grew up during the time he's talking about and found it repetitive and parts that were screamingly boring. There were some good chapters but not enough of them to rate this any higher than 3 stars.

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: My last four reads for June 2021:

NAME: Janet MacGillivray Manning
CONTENT: I love to read about people, especially the most successful people. I want to learn what they bring to the company. What makes them tick. Jeff Bezos brings it all. He is a creative genius. This book is so… વધુ interesting and worth reading. He's no college drop out. He graduated from Princeton w/degrees in Electrical Engineering and Software Engineering. His first job was on Wall Street. He learned as a broker that data is more important than anything. Even if you don't like Amazon or Bezos this book is so good.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read this book, enjoyed it and thougt I would mention it to you: "The Loveliest Chocolate Shop in Paris" by Jenny Colgan.  If you love Paris, as I do, and relish all things French when it comes to chocolate and wine and food and on and on, then this just might be the perfect light-hearted book for you.  It’s not about any World Wars or other… વધુ times of strife, just a story of an English girl, Anna Trent, who works in a chocolate factory in England, suffers a slightly crippling accident, and when she recovers, is persuaded by her French teacher, Claire, to take a job in a chocolate shop on the Ile de La Cite’ in Paris.  The descriptions of the chocolate shop are enchanting, and Anna… વધુ

NAME: Aditya Singh
CONTENT: Book review: Swift Horses sharp swords by Amit Agarwal Genre: Indian medieval history The book covers the early Indian medieval period from the 7th century till the 13th century in great detail and analyses the… વધુ social, economic, religious, technological and geographical factors of that era and their interplay.  The book has 3 distinct parts. First is about ancient India and its glory. But it's the second part in which author comes into his element and give a detailed narration about the battles. The author does not shy away from pointing out the mistakes committed by Indian warriors too. Especially the battle of Tarain has been detailed in interesting manner. Many times it seemed that we are… વધુ

NAME: John Zenoni
CONTENT: Wow, what a novel! I loved it! ‘The Maidens’ by Alex Michaelides is an amazing, heart-stopping thriller that I could not put down. If you liked his debut novel, ‘The Silent Patient’, wait until you read his… વધુ latest. He is definitely on a roll as far as writing.  ‘The Maidens’ is about Mariana, a therapist who really focuses on group therapy, who goes to Cambridge University to be with her niece, Zoe, whose best friend Tara has been found murdered on campus. Mariana not only feels responsible for Zoe, and adores her, but needs a change of scenery as she is still suffering from the loss of her husband in an accidental drowning while on a trip to Greece.  I don’t want to give too much away but… વધુ

The first one is about a hitman assassin in like the 1800s may have magic (can't remember) but the book is gory and has very strong adult language. My bet is the book would be rated R lol. I REALLY want to read this book! I don't know the name or author! The second I read in grade school, I… વધુ always thought it was called "The Green Book" it was about Earth was about to die or the sun was. They sent all these people on ships to another planet and I think it took hundreds of years but they finally found a place. The grass was like glass shards. It was from a little girls point of view. I have been searching high and low for this book. I won a national young writers contest and got to read my writing on the local news. We had to write one of a few different prompts, I choose the prompt; write a story about you being sucked into your favorite book. I wrote it based on the book I'm looking for. If anyone can please help I'd be forever grateful!!

Second reading and I was just as… વધુ captivated as the first time. Unusual concept, beautiful writing, great characters. The voice of Context is your reliable narrator who assured us that all will be made clear in the end. And it is. Everything in a circle. Very clever.   3. The Magus of Hay - Phil Rickman. No. 12 in the Merrily Watkins series. Merrily is a female priest and… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: I’ve read 3 books about the Horowitz family, the first were “The Keeper of secret”, second was “Rachel’s Legacy” and lastly is “Levi’s War” by Julie Thomas. I am sad that I have read all of those three books.… વધુ They were truly impressively splendid, I couldn’t put down. I loved how the author Julie brings a heart-rending story of love, loyalty and family during ww2. Love the story and characters.  The experiences that the main character had were extraordinary difficult. During the World War Two was very painful for so many people and in so many countries. The last book I just have finished reading about oldest brother Levi. His war story.  It is set in the past and present day. He was a Jewish… વધુ

NAME: Carolyn Scarcella
CONTENT: What an interesting 9 decade of life I read a book called “The testimony” by Halina Wagowski. She tells her story life, for those of us not living through the Holocaust needs to read this incredible book and… વધુ never let it happen again. She lived through the horrors through ghetto then deported to Auschwitz-Birkenau and Stutthof. She lost her family and moved to Melbourne alone at the age of 18, working and studying to support herself. She also found time to help others, from homeless teenagers to asylum seekers, to bushfire victims.

But that is the question throughout the novel -what was he seeing or did he really see anything at all? Cha Cha and his brothers and sisters all have to deal with various things in life, including the truth about their father, accepting their mother’s illness, and possible loss of their home place, The Turner… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I'd like to recommend to you: "Mistress of the Ritz" by Melanie Benjamin.  Another novel of World War II.  Another historical novel.  You might say, oh, no, not again!  But maybe not in this case because Melanie Benjamin has written a very human story about the Nazi occupation of France during the Second World War, and it all takes… વધુ place at the elegant Ritz Hotel in Paris.  Blanche, the protagonist, is a beautiful blond American woman who aspires to be a movie actress and travels to Europe with a friend and her current lover on the promise of a movie to be filmed in Egypt.  On their stopover in Paris, Blanche meets Claude Auzello, a suave Frenchman, the assistant manager of the… વધુ

I want to tell you about each story in detail but I can't do it justice. These stories linger, rolling around my brain, hugging my heart.  5/5

NAME: John Zenoni
CONTENT: Ok, if I could rate this novel a little bit higher I would - 3.5 stars out of 5 versus 3 - as it is an entertaining read. The only reason I am not rating it a 4 or above is because not ALL of the stories within… વધુ this collection are entertaining. Some of the stories are just strange and made no sense to me.  ‘Where the Wild Ladies Are’ by Aoko Matsuda is a collection of ghost stories that's spooky, original and definitely feminist as all of the men are immensely frowned upon for their behavior in real life. It seems that the women in this novel who are now ghosts all have had some bad experiences and those are shared throughout the novel.  There are some really great (and spooky) stories and some that are just odd and I myself did not get the meaning. Perhaps, being a man, that is to be expected? I don’t know, but I will say that this is an original novel and a pretty fast and easy read. It is also interesting to note that all the stories are based, loosely, on traditional Japanese stories of yōkai, ghosts and monsters that figure prominently in the country's folklore.

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: June Reads My books for June:   1. Hamnet - Maggie O’Farrell. This is my 2nd time of reading this and I found it just as poetic and moving as I did the first time. Maggie O’Farrell paints her scenes with deft strokes of her pen. The story is beautifully told and, in my view, a masterpiece.   2. Alice Adams - Booth Tarkington. The 4th in the… વધુ Pulitzer prize winners which I am reading my way through. This one won the prize in 1922 and is the second winner by this author. A cautionary tale is the best way to describe it.   3. The Magdalen Prophecy: The Quickening - Shams-Tabriz. Great adventure with a strong female protagonist. I was just a bit baffled by the ending - but none of the other… વધુ

CONTENT: Finished reading the book "Man's Search for Meaning" by Victor E Frankl  . My Review: Average/Good/Excellent: GOOD Marks: 7/10 The first half of the book is very boring and at times it becomes difficult to… વધુ continue reading. But the second half is meaningful. It is a non-fiction hence search for a good storytelling is wortless here.This book is basically for any person who lacks meaning in his life, who thinks this is the end and loses all his hope. The writer viktor E. Frankl was a prisoner in concentration camp of Auschwitz during The second world war. He outlined the darkest events in human history. Dr. Frankl was an author-psychiatrist, he explains the experience which led to his… વધુ

NAME: Janet MacGillivray Manning
CONTENT: This story picks up where the Henna Artist  left off-12 years later. A new generation has come of age. The book has intrigue, love, deceit and forgiveness. Oh and let's not forget the wondrous country of India… વધુ where it all takes place. A wonderful mix. Many of the same main characters from The Henna Artist are in this book. This is Book 2 of a trilogy. I really enjoyed it!

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: There's a lot packed into one story. The author definitely wanted us to get a sense of what issues were facing Native peoples in this time period. Sometimes I was sad, disgusted, angry and other times I was… વધુ laughing. I learned a lot too. It would be interesting to read The Orenda by Joseph Boyden juxtaposed to this novel to discuss as a book club. We can't change what's happened but we most certainly should learn from it. I'd be so bold as to suggest this be required reading.  4.5/5

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just finished and wanted to suggest to you all: "The Magician" by Colm Toibin.  Another piece of historical fiction, this book is a fictional biography of the prolific German author, Thomas Mann.  Among Mann’s most well-known books are "Buddenbrooks"  and "The Magic Mountain," for which he was awarded the Nobel prize in literature… વધુ in 1929, and "Death in Venice."  Mann was born in 1875 in Lubeck, Germany.  He began his writing career as a young man, publishing his first short story in 1898.  This book covers most of Thomas Mann’s eighty years, and features his family life from the time he marries his remarkable wife, Katia, through the births of their six children, and the… વધુ

It definitely makes you wonder what you would do if given the chance to go back in time or to the future. That is what the few people we are introduced to in this story have a chance to do and, of course, each does take part in this time travel, for different reasons with different outcomes. The only issue is there are restrictions around what you can or cannot do when you make that choice and yet those in the… વધુ

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: Never in a hundred years would I have picked this book for myself. It's just not a genre I would have thought I'd enjoy. Pleasantly surprised is an understatement. When I first started reading it I was… વધુ picturing in my head The Invincibles. Literally. And I was wondering if maybe I was just too old for some of the humour but it was a fun and lively story pace with snappy dialogue and I wanted to know what happens next. As the story progressed I was completely picturing this as a movie and I wanted to call Ryan Reynolds but he doesn't know me so it's unlikely we'd get to chat about it ;-) I totally enjoyed this story. Lots of action and great characters. Could there be a sequel coming? I'm totally down for that! And although I can't act I'd love a role if this does become a movie (in case anyone is listening).  This isn't just an anti-superhero story. It's about women in the workplace, office politics today and rage/revenge all handled with wit and a very observant eye.  To add context - I am a "mature" (aka older) Gen X and this book was written by a Millennial.  4.5-5/5

Le Sommet has always been a sinister's place the former abandoned sanatorium has now been renovated into a five-star hotel. Elin a police officer for the uk. I need but her brothers throwing engagement to Laure and she has free time on her hands she can't say no, but when they arrive a huge threatening snow storm takes on a life of its own well in the mist finding out Laure is missing, she is under pressure to find what has happened to her at the same time not understanding that someone else another woman has gone missing see what happens in this amazing book from start to finish. A great summer read as well #thesanatorium #sarahpearse #summerreading2021 #reesesbookclub

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just finished another book I'd like to recommend:This Tender Land by William Kent Krueger.  OMG I loved this book!  What a story of two orphaned brothers in 1932 during the Depression, placed in a school for Native American orphans in Minnesota because there was no other place to put two orphan boys at that time.  From canoeing down the Minnesota… વધુ River, to the homeless villages along the way, to riding the rails in empty boxcars, it reminded me of my childhood reading of Tom Sawyer, Huckleberry Finn and Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm.  The story is gripping and the telling of it is extraordinary.  If you have not already read this book, you are in for an adventure in middle America in the early 1930’s.

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: I could barely put it down and when I had to do other things I kept thinking about this story. The sordid colonization of Australia. The treatment of the aboriginal people. The treatment of prisoners,… વધુ especially women prisoners of petty and made up crimes. The prison conditions, the ship crossing and the jails on the other side. A story that makes you truly listen to the herstory of women who are born with no noble titles, and not just poverty stricken born. No rights. And it's not entirely a bummer book, some survive and rise and build a life. And so we are here. And so we are here.  4.5/5 for me

NAME: John Zenoni
CONTENT: What a wonderful, charming novel! I really did not expect to like it as much as I did because I feared the storyline was going to be predictable based on the overview but it really had unexpected twists and… વધુ turns which surprised me. I also loved all the primary characters as they were fun to get to know. Holly, the smart, logical thinking one with the stern demeanor (only to find out she does have a heart), Katie, the sweet, calm one that everyone loves (the reason for the road trip that takes place in the story), Summer, the kooky, crazy, celebrity who is just endearing and has an answer for everything and finally, Samantha, the real star of the novel in my opinion, who is so good hearted and has so many wonderful qualities.  The road trip is one that deals with many emotions - anger, truths, sadness, love and more. It is an engrossing time with these ladies and I can see this being made into a movie. The ending is just perfect in my opinion.  I definitely recommend this one and I would not mind reading about them again!

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: Engaging story that flows well. Throughout the story I tried to think back to myself in my young 20s and there's a lot that's relatable. I thought I was adulting and I was out on my own with a career and… વધુ accomplishing much BUT was I naïve? Yes, looking back, I think so. Could I have been manipulated by an older man I was deeply attracted to? Yes, most likely. As mature as I thought I was, there were many life lessons to come that would season me.  Brooke annoyed the shit out of me but it's because I wanted her to see things as they were. And that's not what this story was about. It was about her journey. And I'm grateful Kerry Clare shared her telling of this. Honestly, there's so many young women who fall into the trap and the issues that surround it and how we still haven't resolved it. 3.5/5

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: This book. This wonderful book. This wonderful, mind-bender of a book had me on page one. I decided to step out of my lane and try Science Fiction/Techo Thriller. It starts with a plague of FMS, “False Memory… વધુ Syndrome”. As one of the main protagonists, NYPD cop Barry Sutton is called to the scene of an impending suicide who suddenly remembers a totally different life than the one she is living. This FMS seems to be becoming of a plague and the number of suicides is rapidly rising. The novel explodes forward from there. The other principle, Helena Smith, is a neuroscientist who recreates technology that has the power to change time and reality, giving people the ability to go back and re-do parts of their lives. Time travel and memory are the major themes; but one of the core aspects of the book is Barry and Helena’s love story. Falling in love makes the stakes of them saving the world even greater. This book is the inspiration for Shondaland’s upcoming Netflix film.

CONTENT: Here's a book I just finished reading and want to recommend: "Eight Hundred Grapes" by Laura Dave.  I couldn’t put this book down.  This is the second book I’ve read by Laura Dave, and I’ve put all of her books on my “to be read” list because she’s definitely got a “way with words.”  This story takes place in Sonoma County, California, and is about… વધુ a winemaker and his family.  I loved the way the author based the story on the word “synchronization” - both as it relates to the art of winemaking and as it relates to building a life with the one you love.  This even flows through to “desynchronization” – times when everything in one’s love life goes wrong as well as to unforeseeable events such… વધુ

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: I finished The Girl from the Channel Islands by Jenny Lecoat. It is a true , gripping, suspenseful story of survival  and coping during WWII when the Germans occupied the Channel  Islands. Half Life by Jillian… વધુ Cantor is my next read. According to the synopsis on the back of the book, the story is woven around important choices  that Marie Curie faced when she was a young girl. Should Marie marry the man who captured her heart but of whom her parents do not approve, or should she refuse her feelings and leave her home as a single woman to  study chemistry at the Sorbonne  in Paris?

NAME: Sharon Manthe
CONTENT: I have never been more excited to leave a book review than I am for this one!  ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ WOW! This is a wonderful book! Very well-written and I found myself reading and saying "YES! YES!" to so many important… વધુ truths and realizations that I've felt at one point or another, but just couldn't find the words. They’re here, laid out for us in this book! I enjoyed reading about the connections our mind has to our bodies, and how we can have more control over some of our systems than we think. The thoughts and ideas are described so clearly and matter-of-fact and I enjoyed the logical explanations and examples for self-improvement, and self-acceptance. It’s comforting to know that several of my… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I think you will enjoy reading: "These Tangled Vines" by Julianne Maclean.  If you love Tuscany and Italian wine with a little romance thrown in, this might just be the book for you.  The story is told in two different storylines, one by Lillian Bell in 1986 and the other by her daughter, Fiona Bell, in 2017.  You will love the… વધુ descriptions of Tuscany and the wines made at the Maurizio Winery.  You may even fall a little in love with Anton, the dashing Italian winemaker at Maurizio, who hires Lillian as a guide for American tourists visiting the winery.  There’s a little mystery, a little romance, some sibling rivalry, all combining to make a very enjoyable reading experience.

NAME: Peggy Royer Parisi
CONTENT: Just finished listening to "Jackie's Girl" by Kathy McKeon. Interesting to hear the perspective of a young lady from a poor Irish family who was brought to America to work and ended up landing a position… વધુ supporting Mrs. Kennedy and caring for Caroline and John. How vastly different were the backgrounds of the Kennedys and this Irish girl.  Kathy ended up working for Mrs. Kennedy for over 10 years.  The book includes many insights into their day-to-day activities.   I enjoyed and recommend the audio version.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just read and want to recommend: "Have You Seen Luis Velez?" by Catherine Ryan Hyde.  Raymond is a teenage boy who is falling through the cracks.  His parents divorced so now he lives with his mother and his stepfather and three younger half-sisters, and spends every other weekend with his father whose wife leaves when Raymond… વધુ arrives.  At school he has no friends.  He feeds a stray cat and feels like a loser.  One day a blind woman who lives in his building cautiously asks him “Have you see Luis Velez?”  I really found this to be a profound story in that Raymond, who is shy but an excellent student and a very smart young man, takes on the responsibility of walking Millie, his blind elderly neighbor, to the bank and the store, and attempts to find out what happened to her friend, Luis Velez, who kindly took Millie under his wing in the same manner until he suddenly stopped coming around. This is not a long or complicated story, but one that will tug at your heartstrings and give you faith in the resiliency of the human spirit.

NAME: Barbara Crompton
CONTENT: Here is my rundown of my reads for May:  1. The Return - Victoria Hislop. This was our book group read this month. I’ve read it before but enjoyed it just as much second time around. It’s based in southern Spain where I live, so those books always appeal. Most of the group thought there were just too many coincidences and that the means of telling… વધુ the story was just too improbable. They are right - but it didn’t matter to me. I just enjoyed the story.   2. Emily of New Moon - LM Montgomery. This was my classic book group choice. Not one I would have chosen to read but, guess what - I loved it. I will probably read the 2 sequels as well. A little sweet treat.   3. Pale Rider - Laura Spinney.… વધુ

NAME: Angela Vanderburg
CONTENT: First Kristin Harmel book for me and it won't be my last. Thoroughly enjoyed this story from start to finish. Set in France in World War II. It runs the gambit of characters and each is real and complicated and… વધુ messy and human. There's was suspense, intensity, sadness, anger, despair, love and fear. And the ending made my heart sing. 4/5

NAME: Peggy Royer Parisi
CONTENT: Just finished "The Widow Clicquot" by Tilar J Mazzeo.  Enjoyed learning about the history of Champagne and the story of this brave, ambitious, and independent woman who revolutionized an industry.   She was… વધુ human, not perfect.  She was a daughter, wife, mother, grandmother, and great-grandmother who led an international company in a time when women did not hold such roles.  The author kept me engaged and wanting to learn more.
