NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I just finished and enjoyed very much: "The Girl from Berlin' by Ronald H. Balson.   This is an excellent historical novel about an aspect of World War II that I had not heard a lot about.  In the 1930’s in Germany and all over Europe, all the large cities had professional orchestras and employed many Jewish musical prodigies.  When… વધુ the Nazis starting purging the Jewish population, many of these musicians were spared in the interest of preserving the integrity of the orchestras’ performances.  Ada Baumgarten was one of these prodigies.  Her father was concertmaster of the Berlin Philharmonic, and he taught Ada to play the violin, at which she excelled as a student, as well as a… વધુ

You can browse Amazon and Goodreads and find out instantly if your library has the book. 📕📗📘📙 *and don't forget, you can always ask your library to buy books they don't have. NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Here's a book I recently read and want to recommend: "Look Again" by Lisa Scottoline.  I just read this for my book club’s May selection.  It had me on the edge of my seat a lot of the way through the book, laughing and crying and hoping and praying that everything would turn out all right.  Lisa Scottoline has a way with words that will not… વધુ disappoint you.  Ellen Gleeson is the mother of a three-year-old adopted son, Will.  She’s a newspaper features reporter and one day happens to see a flyer entitled “Have You Seen This Child?” with a photo of a boy whose resemblance to Will is startling.  Ellen feels compelled to look into the situation and the story takes off from there.  You’ll be rooting for Ellen and Will throughout the book.  And believe me, the going gets pretty rough before the final resolution is reached.  I heartily recommend this book, even though I’m not going to give you a synopsis of what happens.  You’ll have to read it to find out for yourself.

NAME: Patty Smith
CONTENT: Suggestions for a good summer read for a book club.  TIA!

NAME: Cathy Oswald
CONTENT: I just finished Rachel Caine’s The Great Library series (5 books) that posits a world in which the library of Alexandria wasn’t destroyed and instead became a ruling power, preserving and controlling access to all the knowledge in the world. It is fantastic, and I highly recommend it! The first book is Ink and Bone.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: Our book club got together for a “Girl’s Night on the Porch” and we made recipes from Jake Cohen’s “Jew-ish” cookbook which we received from “The Book Club Cookbook Monthly Book Giveaway”. Jake reinvents the… વધુ food of his Ashkenazi heritage and draws inspiration from his husband’s Persian-Iraqi traditions. “Jew-ish” is a brilliant collection of delicious, easy-to-follow everyday and holiday recipes that are both traditional and with a little modern twist. While turning the pages of this cookbook, you will be inspired to try the fabulous recipes as each is accompanied by a beautiful photo and delightful backstory. I highly recommend adding this book to your collection! Menu: Just-Add-Sour-Cream Caramalized Onion Dip Tomato-Cucumber Salad Kale Tabbouleh Salad Cardamom-Spiced Pear Noodle Kugel Beef-Stuffed Eggplant

CONTENT: So I finished my Disney villains book series and am looking for book recommendations? Has anyone read any good books lately?

CONTENT: Just finished “In Five Years” absolutely loved it! Has anyone else read it? 📚 ❤️

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: Suzanne Redfearn  writes an engaging comparison study of ordinary life and life after a catastrophe.She writes beautifully and with insight. “Impossible choices are made”, along with “split second decisions” in… વધુ the aftermath of the cataclysmic event that fuels the plot. I became deeply involved with each character, so much so that I lost track of the fact that the characters only live in the world of fiction!

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just finished reading this book, and can highly recommend it: "The Forgotten Room" by Karen White, Beatriz Williams and Lauren Willig.  This is an intriguing book written by three separate authors about three separate main characters taking place in three time periods, the first being 1892-1893, the second 1920, and the third 1944.  The women… વધુ protagonists are all related to each other, and each has a love affair that would have been considered ill-advised at best during each time period.  Actually in my own mind the star of the story is the house in which it all takes place – a Gilded Age mansion built in 1891 for the Pratt family in Manhattan’s Upper East Side with an unbelievably beautiful attic room at the very top of the mansion with a domed glass ceiling and beautiful glass walls affording an exceptional view of Manhattan.  This is a book to savor, and I enjoyed every moment of reading it.  I hope you will enjoy it as well.

NAME: Brianne Benford
CONTENT: Currently reading this book & it has me laughing out loud it’s so funny. 😂 The author Jen Spyra is a former staff writer for The Stephen Colbert Show & “The Onion” & as you can probably guess that means her… વધુ writing is skewed towards being a little bit disturbing, a whole lot of weird, & super hilarious. Won’t be for everyone but if you like short stories that are at times darkly funny, this one might be for you.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: Falling by T.J. Newman Torri Newman uses her years as a flight attendant to create an authentic and terrifying thriller about a pilot whose wife and two young children have been kidnapped.  If he wants them to… વધુ live, he must crash a plane carrying 144 passengers, killing everyone on board.  This amazing debut novel ratchets up the tension with twist after heart-stopping twist and is guaranteed to leave you breathless.  Pub Date:  7/6/21 Many thanks to Simon & Schuster for the advance review copy.  #simonandschuster

CONTENT: I just finished reading The Humans by Matt Haig. I walked away from this book for a few days. I even said to my husband, "I don't get why this book is so highly rated..." and "did you like it (add incredulous tone)?" But then it happened. I fell in love. The sentiment, the language, the insights - I craved to hear more, to learn more and to love more.  And the "Rules" - they were their own form of poetry. A true love letter.  I hope I can continue to see the world JUST LIKE THIS.

His family is a young, overwhelmed mother; a hardworking father from a huge Italian family well known for its unusual relationship with the law; and two grandfathers who both influenced… વધુ

CONTENT: What an amazing read! I’ve never heard of this author but he is good. Now I need to look up his other books. Will Leitch is very good at pulling the reader into the story and getting you to feel all of the… વધુ characters of the story. My heart ached for Daniel’s mother when the doctor told her that her son had SMA. I hated the doctor’s ways of breaking the news to her. I loved the relationship between Daniel and Travis, an amazing friendship that one could only imagine. I loved how the author set up the ‘chase’ scene at the beginning of the story and had you on the edge of your seat waiting for it. This would make a great movie! Thank you #goodreads and #willleitch for this ARC. It was amazing.

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: Thank you @ simonandschuster and @BookClubFavorites for the free book.  I just finished reading it and want to give you my take: "Falling" by T. J. Newman. I just read an Advanced Reader’s Edition of this book which will be published on July 6, 2021.  Talk about a gripping story!  The author of this book was a full-time flight attendant for almost… વધુ 20 years as well as an aspiring author.  Here’s the scenario:  You’re a commercial pilot for a large airline.  What would you do if, during a flight, terrorists kidnapped your wife and children and told you that if you did not crash the plane, your family would be killed?  Needless to say, there’s not a dull moment when you’re reading this one!  I urge you to read it as soon as it comes out this summer!

NAME: Susan Goldstein
CONTENT: I just finished The Secret Diary of Hendrick Groen, a day by day telling of one year in the life of an 83 year-old man in a retirement home in the Netherlands. It's a delightful tale of aging, friendship, and even heartbreak. I am extremely jealous of the "Old But Not Dead" club the central characters form. They have great fun together. It was… વધુ published anonymously, but "in April 2016, NRC Handelsblad revealed Peter de Smet, a 61-year-old librarian with no previous published written work, as the book's author." HIGHLY recommended, especially for older readers (with a sense of humor).

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: The Bird King is  a fantasy story set in 1491 during the reign of the last Sultan on the Iberian peninsula.One of the main characters has a magical power: he can transport himself and others to far off,… વધુ mystical places  merely by making a map of the location. His talent is useful to the Sultan and a form of play for the Mapmaker and his friend , one of the women in the Sultan’s harem. Everything is peaceful in the Sultan’s royal court until a delegation from Spain arrives with the intent of conquering the Sultan’s kingdom and submitting the Sultan and all in his kingdom to the Inquisition. The solution to the problem of the conquering Spaniards and the Inquisition takes the mapmaker and his… વધુ

NAME: Nancy A Bekofske
CONTENT: Don't let the pretty pastel cover art fool you into thinking That Summer is a lightweight read. Jennifer Weiner's latest novel delves into the #MeToo movement, showing how toxic masculine culture impels… વધુ conformist behavior that ruins women's lives. Her protagonist, Diana, struggles with how to hold her rapist and his friends accountable. Understanding how young men make bad decisions does not exonerate them.  Weiner's portrayal of a teenage girl destroyed by someone she trusted and cared for, and her long path to recover her derailed life, is a page turner. Diana decided on a plan of revenge, assuming a fake identity to infiltrate her rapist's family. But nothing turns out the way she… વધુ

NAME: Dawn Williams
CONTENT: Someone in this group recommended this novel. I don't remember your name, but I wanted to thank you! I absolutely loved it! The book starts dark with Jack mourning the death of his wife. The chapter of him… વધુ going home after the funeral felt so personal heart-wrenching. After that it's an adventure of romance, action, betrayal, love, forgiveness...the book truly captions the essence of unconditional love and life. I finished it in two days. I was hooked. I couldn't put it down!! This will be a best seller and I'm just glad I found it before it got famous. 😍 I now want to go to Italy!!! 😂🥰 I ordered mine on Amazon. Came in two days.

NAME: Pam Erickson Gardow
CONTENT: At the height of the cold war, an American diplomat defects to Russia with his wife, Iris, and their children. Four years later, Iris sends a postcard to her twin sister in New York begging for help. Prepare… વધુ yourself for mind-blowing twists and turns, unbearable suspense, and most likely a sleepless night. Our Woman in Moscow by Beatriz Williams plummets the reader into an unputdownable novel of Cold War spycraft, amazing, rich characters, and pulse-pounding action. Kudos to Nicola Barber and Cassandra Campbell for brilliant audio narration! Absolutely incredible! Thanks to #harpercollinspublishers for an advance copy of the audiobook!  Due out June 1.

NAME: Debbie Szymanski
CONTENT: I didn’t mind the past few rainy days; in fact, I welcomed it - I hunkered down with “You Are Not Alone” by Greer Hendricks & Sarah Pekkanen. This book was an unputdownable psychological thrill ride! I received… વધુ this book from The Book Club Cookbook monthly book giveaways.  Book Club Menu: Hummus Veggie Plate and Moscow Mule Shay Miller is a quiet, analytical young women who is down on her luck. She recently lost her market research job and is taking less than thrilling temp jobs in order to pay her bills. She harbors a secret crush on her roommate, Sean - who has a girlfriend and they want to live together so Shay has to find a new place to live. To top it all off, she witnesses a young… વધુ

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just read a book you might like: "Mrs. Everything" by Jennifer Weiner.  This story covers a lot of territory, starting with the simple Midwestern family living in Detroit in the 1950’s with two daughters, Jo, who is an athletic tomboy, and Bethie, a pretty, feminine girl who loves to sing and stars in school plays and musicals.  Jo discovers that… વધુ she likes girls more than boys, and that is not acceptable behavior in the 1950’s.  Both girls end up going down different paths – Jo marries a respectable businessman and becomes a housewife and mother of three girls.  Bethie gets involved with drugs and communes, and lurches down a completely different road in life.  The time period of the book spans six decades, and presents an interesting look at how the characters evolve through the years.

CONTENT: So I had to find out what all the fuss was about with ‘The Midnight Library’ by Matt Haig and I am so glad I read it. Wow! This is one of those novels where I had to stop and either highlight sections or copy… વધુ some of the quotes from it. The first thing I loved about it is the very interesting storyline that pulled me in from the get go. I don’t want to give anything away but once you learn what The Midnight Library actually is I think you will understand what I mean. It is original but not so quirky that you cannot keep up with the story or characters that are introduced (not to go off on another tangent but this is what happened with ‘The 7 1/2 Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle - I was so in… વધુ

CONTENT: 3️⃣📚 in April My month was full of 4 🌟 reads!  I final read my first Stephen King novel. It isn’t your typical SK story. This one deals with time travel and the butterfly effect. Hulu has a limited series… વધુ starring James Franco. I’ve only seen 3 episodes and can tell they cut a lot of details out. #typical to say the book is better!  Read my first Sci-Fi book in a really long time. It’s being turned into a movie. Can’t wait to see it!  I finally finished TBT. It was wonderfully tragic. Saw the movie and although it was a great adaptation, book was better.  🎧 11.22.63 by Stephen King 🧵 🧵 🧵 🧵  🎧 Dark Matter by Blake Crouch🤯🤯🤯🤯 📖 The Book Thief by Markus Zusak 👧🏼👧🏼👧🏼👧🏼 Legend:  📖=physical book (hardcover or paperback) 💻=kindle  🎧=audible 5️⃣WOW! This book spoke/related to me on some level. I was thoroughly entertained. 4️⃣ I really liked this book a lot. 3️⃣ It was decent/ok. Some good content but something was lacking. 2️⃣Disappointing. 1️⃣Not a fan at all. #books #reading #april2021reads

NAME: Pankaj Kishore
CONTENT: Whereabouts by Jhumpa Lahiri: I bought this book because I liked Jhumpa Lahiri’s other works. I am halfway through and am losing interest. Has anyone read it and has any comments about it? The author has won a… વધુ Pulitzer prize and that is reflected in her beautiful writing style. The story is a vivid description of the narrator’s lonely life in a city in Italy. It started off quite well, and liked it as I could relate to some of the incidents she described. The story is now turning out to be a meandering and plotless commentary. It is beginning to sound like a psychology book or a thesaurus/encyclopedia of difficult human connections – no connections, broken connections, and superficial connections strung together by an annoyed and acrid narrative.  I am wondering if the story will get more interesting in the second half.

NAME: Melissa Leedom
CONTENT: I have just finished reading 365 Ways to Love Your Child by Julie Lavender. This book is wonderful. My boys are grown, so reading all these marvelous, creative ideas really made me miss my time with my own… વધુ children.  But it occurred to me that many of the ideas in this book would be great for grandparents - I envisioned myself doing some of these things with my granddaughter. “Cool” aunts and uncles, those who volunteer as Big Brothers and Sisters - even day/child care centers and elementary school teachers - could use many of the activities in this book.  Do not be put off, either, that this is a "Christian" book. Even if you don’t want to foster a love for God in your child, this book is a powerful self-esteem-building tool. It will help you give your child the greatest of gift of all: the gift of your time. Melissa Lea Leedom, Author To Forgive, Divine

NAME: Dorinne Dobson
CONTENT: I just finished reading this book and want to recommend it: "The Evening and the Morning" by Ken Follett.  It’s the year 997 C.E., C.E. being an abbreviation for Common Era or Christian Era, or an annual designation for the year after the birth of Jesus Christ when the Christian calendar started counting the years.  It’s also the end of the Dark… વધુ Ages.  So you can imagine that society would be quite different from our current times.  What an understatement that is!  The Vikings are invading England at will.  Most people cannot read or write.  England is divided into shires, each ruled by a different earlderman (which I discern would be “alderman” in modern day parlance).  Ken Follett has… વધુ

NAME: Lisa Christensen
CONTENT: This book tugged at my heart! I knew nothing of the tragedy of the ship Wilhelm Gustloff , a WWII refugee ship. The sinking of this ship is the “deadliest disaster in maritime  history “.(authors notes)More… વધુ people perished  when this ship was torpedoed than in in the total lives lost from the Titanic and Lusitania. The author interviewed many of the survivors whose numbers are few. Reading the personal stories of these survivors was melancholy, yet their stories are incredible. I read this book straight through!
